job.title: SAP Fiori Consultant (34230)
job.description:
Our Ottawa based, public sector client is seeking an experienced SAP Fiori Consultant to implement, customize, and optimize SAP Fiori solutions while providing SOP creation, training, and knowledge transfer. The successful candidate will work closely with business stakeholders to streamline processes, enhance worker productivity, and ensure seamless integration with existing SAP systems. 
Work Model: 100% Onsite –Ottawa, ON
Hours: Monday to Friday, 7.5 hours/day

Key Responsibilities

  • Conduct detailed analysis of existing data systems and business processes

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements and identify process optimization opportunities

  • Develop SOPs, training documentation, and conduct training sessions/workshops

  • Implement SAP Fiori enhancements, ensuring best practices and industry standards are applied

  • Create process flow maps for current and future states with SMEs

  • Monitor system performance metrics and provide optimization recommendations

  • Translate business requirements into technical specifications and project documentation

  • Contribute to project planning, WBS creation, resource allocation, and risk management

Required Skills & Experience

  • 5+ years experience with each of the following:

  • SAP Fiori, SAPUI5, Gateway, OData services, ABAP, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SAP HANA, Power BI

  • Proven experience creating SOPs and delivering end-user training

  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and stakeholder communication skills

  • Experience in business analysis, project management, and process improvement initiatives

    Education & Certifications

  • 4-year university degree in Computer Science, Programming, or equivalent

  • SAP Certified Development Associate – SAP Fiori Application Developer (or equivalent)

  • Accreditation in Business Transformation considered an asset

job.title: NMS Developer (32446)
job.description:
As a Network Management System Developer, you’ll be responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of our network by designing, implementing, testing and maintaining Operational Support Systems (OSS). Your role will be instrumental in optimizing network performance, enhancing efficiency, and ensuring a seamless customer experience.

Main Responsibilities

  • Design network management solutions to monitor and manage Carrier
  • Ethernet and IP services, ensuring optimal capacity, performance and reliability
  • Define configurations and notification data models using YANG
  • Define real-time network monitoring solutions
  • Program network automation with gNMI/gNOI/NETCONF/RESTCONF
  • Design, Develop and maintain automated scripts and tools to verify NMS functionality
  • Work with vendors to implement new OSS/NMS solutions
  • Review and approve design documents, test strategies, plans, and scripts
  • Maintain accurate documentation of OSS/NMS requirements, configurations, processes, and procedures
  • Resolve complex OSS/NMS implementation and network problems with cross-functional teams
  • Enforce security best practices to protect network systems and data integrity

Education and Experience Required

  • Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field
  • 2-5 experience in a similar role.
  • Proficient in Layer 2/3 protocols, YANG modeling, gRPC/gNMI/gNOI
  • Experience designing network management systems using Layer 2/3 protocols
  • Programming skills in modern C++, GNU C, Go, Python 3.x
  • TDD and BDD test frameworks
  • Knowledge of developing software in container hosted in Linux environment and microservices
  • Knowledge of Protobuf, XML, JSON IETF encoding, and template language (Jinja2)
  • Good problem-solving, and communication skills
  • Experience with NMS products like Netcracker Digital OSS, ONAP, Ciena Blue Planet, Amdocs

Knowledge in Protocols and Standards:

  • Layer 3 protocols: IP, OSPF, BGP, MPLS, SR-MPLS
  • Layer 2 protocols: Ethernet, VLAN, STP, LACP
  • MEF and TMF Standards

job.title: IT Technical Analyst – Data Governance & Microsoft Purview (34223)
job.description:
Required Experience Needed:

  • 3–5 years of experience as an IT Technical Analyst

  • 1–3 years of hands-on experience with Microsoft 365

  • 1–3 years of experience working with Microsoft Purview

Core Competencies Required:

  • Technical Proficiency:
    In-depth knowledge of Microsoft Purview, Microsoft 365 workloads, and Azure capabilities, with a strong foundation in cloud-based data governance solutions.

  • Data Governance & Security:
    Solid understanding of data governance frameworks, data lifecycle management, and security best practices to ensure organizational compliance and data integrity.

  • Compliance Expertise:
    Familiarity with data protection regulations and compliance standards such as GDPR, HIPAA, and other regional or industry-specific frameworks.

  • Analytical & Problem-Solving Skills:
    Strong analytical mindset and troubleshooting abilities to address complex governance and data classification challenges.

  • Cross-Functional Collaboration:
    Demonstrated ability to work effectively with diverse teams including data architects, business analysts, and cybersecurity professionals.

  • Automation & Scripting:
    Proficiency with scripting tools such as PowerShell for automating workflows and integrating Purview capabilities across systems.

Nice to Have:

  • Experience with Exact Data Match (EDM) for advanced data classification and protection.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Policy Development & Enforcement:
    Design, implement, and maintain data policies including Data Loss Prevention (DLP), data retention, and sensitive information protection measures.

  • Data Cataloging & Lineage:
    Build and manage a centralized data catalog, define metadata standards, and establish data lineage to promote transparency and data discoverability.

  • Risk & Compliance Monitoring:
    Conduct risk assessments, proactively monitor for compliance violations, and implement remediation strategies leveraging Purview’s capabilities.

  • System Integration:
    Seamlessly integrate Microsoft Purview with Microsoft 365 workloads and other enterprise data sources to enhance governance coverage.

  • Reporting & Insights:
    Generate actionable insights through reports on data usage, compliance status, and governance gaps to support continuous improvement.

job.title: SAP CM/OCM Consultant (S/4HANA) (34250)
job.description:
Our Vancouver based clinet is looking for an experienced SAP Change/Organizational Change Management (CM/OCM) Consultant to support a fast-moving SAP S/4HANA transformation. This is an urgent backfill. You will lead change strategy and execution across stakeholder engagement, communications, training, and adoption—partnering closely with program leadership and functional workstreams.  HYBRID ON SITE VANCOUVER

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead the change management strategy and integrated plan for an S/4HANA program.

  • Drive stakeholder analysis, change impact assessments, and readiness activities.

  • Build and run the communications plan (executive and end-user messaging, artifacts).

  • Define and execute the training strategy (curriculum, delivery approach, enablement).

  • Establish adoption KPIs/OKRs, track readiness, and report progress to leadership/PMO.

  • Stand up and manage the change agent/super-user network; support cutover & hypercare.

  • Coordinate with PMO, SAP functional leads, and business sponsors to align scope, timeline, and risks.

  • Be on-site in Vancouver weekly to facilitate workshops and key change activities.

Required Qualifications

  • Proven experience leading enterprise ERP change/transformation programs, with hands-on SAP S/4HANA exposure.

  • Strong delivery across impact assessments, comms, training, adoption, and readiness.

  • Excellent facilitation, executive communication, and stakeholder management skills.

  • Prosci/ADKAR or equivalent methodology experience (asset).

  • Mining industry experience is an asset.

  • Able to travel to Vancouver weekly; work primarily remote otherwise.

  • Eligible to work in Canada.

job.title: Senior Team Lead Linux Administrator (32447)
job.description:
The HPC Administrator will serve as a Linux Subject Matter Expert (SME), responsible for monitoring, maintaining, troubleshooting, and supporting high-performance computing (HPC) nodes that are critical to our client’s day-to-day operations. The role focuses on ensuring a secure, optimized, and highly available HPC environment, while delivering deep technical expertise and guidance to users and internal teams.

Candidates must be able to work onsite at least 4 days per week.

Key Responsibilities

  • Act as the primary technical expert for Linux-based HPC clusters – ensuring performance, capacity, and availability targets are met.

  • Identify, diagnose, and resolve complex second-level issues for hardware, software, network, VPN, and Linux environments; escalate as needed with full documentation.

  • Manage daily operations of Linux-based HPC environments, including patching, upgrades, security hardening, and configuration of Ubuntu and RedHat systems.

  • Support job submission and workload management using Slurm or OpenHPC, and assist end users in optimizing compute workloads.

  • Migrate existing nodes to Linux, ensuring minimal downtime and performance impact.

  • Implement and manage cluster patching/automation tools such as Foreman (or similar) to streamline operations.

  • Install and configure servers, storage, hypervisors (KVM), and other HPC infrastructure components.

  • Automate administrative tasks to improve operational efficiency.

  • Execute firewall access requests, monitor security alerts, and assist in incident response.

  • Provide second-level support and mentorship to junior technical staff, ensuring knowledge transfer and consistent process execution.

  • Develop, maintain, and publish technical documentation, KB articles, and end-user guides for new systems or upgrades.

  • Participate in on-call rotations, emergency incident response, and occasional after-hours maintenance windows.

Education & Experience

  • Diploma or Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.

  • Minimum 2+ years in IT (with a related University Degree) or 7+ years in IT (with a three-year College Diploma).

  • Enterprise-level Linux expertise (Ubuntu and/or RedHat) is essential.

  • Certifications (e.g., MCSE, CISSP) are strong assets.

Specialized Skills

  • Proven track record as a Linux SME in installation, tuning, and operational support.

  • In-depth experience with HPC clusters and job scheduling tools such as Slurm, LSF, or GridEngine.

  • Strong knowledge of KVM or similar hypervisors.

  • Working understanding of network systems, protocols, and standards including Active Directory integration.

  • Identity management experience (Microsoft Identity Manager, Azure AD Connect).

  • Solid scripting skills (Bash required; additional scripting languages are an asset).

  • Experience applying advanced troubleshooting to resolve performance, configuration, or security issues.

  • Excellent problem-solving, organizational, and documentation skills.

  • Ability to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • Bilingualism (English/French) is an asset.

  • Microsoft Windows knowledge is an asset.

Decision Making & Supervision

  • Operate with minimal supervision while making decisions based on analysis, troubleshooting, and established procedures.

  • Coordinate with helpdesk, networking, platform, and security teams to ensure alignment of upgrades, patches, and operations.

Working Conditions

  • Comfortable office environment with periodic physical tasks (e.g., installing hardware).

  • Requires appropriate security clearance.

  • Must be willing to provide occasional off-hours support and participate in on-call rotation.

job.title: Content Annotation Specialist (34248)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client, based in Wichita, KS, is seeking a Content Annotation Specialist for a hybrid contract position.

Shift Time: 8-5 and 30-40 hours per week

NOTE: W2 Only!

Job Responsibilities:

The position will be utilizing marked up Word documents to analyze changes from prior versions and template version to determine the changes needed to integrate the new version of dynamic forms within an audit "title" for approximately 20 titles. Candidates should be familiar with Word and Excel. Basic understanding of XML is recommended but not required. Must be able to quickly adapt to new systems. High-level attention to detail is a must. Needs ability to produce quality output under tight deadlines. Receive on-the-job training and direction from more experienced staff to ensure requisite learning is achieved and utilized to complete assignments. Business knowledge of auditing is a bonus.


Required Skills/Experience/Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree. 
• Analytical and detail-oriented mindset. 
• Strong organizational skills and proficiency with Microsoft Office 365 suite. 
• Familiarity with content management systems. 
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. 
• Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. 
• Flexibility, responsiveness to change, and a proactive attitude. 
• Able to adhere to production and process standards within a content team.

job.title: Sr. Java Developer (34249)
job.description:
Myticas' direct client, based in Lansing, MI, is seeking a Sr. Java Developer to work on a hybrid schedule (on-site two days per week).

Please NOTE: Accepting local candidates to Michigan that are within 2 hours of Lansing ONLY. Position will be hybrid, in office 2 days a week (Tue/Wed) upon start and there is NO REMOTE ONLY option. 

Top Skills & Years of Experience:
- 10+ years of experience developing complex systems using Java, Spring Boot (3.0), Hibernate/JPA, and JEE technologies, with strong command over design patterns and SDLC practices.
- 5+ years of hands-on experience with Angular, React.js (ES6+), Redux, React Router, and modern JavaScript frameworks for building dynamic user interfaces and prototypes.
- Proficient in SQL, PL/SQL, Oracle, and SQL Server with deep experience in database design, stored procedures, performance tuning, and RESTful/SOAP web services
- 3+ years of experience creating CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps, with exposure to cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and containerized deployments via OpenShift.
- Proven ability to leverage GitHub Copilot for code generation, refactoring, documentation, and embedding Copilot APIs into developer tools to boost productivity and collaboration.

Job Summary:
The position is responsible for providing ongoing maintenance and support of complex Java applications and developing enhancements to OBRA and other vital records MDHHS applications supported within our department. OBRA is a critical system that is used to screen and evaluate individuals’ needs in order to develop a treatment plan. Changes are being made to enhance the stability and functionality of the system. The resource is integral to developing and maintaining MDHHS’ OBRA automated processes, streamlining critical business processes, data integrity, SEM/SUITE compliance, and securing the applications.  The resource also performs as a technical lead and provides technical guidance to the other developers in the department.  As a technical lead, the resource participates in a variety of analytical assignments that provide for the enhancement, integration, maintenance, and implementation of projects.  The resource also provides technical oversight to developers in the team that support other critical applications. Not having a resource on staff will lead to MDHSS manually documenting and developing screen plans that can lead to errors causing data integrity issues and can eventually lead to incorrect information being processed and reporting of patient information.

Position Summary:
• Write well-designed, testable code using spring MVC, Hibernate framework for entity object mapping, JQuery/HTML5, JavaScript, HTML, XML,Angular
• Develop business application components using Object Oriented java/JEE technologies, design principles .
• Design and develop RESTful Web Services using Spring Web MVC framework.
• Design, Develop and maintain applications using Apache Struts framework.
• Ability to implement design patterns like Intercepting Filter, Front Controller, Session Façade, DAO, Singleton, and Service Locator
• Proficient in building and maintaining unit test framework with Junit and Spring Boot.
• Execute full software development life cycle (SDLC) including experience in gathering requirements and writing functional/technical specifications for complex projects.
• Excellent knowledge in designing both logical and physical database model
• Develop database objects including stored procedures, functions,
• Troubleshoots issues using SQL, PL/SQL scripts
• Experience tuning SQL queries and scripts
• Hands on experience Integrating software components into a fully functional software system
• Extensive knowledge on source control tools such as GIT
• Experience on Build Frameworks like  Maven, maintain source code using source control, and baseline software versions and build war files for deployments
• Experience developing with application servers Apache Tomcat, JBOSS, Web Sphere,Openshift Container
• Develop software design documents and work with stakeholders for review and approval.
• Experience developing, prototypes, mockup for users review and approval.
• Experience creating flowcharts, screen layouts and documentation to ensure logical flow of the system requirements
• 2+ years experience with React.js and modern JavaScript (ES6+)
• Strong understanding of Redux, React Router, and component lifecycle
• Experience working on large agile projects.
• Experience with Java 8, SOAP Web-Services and Java Messaging Service (JMS) API.
• Experience with Spring Boot Projects, Spring Data, Spring Batch, Spring Security frameworks.
• Good to have knowledge of Apache Kafka, Apache Spark and ActiveMQ broker.
• Experience in Database Design in Oracle and SQL server.
• Experience or Knowledge on  creating CI/CD pipelines using Azure Devops- Nice to have

Required Skills/Experience:
• 10+ years developing complex computer systems using Java.
• 10+ years developing complex computer systems using java IDEs such as Eclipse,STS
• 8+ years programming using Java JEE Struts Framework
• 10+ years programming in SQL and/or PL/SQL.
• 8+ years programming using Java JEE Spring/SpringBoot Framework 3.0.
• 8+ years of development using Hibernate/JPA framework.
• 5+ years in projects development using  Angular/React JS, JavaScript framework.
• Over 5+ years programming in the JBOSS Enterprise SOA environment including JBOSS Workflow .
• Over 5+ years using CMM/CMMI Level 3 methods and practices.
• Over 5+ years implemented agile development processes including test driven development.
• Over 3+ years Experience or Knowledge on  creating CI/CD pipelines using Azure Devops- Nice to have
• 2+ years experience with React.js and modern JavaScript (ES6+)
• Strong understanding of Redux, React Router, and component lifecycle
• Exposure to DevOps practices and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure)
• Hands-on experience using GitHub Copilot to accelerate daily coding tasks, including code generation, refactoring and documentation.                      
• Proven ability to integrate GitHub Copilot into development workflows to enhance productivity, code quality, and team collaboration.
• Experience embedding GitHub Copilot capabilities into applications or developer tools via GitHub Copilot APIs or extensions.

job.title: Full-Stack Java Developer (34247)
job.description:
Myticas' direct client, based in Lansing, MI, is seeking a Full-Stack Java Developer to work on a hybrid schedule (on-site two days per week, Tuesday/Wednesday).

Please NOTE:

  • Position location: We accept local and non-local candidates willing to relocate at their own expense with no delays. The position will be hyped, and the candidate will be in the office two days a week (Tuesday/Wednesday) upon start. There is no REMOTE ONLY option.
  • Candidate Needs to Provide: 2 Professional references from recent projects.

Top Skills & Years of Experience:

  • This is a full-stack java developer position, exposure with front-end development is highly desired.
  • 7+ years of experience programming complex computer systems using current JAVA, this includes using relevant IDE tools such as Eclipse/Jboss Developer Studio.
  • 4+ years of experience programming with Java 8.
  • 5+ years of experience programming in projects using current Spring framework.
  • 5+ years of experience programming application user interfaces using current Javascript/front-end frameworks, HTML, CSS, including Bootstrap.

Job Summary:

This is a full-stack java developer position, exposure with front-end development is desired. The position will be supporting the Michigan Department of Transportation's (MDOT) Project Development and Maintenance programs.As a software developer, the responsibilities include, but are not limited to, working with the project manager, application owner, and resource manager, working on an agile development team to organize work, develop, test, and deploy code. This position performs a variety of complicated tasks and may report directly to a project lead or manager. This position must have excellent communication and teamwork skills, be self-directed, committed, and a quick learner.

In addition to full-stack development, this position will also work with UI/UX team members in building user interfaces and responsive applications.

Required Skills/Experience:

Core Java & Backend Development

  • 7+ Years of programming complex systems in Java (using Eclipse/JBoss Developer Studio)
  • 5+ Years of Java 8 programming experience
  • 5+ Years of Spring Framework (including Spring Boot, Spring Data)
  • 5+ Years of JPA/Hibernate (ORM frameworks)
  • 5+ Years working in Agile development environments

Frontend Development

  • 5+ Years of JavaScript and modern frontend frameworks
  • 5+ Years of HTML5, CSS, and Data Tables
  • 4+ Years of jQuery & jQuery UI

Database & Reporting

  • 4+ Years of Oracle 12C/19C database programming
  • 5+ Years of SQL/PL/SQL (Desired)
  • 4+ Years of Jasper Reports, Crystal Reports, or Business Objects (Desired)

Additional Technologies

  • 4+ Years of React.js (Desired)
  • 4+ Years in JBOSS Enterprise environment (Desired)
  • 4+ Years with Log4j, JUnit, and Tiles (Desired)
  • 4+ Years of ADA/WCAG 2.0/Section 508 compliance & UX design (Desired)

job.title: Legal Invoice Analyst Initial Reviewer (32444)
job.description:
Location: Hybrid Contract Position | Minneapolis, MN
NOTE: W2 Candidates Only!

Myticas's direct client, based in Minneapolis, MN, is seeking a Legal Invoice Analyst/Initial Reviewer for a hybrid contract position.

Position Overview:

The Legal Invoice Analyst I is responsible for the prompt, accurate, and efficient auditing of electronically submitted legal fee and expense invoices from law firms and vendors. The selected candidate will ensure compliance with billing guidelines by adjusting invoice line items that violate provisions and documenting justifications for those adjustments. The analyst will also provide guidance to business unit partners on issues or opportunities within the Legal Billing Audit process.

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Efficiently and accurately review legal invoice entries.
  • Receive legal invoice assignments from the Operations Support Specialist or self-assign tasks from the intake queue.
  • Verify compliance with legal billing guidelines for submitted invoices.
  • Ensure the accuracy of UTBMS task codes (Fee, Activity, and Expense codes) applied to invoice line items.
  • Document reasons for any adjustments made to invoice line items, specifying the violated billing guideline and rationale for the adjustment amount.
  • Forward audited legal invoices through the appropriate review chain as required.
  • Collaborate with Legal Invoice Analysts and Quality Assurance Analysts.
  • Exercise discretion and sound judgment when making audit and adjustment decisions.
  • Demonstrate a strong understanding of legal terminology and claims-related legal situations, with multijurisdictional exposure preferred.
  • Work independently with minimal supervision after training.
  • Utilize electronic legal bill submission and auditing software efficiently.
  • Organize work to ensure the prompt and efficient review of legal invoices within designated timeframes.
  • Apply basic business math skills and maintain appropriate business telephone etiquette.

Required Skills, Qualifications, and Experience:

Education:

  • Paralegal Certification or a Bachelor's Degree in a legal-related discipline, or equivalent work experience.

Experience:

  • 1-3 years of experience in a legal services or legal auditing environment.
  • Must speak, read and write French--for this opening.
  • Familiarity with legal billing processes.
  • Strong understanding of federal and/or state rules of civil procedure.

Technical Skills:

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
  • Experience with legal billing systems and processes.

Core Competencies:

  • Teamwork: Collaborate effectively with the Legal Billing Audit Center of Excellence (LBACOE) and other business units while providing constructive feedback.
  • Problem Solving: Think independently and make sound decisions. Identify necessary resources to aid in decision-making and take proactive steps to resolve problems.
  • Leadership: Demonstrate personal accountability for day-to-day tasks and collaborate with other business units to achieve results.
  • Planning and Organizing: Prioritize tasks to achieve short- and long-term goals within designated timeframes.
  • Technology: Partner with technology experts to identify gaps and develop impactful solutions.
  • Learning: Adapt to changes in the marketplace and workforce by acquiring or modifying knowledge through study, experience, or instruction.
  • Initiative: Exhibit self-direction and translate ideas into action to achieve results.

job.title: Manager, Business Systems Analyst - Finance Transformation (34246)
job.description:
SC JOHNSON IS A FIFTH-GENERATION FAMILY COMPANY BUILT ON THE SPIRIT OF OUR PEOPLE. We have been leading with purpose for over 130 years, building iconic brands that win the hearts and minds of consumers – such as Raid®, Glade®, Ziploc® and more, in virtually every country around the world. Together, we are creating a better future – for the planet, for future generations and for every SCJ team member. Join our winning team of Wave Makers and Go Getters and help us write the next chapter in the SCJ story.

We are seeking a highly skilled Manager, Business Systems Analyst – Finance Transformation to support our enterprise-wide SAP transformation initiative. This role will act as a key liaison between Finance and IT, translating complex business requirements into scalable SAP solutions. The position reports to the Director, Digital Strategy Transformation & Deliver, Finance and plays a critical role in shaping future-state finance processes. The ideal candidate will possess a deep knowledge of finance processes, SAP configuration, and project lifecycle management. This is a strategic, non-people-management role ideal for a senior-level contributor who thrives in cross-functional environments.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document detailed business requirements, translating them into actionable SAP Finance solutions that support digital transformation.

  • Lead the configuration and optimization of SAP Finance modules, assessing cross-functional impacts and ensuring system integrity to support evolving business needs.

  • Champion data integrity and transparency through seamless integration, migration, and reporting initiatives.

  • Serve as a trusted advisor and change agent, empowering users through training, support, and continuous improvement.

  • Collaborate with SAP Security & Controls to ensure compliance with segregation of duties

job.title: Remote-Drupal / PHP Developer (34242)
job.description:
One of Myticas Consulting's direct clients is seeking a Drupal/PHP Developer for a 100% Remote contract position.

The qualified candidate will help to enhance, upgrade, or develop operational tools and business functionality for the client's web content management, enterprise web search and related systems.

Location: 100% remote with the expectation that the contractor will be on camera for all meetings.

Duration: 10+ months contract

Interview process: A technical assessment will be administered to determine the expertise level of the candidate. The objective of the assessment is to evaluate the problem-solving skills, logical analysis, and technical knowledge of the candidate. 

Requirements:

  • Must be a US Citizen
  • Advanced PHP, JavaScript, HTML/CSS experience
  • Advanced Drupal administration and/or development experience
  • Database development experience with MySQL, SQL Server, or Oracle experience
  • Sharepoint, Enterprise Search (ex. Coveo), and WordPress experience is a plus
  • Ability to produce secure, reliable, and extendable code
  • Able to work both independently and as a contributing member of an Agile Scrum technical team.
  • Able to effectively interact with user organizations to derive system requirements and design solutions.
  • Excellent communication and technical skills.

job.title: Sr Business Systems Consultant/PM (34245)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client is seeking Sr Business Systems Consultant/PM for 5+ Months Contract role at Waukegan, IL (Hybrid-3 days onsite)
 

TOP 5 skills/experience:

  • 5 years of Senior IT project experience: System Lifecycle (SLC) Expertise, Business System Analysis expertise (hands on creation of documentation), vendor management expertise, project management and project financial management experience. 
  • Must have the ability to create / review SLC documents (Sr BSA experience)
  • Track record of successful GXP system implementation including custom development and validated systems. 
  • GXP system experience required, 
  • Clinical experience strongly preferred
  • Methodology used: Waterfall and Agile.

Job Description

One of our Direct clients is looking to add a Seasoned Sr Business Systems Consultant to their team, to support in-flight system development (custom build) and enhancement projects, complete contracting / pre-SLC assessments for new projects, assess new business capability requests and coordinate technical teams to deliver the capabilities. 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Initiate and Plan Project:
  • Collaborate with business and IT management to establish project goals, objectives, financials, and deliverables.
  • Build and manage the project plan, resources, and Gantt charts to accomplish the project scope.
  • Project Control and Quality Management:
  • Evaluate scope changes, issues, and risks, working with stakeholders to resolve them.
  • Measure performance against the original plan and budget, ensuring compliance with corporate and functional policies and procedures.
  • Maintain and update the RAID log to track project risks, actions, and issues.
  • Execute and Close Project:
  • Develop and execute work plans, securing authorized resources to complete all activities.
  • Lead the team in delivering the project scope, gather lessons learned, and obtain final project approval.
  • Assist in managing the process to ensure all validation deliverables are completed.
  • Project Communication:
  • Produce and distribute project reports to provide accurate status and decision support to stakeholders.
  • Make recommendations to resolve issues and manage risks based on the current project status.
  • Resource and Team Management:
  • Coordinate and assign resources to ensure project needs are met, effectively assign tasks based on team members’ abilities.
  • Motivate the project team to achieve desired outcomes.
  • Decisions and Financial Control:
  • Make decisions impacting project-level activities; influence or have authority over the project budget.
  • Develop and manage a financial plan, maintaining spend within +/- 10% of the overall budget.
  • Track and update financials in Clarity, coordinating estimates and invoices with vendors.
  • Vendor Coordination:
  • Coordinate vendor activities and ensure timely milestone delivery.
  • Ensure vendor purchase orders (POs) are processed promptly.
  • Project Meetings:
  • Facilitate Project Management meetings to oversee execution activities with IT System Owner and Principal Business Systems Consultant.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Systems/Computer Science or related discipline.
  • Proven Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word skills are required.
  • Strong Business Systems Analysis experience
  • 5-10 years of experience in Information Technology project management.
  • Experience SLC - System lifecycle, change request.
  • GXP system experience required - GXP system implementation including custom development and validated systems.
  • Portfolio / Program management experience.
  • Clinical Systems
  • Flexibility needed while collaborating with the global project team and vendors (eg 7 AM meetings and /or 4 pm meetings).

Preferred Qualifications:

  • PMP Certification
  • PPM Tool experience
  • Pharmaceutical experience
  • Experience managing projects to deliver or enhance validated systems.

job.title: Part-time Remote Technical Project/Program Manager (34243)
job.description:
Sr IT Project/Program Manager
100% remote
Part time-20 hrs/week
Working hours- 9:30-1:30 pm PST

NOTE:
**Need a seasoned, higher level Program Management Consultant-managing multiple programs/projects.
 
Job Summary 
One of our Direct clients is looking to add a Seasoned Sr Project/Program Management Consultant to their team. 
 
Primary Function:
Develop, execute, and manage multiple IT projects within their defined scope(s). Manage a multitude of interrelated project activities and lead all aspects of the project lifecycle, working with project sponsors/key stakeholders, team members, and management to oversee all phases of project completion. Build and manage project’s work breakdown structure, milestones, risks, issues, and deliverables within the constraints of human and financial resources and changing priorities to ensure the successful completion of the project. Ensure transparent reporting of project status, issues, risks, and financials.
 
Key Responsibilities:
  • Initiate and Plan Project:
  • Build and manage the project plan, resources, and Gantt charts to accomplish the project scope.
  • Collaborate with business and IT management to establish project goals, objectives, financials, and deliverables.
  • Project Control and Quality Management:
  • Maintain and update the RAID log to track project risks, actions, and issues.
  • Measure performance against the original plan and budget, ensuring compliance with corporate and functional policies and procedures.
  • Evaluate scope changes, issues, and risks, working with stakeholders to resolve them.
  • Execute and Close Project:
  • Assist in managing the process to ensure all validation deliverables are completed.

  • Resource and Team Management:

  • Coordinate and assign resources to ensure project needs are met, effectively assign tasks based on team members’ abilities.
  • Decisions and Financial Control:
  • Track and update financials in Clarity, coordinating estimates and invoices with vendors.
  • Develop and manage a financial plan, maintaining spend within +/- 10% of the overall budget.
  • Make decisions impacting project-level activities; influence or have authority over the project budget.
  • Vendor Coordination:
  • Ensure vendor purchase orders (POs) are processed promptly.
  • Coordinate vendor activities and ensure timely milestone delivery.
  • Project Meetings:
  • Facilitate Project Management meetings to oversee execution activities with IT System Owner and Principal Business Systems Consultant.
 
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Systems/Computer Science or related discipline.
  • Proven Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word skills are required.
  • 5-10 years of experience in Information Technology project management.
  • Experience managing SDLC projects.
  • Flexibility needed while collaborating with the global project team and vendors (eg 7 AM meetings and /or 4 pm meetings).
 
Preferred Qualifications:
  • PMP Certification
  • PPM Tool experience
  • Pharmaceutical experience
  • Experience managing projects to deliver or enhance validated systems.
 
Key Stakeholders:
  • Business and Technology resources; varying levels of leadership.

job.title: EDW Sr. Healthcare Technical Analyst (32542)
job.description:
EDW Sr. Healthcare Technical Analyst

Duration: 12 months with possible multi-year extension/s

Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) is are seeking a highly experienced EDW Sr. Healthcare Technical Analyst for a large, direct client in Springfield, IL. 

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Leading, developing, and maintaining a library of technical and business documentation source code and reports.
  • Analyze Medicaid program including claims, eligibility, and provider data supporting data warehouse downstream reporting and analytics.
  • Developing and supporting technical training materials.
  • Modifying existing technical documentation for business needs.
  • Participating in and leading technical and business requirements sessions.
  • Meeting with the project team regularly to consolidate project status and reporting.

  • Mentoring/Coaching other project team members on effective writing skills and strategies for consistency.
  • Performing additional duties that are typically associated with this position, as assigned.

Required Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of healthcare business analysis experience supporting business initiatives through data analysis, writing business requirements and user acceptance testing of various systems.
  • 5+ years of experience serving as a technical analyst in healthcare (payor).
  • 3+ years of experience working specifically with Medicaid programs, MMIS/MES or related systems.
  • 3+ years of experience in knowledge management creating, organizing, sharing, and optimizing knowledge within an enterprise organization using tools such as Microsoft 365, AI-enabled search, MS SharePoint/Teams, and JIRA.
  • Proven ability to lead communication (written and verbal) at the customer leadership level.
  • Knowledge of health insurance, HMO, and managed care principles including Medicaid and Medicare regulation.
  • Ability to interpret federal and state Medicaid policy and translate it into business and technical requirements.
  • Effective organizational, analytical, time management, problem-solving, and multi-tasking skills, and habits; ability to complete assignments under tight deadlines with little/no direct supervision.
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, information systems, Public Health, or a related field

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master’s Degree in related field is preferred.
  • 5+ years of experience as a technical analyst in payor healthcare.
  • 3+ years of experience writing SQL using large-scale database management tools.
  • 3+ years of experience working with State Medicaid and CHIP agencies including federal reporting (CMS 64/21, TMSIS, PERM). Enterprise Data Warehouse - Sr. Healthcare Technical Analyst
  • Knowledge of data integration, software enhancements/planning and agile methodologies
  • Experience with using Azure DevOps, SharePoint, MS Project, Visio

job.title: IT Business Analyst (34146)
job.description:
IT Business Analyst

We are seeking a highly motivated and self-driven individual to work in a complex and thriving global IT environment in support of the Toronto site, one of the largest vaccine research and development and manufacturing sites in the world. This role will report to the Digital Shop Floor Tools Lead and will be supporting all on-site manufacturing IT systems.

 

Location: North York ON (onsite 5 days a week)

Type: Contract

Duration: 12 months, long term contract renews every 1 year

Pay: $40 to $48 per hour CAD; $30-40 USD

 

Skills Required: The candidates must possess the following skills and this experience must be displayed on their resume: These are essential for seamless collaboration across different departments encompassing diverse skillsets and expertise, such as Digital, Operations, Automation, and Quality.  

  • Must have WHMIS certification.
  • Must have a university degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Must have 2-6 years of providing in-person support of physical shop floor hardware/workstations (e.g. printers, scanners, WiFi bridges, ThinClient devices, peripherals) in a manufacturing environment. These systems include the manufacturing execution system, data historian system, interfaces for integrated lab equipment, and related physical hardware/workstations.
  • Must have 2-6 years Business Analyst and support experience with computerized systems such as manufacturing execution systems, data historian systems, automation and control systems.
  • Good understanding of IT Software Development Life Cycle (SLDC) and Project Management Methodologies.
  • Must be able to supply their own PPE. Requires CSA certified steel toe boots. If there is a need to enter a live construction area (as we have projects where the facilities are being renovated) there are additional PPE requirements such as safety helmet, safety glasses, and gloves.
  • The candidate for this role is expected to enter our manufacturing areas from time to time to provide on-the-floor support. As they will be entering live areas they may be exposed to Pertussis, Diphtheria, Tetanus and Flu. They will need to be vaccinated for these to enter those areas.

 

Skills Preferred:

  • Knowledge and awareness of regulatory standards requirements from FDA and Health Canada particularly GXP, 21 CFR Part 11, Electronic Records and Electronic Signatures, Data Integrity Requirements and ALCOA applied to IT Systems would be an asset.
  • Experience with computer systems validation in pharmaceutical industry.
  • Ability to manage relationships with external vendors.

 

As an IT Business Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting on-site manufacturing IT systems from technical troubleshooting perspective as well as systems and process improvement perspective.

  • Natural curiosity and passion for technology, ability to quickly learn manufacturing processes, and strong organizational and time-management skills. 
  • Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities, effective communication skills (technical writing, verbal, and presentation)
  • Self-driven with a passion for taking ownership for their work with the ability to prioritize and execute tasks from initiation to closure and a proven track record of successful independent work and self-sufficiency. 

 

Responsibilities:

  • Take ownership of manufacturing IT system issues from inception to resolution, collaborating closely with users and support teams to troubleshoot and resolve.
  • Escalate and coordinate with local infrastructure team, global support teams and vendor if required to provide timely support and resolution to various system issues.
  • Draft and maintain documentation in alignment with GxP and company processes as required by deviations / change controls, including but not limited to architecture specifications, installation procedures, and detailed specification documents.
  • Provide in-person support of physical shop floor hardware/workstations (e.g. printers, scanners, WiFi bridges, ThinClient devices, peripherals).
  • Participate in on-call support for addressing system emergencies outside of regular business hours.
  • Drive system and process improvements to improve user experience and/or reduce required support and troubleshooting effort.

 

Location/Scope:

  • The job site is in Toronto, ON, Canada. Consistent on-site presence is mandatory for this role to facilitate troubleshooting and relationship management.
  • This role may occasionally require after-hours support availability to address system emergencies as the manufacturing facilities operate on a 24/7 basis. Overtime hours must be agreed with management.
  • Due to the nature of the job (production floor support) up to date vaccination and WHMIS certification is required.

job.title: Sr Program Management Consultant (32608)
job.description:
Sr Project Management Consultant
Location: Waukegan, IL (Hybrid - 3 days onsite)
Company: Myticas's direct client based in Waukegan, IL

Manage a multitude of interrelated project activities and lead all aspects of the project lifecycle, working with project sponsors/key stakeholders, team members, and management to oversee all phases of project completion. Build and manage project’s work breakdown structure, milestones, risks, issues, and deliverables within the constraints of human and financial resources and changing priorities to ensure the successful completion of the project. Key Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with business and IT management to establish project goals, objectives, financials, and deliverables.

  • Measure performance against the original plan and budget, ensuring compliance with corporate and functional policies and procedures.
  • Evaluate scope changes, issues, and risks, working with stakeholders to resolve them.

  • Lead the team in delivering the project scope, gather lessons learned, and obtain final project approval.
  • Develop and execute work plans, securing authorized resources to complete all activities.
  • Project Communication:
  • Make recommendations to resolve issues and manage risks based on the current project status.
  • Produce and distribute project reports to provide accurate status and decision support to stakeholders.
  • Resource and Team Management:
  • Motivate the project team to achieve desired outcomes.
  • Coordinate and assign resources to ensure project needs are met, effectively assign tasks based on team members’ abilities.
  • Decisions and Financial Control:
  • Track and update financials in Clarity, coordinating estimates and invoices with vendors.
  • Develop and manage a financial plan, maintaining spend within +/- 10% of the overall budget.
  • Make decisions impacting project-level activities; influence or have authority over the project budget.
  • Vendor Coordination:
  • Ensure vendor purchase orders (POs) are processed promptly.
  • Coordinate vendor activities and ensure timely milestone delivery.
  • Project Meetings:
  • Facilitate Project Management meetings to oversee execution activities with IT System Owner and Principal Business Systems Consultant.
 
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Systems/Computer Science or related discipline.
  • Proven Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word skills are required.
  • 5-10 years of experience in Information Technology project management.
  • Experience managing SDLC projects.
  • Flexibility needed while collaborating with the global project team and vendors (eg 7 AM meetings and /or 4 pm meetings).
 
Preferred Qualifications:
  • PMP Certification
  • PPM Tool experience
  • Pharmaceutical experience
  • Experience managing projects to deliver or enhance validated systems.
 
Key Stakeholders:
  • Business and Technology resources; varying levels of leadership.

job.title: Project Coordinator (34241)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client is seeking Project Coordinator for 12+ Months Contract role. (Potential of Extension).

IMPORTANT NOTE: Resource will be working a hybrid schedule. NO REMOTE ONLY OPTION. Will need to be onsite from day 1, two days a week. Local candidates only - Candidates must be located within 2 hours of Lansing, MI at time of submission.

Top Skills & Years of Experience:
- Proven ability to assist in coordinating large, cross-functional teams and supporting high-visibility projects with medium to high risk.
- Strong communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills, with experience working alongside Agency Leadership.
- Ability to contribute to both technical delivery and change management efforts within complex environments.
- Experience supporting vendor-managed projects with integrated technical components and a variety of stakeholder groups.

Job Summary:
The client is seeking a skilled and organized Project Coordinator to support the planning and execution of complex, large-scale IT initiatives. This role requires a strong understanding of project management processes, effective coordination skills, and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful project delivery, in alignment with business objectives and enterprise standards.

Key Responsibilities:
-Assist in coordinating one or more large, complex IT projects, typically lasting longer than 6 months, involving 20 or more team members, and requiring regular communication and coordination with stakeholders at various levels.
-Support adherence to client project management methodologies, including SUITE, investment management, and systems engineering methodology.
-Aid in organizing cross-functional teams through all phases of project planning and execution, including the creation of integrated schedules, risk management plans, and budget tracking.
-Track and report on project progress related to scope, quality, schedule, and budget. Highlight any potential issues or risks to senior leadership in a timely manner.
-Assist in planning long-term project milestones and releases to support organizational strategic goals, ensuring alignment with broader enterprise initiatives.
-Collaborate with IT and business stakeholders to understand technical requirements, ensuring project activities align with business needs while adhering to SOM best practices and industry standards.
-Help implement structured change management practices, including supporting stakeholder engagement efforts to ensure the successful adoption of project deliverables.

Change Management and Stakeholder Engagement: This position plays a key role in supporting change adoption by:
-Assisting in integrating change management principles from the start of the project.
-Collaborating with stakeholder engagement teams to develop communication plans, facilitate training sessions, and monitor organizational readiness.
-Supporting stakeholders at all levels to reduce resistance, align expectations, and ensure successful long-term user adoption of new systems and processes.

job.title: Technical Support and Customer Service Associate (32571)
job.description:
Personal Support Center (PSC) Associate – Customer Support - REMOTE

Myticas is actively seeking a Customer Service Associate to join our Personal Support Center (PSC) team. This role is perfect for someone with a passion for helping others, a knack for troubleshooting, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, tech-forward environment.

As a PSC Associate, you’ll be the first point of contact for users via phone, email, and chat—working to resolve technical issues, answer questions, and ensure a seamless customer experience. You'll be supported by extensive training, a detailed knowledge base, and a collaborative team ready to help you grow.

What You’ll Do:

  • Provide Tier 1 technical support for software, hardware, and connectivity issues
  • Assist with password resets, software installations, VPN setups, and general troubleshooting
  • Escalate complex issues to senior team members when needed
  • Maintain clear, professional communication across all customer interactions
  • Simultaneously manage support requests via phone, email, and chat
  • Accurately log cases using tools like ServiceNow and Zendesk

What We’re Looking For:

  • Strong customer service and communication skills
  • Comfort working in a flexible, 24/7/365 support environment
  • Ability to adapt to new tools, systems, and processes quickly
  • Team player who’s open to ongoing feedback, learning, and development

Why Join Us:

  • Hands-on training and mentoring
  • Access to a robust internal knowledge base
  • Opportunities to collaborate with tech experts and leadership
  • A supportive team environment where growth is encouraged

If you're ready to jump into a dynamic support role where no two days are the same, apply now or reach out to learn more. We’re excited to meet you!

job.title: Software Test Analyst (34240)
job.description:
The State of Michigan is looking for: Software Test Analyst 3 - Quality Analyst 
Max Bill Rate: $58.92/hour

Top Skills & Years of Experience: 
- 5 + years’ experience using Selenium, Provar, or other automation testing tools.
- 5 + years’ experience with manual testing.
- Knowledge and experience with Java.
- Excellent communication skills and ability to work within a team environment. 


Will close submissions on: 8/15 at 10:00 am EST.

 Interview Process: Candidates submitted must be willing to come onsite (Lansing, MI) for interviews. A screenshot photo of candidate will be required for any interviews as well as a vendor present at beginning of any MS Teams interview to validate candidate. 
 

  1. Identify test requirements from user stories and acceptance criteria, create detailed test plans and test cases in Azure DevOps (ADO) according to State of Michigan standards (SUITE) and collaborate with stakeholders for review and approval.
  2. Coordinate and analyze feedback from other reviewers. Collaborate and negotiate with the project managers and analyst to create appropriate resolutions. Review all acceptance criteria.
  3. Coordinate with project managers, analysts, and developers to understand requirements and clarify any gaps before testing begins.
  4. Review and approve test artifacts. Identify and automate candidates.
  5. Perform thorough manual testing of web applications, including functional, regression, and integration testing.
  6. Log and track bugs in ADO, coordinate with the development team to ensure timely resolution.
  7. Document all test results, test data, and test evidence in an organized and accessible manner.
  8. Prepare and deliver demos of completed work items, create presentations to communicate testing outcomes to stakeholders.
  9. Investigate and help debug production issues by reviewing logs, test scenarios, and application behavior.
  10. Perform basic API testing using tools like SoapUI and understand API structures such as endpoints, methods, and response formats.
  11. Ability to handle and switch between multiple projects with minimal supervision.
  12. Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies.
  13. Identifying and initiate continuous process improvement.

 

 
Duration: 1 year with possible extension.
Remote or On-site: Accepting local candidates within 2 hours of Lansing, MI ONLY. Position will be hybrid, in office 2 days a week upon start and there is NO REMOTE ONLY option.

job.title: Software Developer, Sr. (.Net, Javascript) (32575)
job.description:
*Based in Canada

*Fully Remote (once per year travel within North America for team event)


Role Overview

We’re seeking a skilled software developer with strong experience in .NET to join a collaborative, distributed team. This position offers the chance to contribute to impactful projects, leverage modern cloud technologies, and work with a range of tools and frameworks in a supportive, growth-oriented environment.

Key Expectations

  • Apply solid software engineering principles and a strong understanding of core programming concepts.

  • Produce clean, efficient, and well-structured code in C#, JavaScript, and related technologies, following established standards and best practices.

  • Learn and adapt to evolving tools and platforms, including cloud services (e.g., Azure), SQL databases, containerization solutions, and front-end frameworks such as Angular.

  • Engage effectively in team discussions (English-speaking environment), providing and receiving constructive feedback.

  • Show initiative in problem-solving while knowing when to seek guidance.

  • Deliver quality work on time while maintaining attention to detail.

Core Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and test software solutions using .NET and related technologies.

  • Participate in code reviews, offering feedback on application logic, database queries, and UI components.

  • Diagnose and resolve issues spanning back-end services, databases, and front-end frameworks.

  • Contribute to technical documentation, including APIs, schemas, and system workflows.

  • Assist in more complex initiatives, such as cloud-based deployments using container technologies.

  • Stay current with development practices and tools, including CI/CD pipelines and containerization platforms.

  • Adhere to established workflows for source control (Git) and deployment processes.

job.title: Microsoft AI & Automation Specialist (34238)
job.description:
We’re seeking a skilled Microsoft AI & Automation Specialist to support a major AI and digital services initiative. This role will focus on leveraging Microsoft Fabric, Power Platform, AI Foundry, and Copilot platforms, developing AI solutions, and integrating large language models (LLMs) with enterprise systems.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide expert-level guidance on Microsoft Fabric, Power Platform, AI Foundry, and Copilot

  • Develop architectural plans and patterns to advance the AI strategy

  • Support Azure and AI deliverables, collaborating with technical SMEs

  • Build solutions in Python and integrate with LLMs and platforms such as SharePoint, Databricks, ServiceNow, and SAP

  • Design and implement integrations with external systems

  • Create technical documentation and user guides

  • Contribute as an AI engineer across the full model lifecycle (training, evaluation, deployment, integration, testing)

Required Skills & Qualifications:

  • Degree or diploma in Computer Science or equivalent experience with AI focus

  • 5+ years recent experience with Azure technologies

  • 5+ years recent Python development experience

  • 1+ year recent experience with LLMs and platforms such as SharePoint, Databricks, ServiceNow, SAP, Power Platform, MS Fabric

  • Proven experience designing, building, and deploying AI deliverables

  • Strong knowledge of model deployment and integration practices

  • Demonstrated experience in technical documentation and user guide creation

Nice-to-Have:

  • Experience with PostgreSQL

job.title: Business Systems Analyst – Payments Modernization (34237)
job.description:
We are seeking an experienced Business Systems Analyst to join a large-scale Payments Modernization initiative. The successful candidate will work within an Agile Scrum team to gather, document, and manage business requirements, translate them into actionable specifications, support testing efforts, and contribute to continuous improvement of processes and systems.
SECRET CLEARANCE - Mandatgory

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate within a Scrum team to convert business requirements into detailed specifications and user stories.

  • Facilitate refinement sessions and ensure development teams fully understand requirements.

  • Write, plan, and execute test scenarios; coordinate and support user acceptance testing.

  • Maintain process, procedure, and training documentation.

  • Analyze and validate solutions for complex business problems.

  • Identify and recommend improvements to business processes and system capabilities.

  • Participate in the Business Analysis Community of Practice to share knowledge and best practices.

  • Provide subject-matter expertise and guidance on relevant projects.

Required Skills & Experience

  • University degree or college diploma in business administration, commerce, computer science, or a related field.

  • Minimum 5 years experience developing business requirements and delivering business systems analysis for large IT-enabled projects.

  • Minimum 3 years experience in an Agile environment as a business analyst.

  • Strong facilitation skills for meetings and workshops.

  • Demonstrated adaptability to change and ability to work with diverse stakeholders while managing multiple priorities.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Knowledge of high-availability banking and payment systems.

  • Professional certifications such as CBAP or CCBA.

job.title: Project Manager (34236)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client is seeking Project Manager for 12+ Months Contract role. (Potential of Extension).

IMPORTANT NOTE: Resource will be working a hybrid schedule. NO REMOTE ONLY OPTION. Will need to be onsite from day 1, two days a week. Local candidates only - Candidates must be located within 2 hours of Lansing, MI at time of submission.

Top Skills & Years of Experience:
- 5+ years overall experience
- Experience with the ADKAR (Prosci) Framework
- Proven ability to lead large, cross-functional teams and manage high-visibility projects with medium to high risk.
- Strong leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills with experience interacting with Agency Leadership.
- Ability to manage both technical delivery and change management efforts within complex environments.
- Demonstrated success managing vendor-supported projects with integrated technical components and stakeholder groups.

Job Summary:
The State of Michigan is seeking an experienced and dynamic Senior Project Manager to lead complex, large-scale IT initiatives. This role requires a strong blend of project management expertise, leadership capabilities, technical awareness, and change management proficiency to ensure successful project outcomes aligned with business objectives and enterprise standards.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Provide strategic oversight, leadership, and accountability for one or more large, complex IT projects, typically lasting longer than 6 months, involving 20 or more team members, and requiring executive-level communication and coordination.
  • Ensure alignment with State of Michigan project management methodologies, including SUITE, investment management, and systems engineering methodology.
  • Lead cross-functional teams through all phases of project planning and execution, including the development of integrated schedules, risk management plans, and budget tracking.
  • Monitor and report on project progress regarding scope, quality, schedule, and budget, and escalate issues and risks to executive leadership as necessary.
  • Perform long-term release planning to support organizational strategic goals and ensure alignment with broader enterprise initiatives.
  • Evaluate technical requirements in collaboration with IT and business stakeholders, proposing solutions that meet business needs while adhering to SOM best practices and industry standards.
  • Apply structured change management practices grounded in the ADKAR (Prosci) framework to ensure stakeholder alignment and successful adoption of project deliverables.


Technical Competencies:
  • Strong knowledge of APIs, system interfaces, and multi-system integrations across complex IT environments.
  • Working knowledge of IT infrastructure components and their interactions within networked environments (e.g., firewalls, VIPs, F5 listeners, ports).
  • Familiarity with core infrastructure environments including networks, servers, storage, web platforms, and virtual/cloud solutions.
  • Ability to effectively collaborate with technical teams and external vendors to support solution design, integration, deployment, and issue resolution.


Change Management and Stakeholder Engagement: This position plays a critical role in driving change adoption through:
  • Integration of change management principles from the outset of the project.
  • Close collaboration with stakeholder engagement leads to develop and implement communication plans, facilitate training sessions, and monitor organizational readiness.
  • Supporting stakeholders at every level to reduce resistance, align expectations, and ensure long-term user adoption of new systems and processes.


Ideal Candidate Profile:
  • Proven ability to lead large, cross-functional teams and manage high-visibility projects with medium to high risk.
  • Strong leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills with experience interacting with Agency Leadership.
  • Ability to manage both technical delivery and change management efforts within complex environments.
  • Demonstrated success managing vendor-supported projects with integrated technical components and stakeholder groups.

job.title: Business Systems Analyst/Product Owner (34224)
job.description:
TEST-2
Title: Business Analyst/Product Owner
Location: Waukegan, IL - Hybrid - 3 days Onsite / 2 Remote
Duration: 6+ Months Contract (Potential of Extension)
 
Top 3-5 skills needed:

  1. Good Business Analysis experience, writing/creating requirement, and working with stakeholders.
  2. Product Management/Product Owner
  3. Knowledgeable on HR systems-Workday/HCM/ServiceNow/HR management
  4. Familiarity and comfort with Scrum meeting, Agile mindsets, skillsets, and methodologies.
  5. Proficient in project management, Stakeholder management, Customer and Employee Experience management - approach of managing both customer and employee interactions.
 
Description:
  • We are seeking a talented and experienced Business Systems Analyst to join our team.
  • The ideal candidate will be responsible for reviewing, analyzing, and evaluating business systems and user needs, and will document requirements, define scope and objectives, and formulate systems aligned with our overall business strategies.
  • This role requires a bachelor's degree in a related area and 3-5 years of experience in the field or a related area.
 
** Key Responsibilities **
  • Analyze business systems and user needs to develop requirements and documentation.
  • Define the scope and objectives of business systems projects.
  • Formulate systems that parallel overall business strategies.
  • Support mainstream skills or common HR platforms, including ServiceNow, Workday, UKG, as well as tools like
  • Adobe Analytics, Power BI, and PowerApps.
  • Perform effective tech/vendor/solution scouting and assessment.
  • Engage in CX/EX management with experience or a base level understanding.
  • Utilize AI tools to enhance quality and throughput, maintaining a critical approach without relying on 'autopilot.'
  • Manage programs and stakeholders effectively.
  • Plan and accomplish goals relying on experience and judgment, and perform a variety of complicated tasks.
 
Expertise & Skills:
  • Familiarity and comfort with Agile mindsets, skillsets, and methodologies.
  • Proficient in program management and stakeholder management.
  • AI savvy with the ability to leverage AI tools critically.
 
** Traits & Behaviors **
  • A natural learner and self-starter.
  • Detail- and process-oriented.
  • A doer and builder, showing initiative and proactiveness.
  • Deeply collaborative, able to catalyze progress by leading through example.
  • Outcome-oriented with a focus on achieving practical results.
  • Demonstrates creativity and flexibility in task execution.

job.title: Administrative Assistant (34221)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client based out of Monsey, NY is currently seeking an Administrative Assistant for a contract position.

Pay Rate: $17-18/hr on W2.

job.title: Senior Java EE Developer (34235)
job.description:
Job Title: Senior Java EE Developer
Location: 100% REMOTE (Client is based in Lemont, IL)
Duration: 12+ Months Contract (Further extension)
USC only

TOP Skills:
  1. Java EE Technologies, Java 1.8 version (prefer Java 7.7)
  2. Springboot
  3. Microservices
  4. Web Services
  5. Kubernetes, Docker
  
Job Summary:
Seeking to hire a senior level software engineer, a skilled Java EE developer that possesses extensive solution development knowledge with the ability to work on a defined set of business systems. 
The goal is to reduce the technical debt and modernize various applications and tools within our portfolio.
Some of the common tasks that are to be performed on an application will be: migrate our Java EE portfolio to a container’s environment.
 
The candidate will:
  • Conduct group discussions with key players.
  • Work with the product teams to help determine requirements and understand the design of each product.
  • Refactor, build, and test each product.
  • Design, build, and test integrations for each product.
  • Complete all required client training.
 
Qualifications:
  • Comprehensive knowledge of Java EE Technologies, Java 1.8 version or above, including JMS.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of Oracle, PL/SQL Stored Procedures, Triggers, Functions a plus.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of SQL Server a plus.
  • Working knowledge of ANT, Maven and Jenkins (or another CI tool).
  • Previous experience with Agile Scrum methodology a plus.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of Spring and Spring JDBC.
  • Kubernetes, docker, legacy apps in Jboss
  • Comprehensive knowledge of Apache Camel, Apache CXF, SOAP/WSDL, and WS-Security.
  • Comprehensive knowledge and experience in analyzing current architecture environments.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of Enterprise Service Bus (ESB) technologies, Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) concepts is nice to have.
  • Knowledge of the underlying infrastructure technologies that we will be using, including Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6, virtual machines, Apache, Single Sign On, and load balancing technologies.
 
Soft skills:
  • Considerable skill in defining and aligning team members to the common mission.
  • Excellent communication and technical skills.
  • Able to work both independently and as a contributing member of a technical team.
  • Able to effectively interact with the organization to derive requirements and design solutions.
  • Able to disseminate knowledge to current staff.

job.title: Director of Information Technology (IT) – Cloud Technology & Infrastructure (34234)
job.description:
We are looking for a forward-thinking IT leader to guide our technology operations and spearhead the strategic growth of our cloud-first environment. This role will oversee the planning, delivery, and continual improvement of enterprise IT services, with a strong focus on cloud platforms, SaaS applications, and modern infrastructure solutions. You’ll have the opportunity to shape technology direction in a dynamic, expanding organization while staying hands-on with critical initiatives.
The successful candidate will combine leadership, technical expertise, and business alignment to ensure our technology landscape remains secure, scalable, and optimized for performance. This is both a strategic and execution-focused position, requiring a proven ability to deliver results in a high-growth setting.

Key Responsibilities
  • Lead, mentor, and inspire the IT team to foster innovation, accountability, and collaboration.
  • Manage and optimize cloud platforms and applications, including Microsoft 365, AWS, and Azure, ensuring alignment with organizational priorities.
  • Oversee the delivery of IT projects such as infrastructure upgrades, security enhancements, and modernization programs.
  • Maintain the security, availability, and scalability of network and cloud environments through best practices and proactive risk management.
  • Drive process improvements through automation, integration, and innovative technology solutions.
  • Establish and enforce IT policies, compliance measures, and security standards to protect organizational data and systems.
  • Partner with senior leadership to define and execute a technology roadmap that supports business growth.
  • Provide hands-on support for high-priority issues and initiatives to minimize operational disruptions.
  • Stay ahead of emerging technologies and industry developments to maintain a competitive edge.

Qualifications
  • 7+ years of progressive IT experience, including at least 3 years in a leadership role.
  • Deep knowledge of cloud services, infrastructure, and enterprise technology ecosystems.
  • Strong technical foundation in networking, security, and systems administration.
  • Demonstrated success in delivering complex IT projects in evolving or scaling organizations.
  • Solid understanding of cybersecurity, compliance frameworks, and risk management practices.
  • Proven leadership and communication skills with the ability to inspire and manage high-performing teams.
  • Strategic mindset with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to align IT initiatives to business outcomes.
  • Experience identifying cost efficiencies, automation opportunities, and process improvements in cloud environments.

job.title: Business Process Reengineering Consultant (34232)
job.description:
Job Title: Business Process Reengineering Consultant
Location: Lansing, MI 48933 (Hybrid – Onsite 2 Days/Week)
Client: Myticas' Direct Client

Please NOTE: 

  • Resource will be working a hybrid schedule. NO REMOTE ONLY OPTION. Will need to be onsite from day 1, two days a week. 
  • 30-40 hours per week.


Top Skills & Years of Experience:
  • Deep understanding of practical metrics and how to help business areas seamlessly integrate and monitor metrics
  • Understanding of Lean tools and expertise in PDCA (Plan Do Check Act), used for iterative problem-solving and process refinement.
  • Deep understanding of guiding business to document ROI.
  • Experience in crafting research plans, white papers and synthesizing research outcome reports.
  • Skills in crafting digestible summaries for executives and developing accompanying info graphics for wider communication

Job Summary:
As a Research Analyst, you will be responsible for researching best practices that help define and drive changes to improve the State’s current continuous improvement efforts. The position will serve as an expert on the development of ROI for continuous improvement efforts and for identifying or developing tools to help with improvement efforts.  You will conduct research, work with cross-functional teams, and perform research studies independently.  These responsibilities also include delivering oral and written presentations, evaluating qualitative and quantitative data, and helping the OCI team better understand what would make our methods more intuitive and seamless.

Job Responsibilities:
1.Conduct best practice research across private and public sector for OCI Leadership
2.Organize and evaluate quantitative and qualitative research.
3.Work with cross-functional teams to identify and evaluate research topics and approaches
4.Craft reports, presentations and other communication materials on the research conducted.
5.Generating insights from data and recommend follow up actions.
6.Present and promote research findings to program owners and business stakeholders.
7.Develop customized approaches, plans, and workshops to help address Business Area problems and issues.
8.Lead initiatives, coordinate with senior leadership, and align improvements with broader business strategy and KPIs
9.Lead user workshops and facilitating sessions, both in-person and virtual.

Skills/Requirements:
•Four more years of research experience.
•Deep understanding of guiding business to document ROI.
•Deep understanding of practical metrics and how to help business areas seamlessly integrate and monitor metrics
•Experience in crafting research plans, white papers and synthesizing research outcome reports.
•Skills in crafting digestible summaries for executives and developing accompanying info graphics for wider communication.
•Understanding of Lean tools and expertise in PDCA (Plan Do Check Act), used for iterative problem-solving and process refinement.
•Experience in leading workshops to gather information, synthesize information and developing metrics.
•Generating insights from data and effectively sharing research results.
•Communication & Stakeholder Engagement - Conveying findings simply and persuasively in reports, dashboards, and presentations to diverse audiences—from frontline workers to senior executives
•Collaborating effectively with stakeholders and acting as a strategic partner in decisions.

Certifications (Not required but good to have):
  • Certified Analyst Professional
  • Certified Financial Analyst
  • Financial Risk Manager


  • Examples of Projects:
    -Explore and design SOP’s using AI for supporting continuous improvement activities
    -Explore tools for process mining for better data gathering and decision making.  
    -ROI of OCI HCD projects
    -ROI of OCI LPI program
    -ROI of OCI Customer Experience Strategy implementation
