job.title: Robotic Power Automate Developer (34090)
job.description:
Myticas Consulting is currently seeking 2–3 Robotic Power Automate Developers to support a large-scale data migration project for a confidential financial services client. This is a hybrid role based in Montreal or Toronto, with a preference for Montreal-based candidates. Candidates must be open to periodic travel to Montreal (1–2 times/month, 3–4 days at a time) and working shifts during production events, including some evenings/weekends.

Project Scope:

The successful candidates will develop, optimize, and deploy automation workflows using Power Automate Desktop (RPA) and SQL. The role focuses on data transformation and integration into legacy mainframe systems, supporting business-critical migration activities with high compliance and quality standards.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and deploy automation workflows using Power Automate Desktop (RPA)

  • Collaborate with business and data teams to translate migration requirements into automated processes

  • Write and optimize complex SQL queries, stored procedures, and data validations

  • Automate ETL processes for integration with mainframe environments

  • Monitor, troubleshoot, and resolve workflow issues

  • Ensure security, compliance, and maintain clear documentation and audit trails

  • Participate in key migration events and be available for shift-based support when needed

Required Skills & Qualifications:

  • 4+ years of experience in Power Automate Desktop (RPA) development

  • Experience with Power Platform (solution creation and deployments)

  • Strong SQL development skills, including stored procedures and performance tuning

  • Previous experience with mainframe data integration or loading

  • Understanding of RPA architecture, workflow orchestration, and automation lifecycle

  • Experience working in Agile or hybrid project settings

  • Strong communication and troubleshooting skills

Nice-to-Have:

  • Familiarity with Power Automate Cloud flows or Power Platform integrations

  • Knowledge of SSIS, ADF, Informatica, or middleware tools

  • Exposure to COBOL datasets or legacy batch processing

  • Experience with data mapping and transformation logic

job.title: Environmental Engineer (34088)
job.description:
Environmental Engineer
Location: Indianapolis, IN
Position Type: 100% Contract
Work Schedule: 37.5 hours/week | Monday–Friday, 8:15 AM – 4:45 PM EST
Client: Myticas’ Direct Client (Indiana Department of Health)

NOTE FROM HIRING MANAGER:
This is a long-term, full-time contract position with a standard weekly schedule of 37.5 hours. The candidate must be available to work during regular state office hours (8:15 AM – 4:45 PM EST). Please confirm your understanding of and availability for this schedule.

Job Summary:

The Environmental Engineer is responsible for conducting plan reviews and related tasks to ensure compliance with all relevant laws, rules, and standards. This work supports the Indiana Department of Health's mission to protect public health in the construction and operation of healthcare facilities and other regulated structures. The role emphasizes the application of architectural and engineering standards across multiple disciplines, including safety, sanitation, water supply, sewage disposal, mechanical systems, electrical systems, plumbing, and applicable licensing requirements for facilities in Indiana.

This position also requires effective communication and timely responses to inquiries from the public, consultants, contractors, and the regulated community.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Review and evaluate architectural and engineering plans to ensure regulatory compliance.

  • Apply environmental and public health principles to design evaluations.

  • Provide timely, professional responses to inquiries from the public and regulated entities.

  • Interpret and apply relevant state and federal codes and standards.

  • Recommend actionable plans based on technical data and plan analysis.

  • Ensure compliance with environmental engineering policies and sanitation practices.

  • Support public health initiatives through the review of facility plans requiring state approval.

Required Technical Knowledge and Experience:

  • Minimum 1 year of experience reading blueprints/plans, analyzing data, and recommending corrective or actionable solutions.

  • Working knowledge of:

    • Environmental engineering laws, rules, and technical guidelines

    • On-site sewage disposal and sanitation policies

    • Public health science and environmental health principles

    • Soil science and applied mathematics

    • FGI (Facility Guidelines Institute) healthcare facility design guidelines (hospitals, outpatient, residential)

    • NFPA (National Fire Protection Association) codes and standards

Education and Certification:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Engineering or a related field (Required)

  • Indiana Professional Engineering (PE) License (Preferred but not required)

job.title: Technical Manager Customer Support (32657)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Technical Support Manager to lead a team of skilled Technical Support Engineers in delivering world-class customer support. This individual will be responsible for managing daily support operations, coaching and mentoring team members, driving operational excellence, and fostering a customer-first culture focused on satisfaction, retention, and long-term success.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in technical support operations, experience with networking or SaaS platforms, and a genuine passion for solving customer issues with empathy and urgency.

Core Responsibilities

  • Lead, inspire, and develop a team of Technical Support Engineers to deepen product knowledge, elevate support standards, and encourage professional growth.

  • Oversee daily operations of the support organization, ensuring key performance indicators (KPIs)—including customer satisfaction, response time, and resolution rate—are consistently met or exceeded.

  • Serve as the primary escalation point for complex or high-priority technical issues, ensuring timely and effective resolution.

  • Analyze support metrics, service-level agreements (SLAs), and customer feedback to identify trends and implement scalable improvements that enhance team efficiency and service quality.

  • Evaluate and adopt new tools and technologies that improve productivity and the overall customer support experience.

  • Foster employee development and retention through regular coaching, mentoring, and opportunities for continuous learning.

  • Drive consistency in support processes by promoting best practices, standardizing workflows, and maintaining high-quality documentation.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, Engineering, and Customer Success, to address systemic issues and advocate for long-term product improvements.

  • Lead customer-facing support reviews and Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) to discuss issue trends, resolutions, and opportunities for service enhancements.

  • Translate technical feedback and customer pain points into actionable improvements for product development and documentation.

Required Qualifications and Skills

  • 7+ years of experience in technical support or customer success, including managing technical escalations.

  • Proven success leading support teams in fast-paced, high-growth environments.

  • Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving abilities.

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • Solid understanding of networking concepts and tools used for troubleshooting network-related issues.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related technical field (or equivalent professional experience).

  • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple initiatives in a high-pressure environment.

  • Demonstrated ability to proactively identify risks and implement effective mitigation strategies.

job.title: SQL Implementation-Product Configuration Specialist (32609)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client based out of Madison, WI is currently seeking a SQL Implementation-Product Configuration Specialist for a 100% Remote Contract to Hire position.

NOTE:  W2 only!

  • 100% remote 9-5 EST or CST

TOP Skills:

  • 2+ years Experience with SQL database is required
  • Experience working in a client-facing role; Ideal fit - Implementation & customer facing experience, proficient with SQL with healthcare background as a plus.
  • The manager is looking for someone with a good hold on SQL amongst the other requirements.
  • Experience with (MS Access and/or Oracle is a plus)
  • Healthcare background is a huge plus.
Job Description:
This is a role within our Health division Implementation group supporting our Drug Diversion application. 
  • This role is responsible for configuring our software as part of our implementation process.
  • The successful incumbent will understand how to transform and configure healthcare data from our customers into our software.
  • In addition, their technical aptitude and ability to understand how to resolve customer issues will directly lead to satisfied customers and business success.
  • This is a customer-facing position, so great interpersonal and communication skills are a must.

job.title: Power BI Architect (32633)
job.description:
Myticas direct client is seeking Power BI Architect at Waukegan, IL (Hybrid, 3 days in the office, 3 days of choice Monday – Thursday. Onsite Hybrid schedule is mandatory, cannot be altered)

Duration: 6+ month contract (potential to extend)
 
TOP 5 SKILLS:
 
  1. Experience with design and architecture
  2. Experience with data modelling
  3. Experience with Performance Optimization.
  4. Experience as a BI Architect or similar role, with 5-7 years’ experience in Power BI.
  5. Strong expertise in full Microsoft BI Suite, data modeling, DAX, and Power Query.
 
JOB SUMMARY:
We are seeking a highly skilled Power BI Architect to join our dynamic team. As a Power BI Architect, you will be responsible for designing and implementing effective BI solutions that transform data into actionable insights. You will lead the strategic development of our Power BI platform, ensuring scalability, reliability, and optimal performance.
 
Key Responsibilities:
  • Design and Architecture: Develop and design the architecture of the Power BI platform, Power Automate, and Power Apps, ensuring alignment with business requirements and best practices.
  • Data Modeling: Create efficient and scalable dimensional data models that facilitate data analysis and reporting.
  • Dashboard Development: Lead the development of dynamic and interactive dashboards that provide valuable insights to stakeholders.
  • Integration: Collaborate with IT and data engineering teams to integrate Power BI with various data sources and systems.
  • Performance Optimization: Identify and implement strategies to optimize the performance of Power BI reports and dashboards.
  • Security: Ensure data security and compliance with organizational policies and industry standards.
  • Strategy and Planning: Advise on BI strategy and roadmaps, aligning business needs with technology advancements.
  • Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users and junior team members, promoting effective use of Power BI tools.
  • Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of architectural designs, configurations, and project specifications.
 
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field.
  • Proven experience as a BI Architect or similar role, with 5-7 years’ experience in Power BI.
  • Strong expertise in full Microsoft BI Suite, data modeling, DAX, and Power Query.
  • Experience with SQL, Python, Jupyter Notebooks, and integrating Power BI with various data sources.
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
  • Ability to lead projects and work collaboratively in a team environment.
 
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Experience with Azure data services and cloud technologies.
  • Familiarity with other BI tools and platforms.
  • Power BI certification is a plus.

job.title: SAP FICO/RTR Lead (32631)
job.description:
Myticas Consulting is seeking an experienced SAP FICO/RTR Lead for a long-term HYBRID contract with a major utility and energy client. This is a senior-level techo-functional role requiring a mix of deep functional finance expertise and strong technical capabilities within the SAP ecosystem. The position requires frequent travel (50–70%) to Winnipeg, MB, and the consultant may be based anywhere in Canada.

Project Scope:
The successful candidate will help develop methodologies, tools, and thought leadership in SAP Finance as part of a critical ERP initiative. The role requires strong hands-on knowledge of SAP Finance (FICO/RTR) and integration with other modules, along with experience in end-to-end implementations and strategic financial processes.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead SAP FICO/RTR workstream across implementation and integration efforts

  • Provide hands-on configuration and design of SAP Finance modules (GL, AP, AR, AA, CO, Treasury, SAC-Planning, etc.)

  • Collaborate with business and technical teams to document requirements, define process flows, and ensure high-quality solution delivery

  • Integrate SAP FICO with PS, PM, MM, IS-U, and SCM modules

  • Contribute to finance strategy, reporting systems, and regulatory requirements specific to utilities

Key Qualifications:

  • 8+ years of SAP Finance experience across GL, AR, AP, AA, CO, etc.

  • Experience leading large-scale SAP S/4HANA implementations

  • Functional and technical experience with finance and cost accounting processes

  • Strong familiarity with SAP integrations across IS-U, MM, CS, EWM, PS

  • Understanding of Power & Utilities finance regulations is a plus

  • SAP Certifications highly preferred

  • Degree in Accounting, Finance, or Computer Science (MBA a strong asset)

  • Experience with Datasphere, SAC, and Analysis for Office is a bonus

Additional Details:

  • Travel to Winnipeg is mandatory (50–70%)

  • Must be flexible with on-site scheduling

  • This is a client-facing leadership role requiring excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills

job.title: Sr Engineer (32634)
job.description:
The Myticas Team is hiring a Senior Software Engineer!

Myticas is excited to be partnering with a top-tier organization to add a Senior Software Engineer to their dynamic Technology Services team. This role is ideal for an experienced engineer who is passionate about building scalable, stable, and high-performing solutions—while also helping mentor and guide others in best practices.

In this position, you’ll bring both strategic insight and hands-on technical expertise to support and enhance business-critical systems. You’ll collaborate across teams, drive automation and DevOps practices, and work closely with leadership to shape the engineering standards of tomorrow.

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Design technical solutions aligned with long-term business and IT strategies

  • Develop core software in collaboration with product teams, ensuring stability and scalability

  • Work independently on initiatives and contribute to complex problem-solving efforts

  • Participate in planning sessions, break down work, and remove roadblocks for the team

  • Apply DevOps principles and continuously enhance CI/CD pipeline practices

  • Share new engineering techniques and help define team standards and templates

  • Provide technical coaching to junior engineers, helping them build strong foundational skills

  • Contribute to the recruitment and onboarding of new talent

  • Support ongoing vendor evaluations and technology selections

  • Participate in an on-call support rotation as a subject matter expert

What You Bring:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science (or related field) or equivalent experience

  • 7+ years of experience in software engineering or system development

  • Proven experience working with:

    • ServiceNow, Power BI, Power Automate, ServiceNow Analytics, PowerShell, Automation Anywhere, SQL Queries

    • Code debugging, database querying, and automation tools

    • CI/CD pipelines and DevOps environments

  • A collaborative mindset, mentoring spirit, and an ability to communicate technical concepts clearly

  • Solid understanding of secure, scalable systems architecture

Nice to Have:

  • Experience in the Financial Services or Insurance industry

  • Prior experience coaching junior developers or shaping engineering team practices

If you’re looking for your next challenge where you can lead from the front, help shape engineering culture, and work on impactful projects—we want to hear from you! Apply today to learn more.

job.title: Senior Technical Product Manager (34086)
job.description:
Job Title: Senior Technical Product Manager
Location: Coppell, TX (Hybrid)
Type: Contract (W2 Only)

About the Role:
Myticas is seeking a Senior Technical Product Manager to support our direct client in Coppell, TX. This is a hybrid contract position available exclusively on a W2 basis.

The Senior Technical Product Manager will serve as the critical link between customers, internal stakeholders, and development teams. This role involves deeply understanding customer needs, translating strategic product vision into actionable development tasks, and leading cross-functional collaboration to ensure the successful delivery of software solutions.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop a comprehensive understanding of the product vision, target customer segments, and long-term priorities, while ensuring alignment with senior leadership and stakeholders.

  • Partner with internal teams—including engineering, marketing, sales, implementation, training, and support—to gather insights, align priorities, and ensure effective product development and launch execution.

  • Serve as the voice of the customer, working closely with UX and development teams to validate and refine solutions throughout the development lifecycle.

  • Conduct and facilitate customer engagements, in collaboration with UX teams, to explore unmet needs and test concepts and prototypes.

  • Translate business requirements into user stories and detailed acceptance criteria for development teams.

  • Lead Agile ceremonies including backlog grooming, sprint planning, and sprint reviews, ensuring outcomes align with business objectives.

  • Drive quarterly Agile planning and continuously build subject matter expertise to identify and implement product improvements.

  • Maintain and evolve detailed product roadmaps, prioritizing features across multiple quarters.

  • Coordinate with project managers and other product managers to manage dependencies, monitor progress, and adjust plans to stay on track.

  • Proactively manage cross-functional risks and dependencies to drive continuous improvement and team alignment.

  • Monitor product performance and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess impact and adjust strategies accordingly.

  • Review completed development work to validate acceptance criteria, ensuring products meet expectations and deliver value.

  • Perform other duties as assigned by the supervisor.

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, Business Management, or a related field. Equivalent practical experience will be considered.

Required Qualifications and Experience:

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Senior Product Manager.

  • Minimum of 3 years of product management experience for software products, preferably in B2B enterprise SaaS or Tax & Accounting domains (CPA firm experience a plus).

  • Proven hands-on experience with Agile Scrum methodologies in a Product Owner or Technical Product Manager capacity.

  • Strong understanding of the software development lifecycle, including backlog management, user story writing, and iterative development planning.

  • Demonstrated ability to work closely with UX and technical teams to design and refine products based on user research and testing.

Preferred Skills and Competencies:

  • Strategic Thinking & Influence: Ability to align stakeholders, manage competing priorities, and drive a cohesive product vision.

  • Data-Driven Decision-Making: Skilled in leveraging data and customer insights to inform product strategy and decisions.

  • Technical Fluency & Problem Solving: Capable of translating complex business requirements into clear, actionable development tasks.

  • Agility & Adaptability: Comfortable working in a fast-paced, changing environment with the flexibility to shift priorities as needed.

job.title: Senior Business & Program Management Consultant (32660)
job.description:
Senior Business & Program Management Consultant (GxP/Clinical)
Location: Waukegan, IL (3 days onsite)
Company: Myticas's direct client based in North Chicago, IL

MUST Have:
  1. 8-10 years of Senior IT project experience: System Lifecycle (SLC) Expertise.
  2. GXP system experience required - GXP system implementation including custom development and validated systems.
  3. Portfolio / Program management experience.
  4. Clinical Systems
  5. Project financial management, and vendor management expertise.

Description:
Senior Business Management Consultant to manage and drive all aspects of TWO in-flight system development (custom build) and enhancement projects, complete contracting / pre-SLC assessments for new projects, and assess new business capability requests.
 
Required:
  • 8-10 years of Senior IT project experience: System Lifecycle (SLC) Expertise, Portfolio / Program management experience, project financial management expertise, vendor management expertise.
  • Must have the ability to create / review SLC documents 
  • Track record of successful GXP system implementation including custom development and validated systems.
  • GXP system experience required,
  • Clinical experience strongly preferred

job.title: Lab Technician (32645)
job.description:
Myticas direct client is seeking Jr Lab Technician  at Waukegan, IL (Hybrid-3 days onsite)

Duration: 6 months (with a possibility of extension)

Description:

One of our direct clients is looking for a Jr Lab Technician  who would be responsible for performing highly automated compound management department utilizing robotic instruments to manage the tasks of adding or removing samples from storage banks, along with electronic barcodes to facilitate record-keeping and sample preparation tailored to research scientists’ experimental needs. Automation not only accelerates sample delivery but also promises enhanced consistency of samples regarding concentration accuracy and the uniformity of physical properties across experimental runs. These improvements are crucial in advancing early drug discovery.

Responsibilities:

Work cross-functionally to develop a deep understanding of the scientific processes and identify key bottlenecks that could be improved with automation to increase research velocity.
• Develop appropriate automation protocols to meet the needs research scientists.
• Maintain instrumentation through routine maintenance and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to minimize equipment downtime.
• Write and update protocols for new automation workflows using robotic-specific software for laboratory instruments, e.g., Tecan, Beckman Coulter, Agilent Technologies, and SPT.
• Draft, edit, and review laboratory Standard Operating Procedures for the automated platforms and the protocols necessary to support sample delivery.
• Promptly enter all data to support the needs of the research scientist.
• Interpret results, identify anomalies or unexpected outcomes, and provide appropriate remedies.

Qualifications:
List required and preferred qualifications (up to 10). Include education, skills, and experience.
• Bachelor’s degree in a scientific discipline (e.g., biology, chemistry, or similar).
• Experience with robotic liquid handlers from Hamilton, TECAN, Agilent Technologies, or Beckman Coulter.
• Experience in compound management preferred.
• Ability to work upright and stationary and/or standing for typical working hours.
• Ability to lift and move objects up to 25 pounds.
• Ability to work in non-traditional work environments.
• Ability to use and learn standard office equipment and technology proficiently.
• May have exposure to potentially hazardous elements typically found in laboratory environments (PPE required).

job.title: Digital Marketing Consultant (32563)
job.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a Digital Marketing Consulting to support Search Engine Optimization activities.  This is an ON-SITE role starting as a 5 months contract, with likely extensions.  Candidates local to the Grand Rapids area, are preferred. Qualified candidates please provide resume.  Thank you!
 
Job Description (Visible to Supplier): Digital Marketing Contractor – Job Responsibilities

In response to evolving digital marketing priorities and the growing importance of AI in search, we are expanding the role of our current SEO lead and seeking a Digital Marketing Contractor to provide support for core SEO responsibilities. This role will help ensure continuity in execution and performance monitoring while allowing the team to focus on broader strategic initiatives. The contractor will support global SEO operations and partner with market teams to enhance visibility, discoverability, and performance across digital properties.

Duration: July – December 2025, with potential extension
Location: Grand Rapids, MI (Onsite)
Reports to: Global SEO Lead

Key Responsibilities

Operational SEO Execution
• Conduct keyword research to support market-level needs and content planning.
• Perform technical SEO audits using tools like Ahrefs and Google Search Console.
• Support content optimization efforts, including metadata, on-page structure, and internal linking.
• Compile and deliver monthly SEO performance reports using platforms such as Ahrefs, Heap, and GSC.
• Troubleshoot SEO issues reported by markets and provide actionable solutions.
• Leverage AI tools and approaches to generate recommendations for content optimization, keyword discovery, link-building, and landing page refinement.
• Integrate AI-enabled tools to automate repetitive SEO tasks and improve execution speed and scalability.

SEO Training and Enablement
• Assist in delivering SEO onboarding sessions and office hours for market teams.
• Help maintain and update SEO playbooks, best practices, and documentation on SharePoint.
• Create or revise modular self-serve resources to enable independent market optimization.
• Support the creation and management of a centralized SharePoint hub for training.

Performance Monitoring and Insights
• Support organic search sentiment analysis and reputation tracking.
• Monitor and extract insights from dashboards (Heap, Ahrefs) to identify trends and risks.
• Assist in evaluating SEO impact for major product launches and post-launch performance reviews.
• Apply AI-powered tools to surface deeper insights from large-scale performance data.

Collaboration and Coordination
• Work cross-functionally with content, analytics, and technical teams to integrate SEO best practices.
• Participate in global team meetings or planning sessions to ensure SEO considerations are included.
• Escalate technical SEO issues or strategic risks to the Global SEO Lead.

Tool and Vendor Support
• Assist with user access management, licensing coordination, and onboarding for SEO tools.
• Support evaluations of SEO tool usage and effectiveness.
• Coordinate with vendors to troubleshoot issues or implement platform improvements.

?

Qualifications
• 5+ years of experience in digital marketing and hands-on SEO in global or multi-market settings.
• Proficiency with SEO tools like Heap, Ahrefs, Google Search Console, and Lumar (or equivalent).
• Strong analytical skills; able to turn performance data into clear, actionable insights.
• Excellent writing and editing skills, with an understanding of search-optimized content.
• Demonstrated experience creating or reviewing metadata, headers, and on-page copy for SEO.
• Familiarity with CMS platforms and technical SEO concepts (indexing, crawling, Core Web Vitals).
• Strong understanding of how AI can be applied to SEO (e.g., prompt engineering, content summarization, automated content audits, keyword clustering).
• Experience working with cross-functional teams across content, marketing, and tech.
• Ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and adapt in a fast-paced environment.

job.title: Java Developer (34081)
job.description:
Job Title: Programmer Analyst 6-Java Developer
Location: Lansing, MI 48933 (Hybrid- in office 2 days a week Tue/Wed)
Client: Myticas' Direct Client
Candidate Requirement: Local candidates only (within a 2 hour radius of Lansing, MI). No remote-only option available.


Top Skills & Years of Experience:
Core Java Expertise:

  • 4+ years with Java 8 features and functionality
Framework Experience:

This is a java developer position. The position will be supporting the Michigan Department of Transportation's (MDOT) Project Development and Maintenance programs.

As a software developer, the responsibilities include, but are not limited to, working with the project manager, application owner, and resource manager, working on an agile development team to organize work, develop, test, and deploy code. This position must have excellent communication and teamwork skills, be self-directed, committed, and a quick learner.

In addition to full-stack development, this position will also work with UI/UX team members in building user interfaces and responsive applications.

Required Skills/Experience:

Enterprise Frameworks:

Web Development:

Development Practices:
  • 5+ years working in Agile development environments


Preferred Skills:

Development Tools:
  • 4+ years experience with Log4j, JUnit, and Tiles (Desired)
Reporting:
  • 4+ years with Jasper Reports, Crystal Reports, or Business Objects (Desired)

job.title: Customer Service Technical Specialist (32665)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client is currently seeking an B2B Customer Service Technical Specialist for a 100% Remote (for EST & CST locations) contract opportunity.

NOTE: W2 only!

  • Resource may have to use their own equipment for this role is 100% remote.
  • Expected to work CT hours (8AM-4.30PM); open to candidates from ET & CT zones

Job Description:

Requires in-depth conceptual and practical knowledge of technical customer service theories and principles and applies general knowledge of business and industry practices. Working independently under minimal guidance, carries out a full range of professional duties and solves complex problems. Exercises judgement based on the analysis of multiple sources of information. Contributes to post live technical support services to customers including troubleshooting, problem resolution and maintenance of products and services. Interfaces with appropriate departments in coordination, planning and implementation of various activities. 

Uses advanced analytical, technical, and problem-solving skills do adapt policies and programs and develop models to support small projects or the team. 

What You Will Do:

  • Provide a high level of technical support and assistance for client's customers and consultants using in-depth knowledge of technical customer service 
  • Solve complex technical problems; exercise judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information 
  • Test and identify defects by documenting in the tracking system for the attention of the development team 
  • Liaise with internal escalation, development and functional teams for issue resolution, explain difficult or sensitive information, work to build consensus 
  • Implementing and supporting various advanced features and integrations of the CSC application suites to ensure high availability of data and back end processes Write SQL queries to aid in troubleshooting of application and data requests 
  • Troubleshoot application and interface related issues and modify site configurations based on best practices

Required Qualifications/Experience/Skills: 

  • BS/BA Degree or equivalent, Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent relevant experience 
  • 5+ years’ experience in a B2B technical customer service or implementation role 
  • In-depth knowledge of, or experience with cloud computing platforms such as Azure, Google Cloud, and AWS 
  • In-depth knowledge of database technologies such as Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle 

Other Knowledge, Skills, Abilities or Certifications: 

  • Personal and consultative approach 
  • Experience working in a production support environment 
  • Excellent problem-solving skills 
  • Experience working with healthcare software preferred 
  • Familiarity with healthcare industry regulations and standards preferred 
  • Very strong interpersonal and organizational skills 
  • Self-starter; should be able to work with minimal supervision 
  • Should be open to constructive feedback 
  • Collaborative approach

job.title: Attorney (32601)
job.description:
Legal Invoice Review Quality Assurance Analyst II
Location: Hybrid in St. Cloud, MN or Minneapolis, MN (Must be located in MN; flexible for 2 days per week onsite)
Contract Type: Hybrid Contract Position
Employment Type: W2 only

NOTE: Bilingual (French, German, Italian and/or Spanish) would be a plus, medical malpractice experience would be nice as well.

Myticas' direct client, based in St. Cloud, MN or Minneapolis, MN, is seeking a Legal Invoice Review Quality Assurance Analyst II (QA Analyst II) for a hybrid contract position. This role focuses on quality assurance testing within the Legal Bill Analysis Center of Excellence (LBACOE). The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in legal concepts related to invoice auditing across multiple areas of law.

Required Qualifications:

  • Juris Doctor (JD) degree from an ABA-accredited law school is required.
  • Strong understanding of legal billing guidelines and UTBMS task codes.
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision after training.
  • Excellent written communication skills, including grammar, syntax, style, spelling, and proofreading.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
  • Bilingual (French, German, Italian and/or Spanish) would be a plus, medical malpractice experience would be nice as well

Job Responsibilities:

Quality Assurance & Invoice Review:

  • Conduct expert peer reviews of invoice analysts' work, applying specialized legal knowledge to ensure accuracy and compliance with billing guidelines.
  • Assess legal context and terminology within invoices and make necessary adjustments to previously modified line-item entries.
  • Document comprehensive justifications for adjustments, citing specific billing guideline violations.
  • Ensure accurate classification of UTBMS task, fee, activity, and expense codes.
  • Use discretion and legal expertise to correct both adjusted and non-adjusted invoice line items.

Appeals & Mediation:

  • Serve on the Appeals Team, engaging in written communication with law firms to resolve disputes over invoice adjustments.
  • Participate in legal expert-to-expert discussions to reach mutually agreeable resolutions on disputed invoice adjustments, in alignment with client directives.
  • Handle escalated appeals mediation, including drafting written summaries for clients and attending resolution conferences with law firms, management, and clients.
  • Work professionally with law firms via written communications to resolve disputes while maintaining integrity in the legal billing process.

Collaboration & Process Improvement:

  • Support business unit partners by identifying process improvements and opportunities within the Legal Bill Analysis (LBA) process.
  • Collaborate with audit and appeals teams to interpret client guidelines and resolve complex legal invoicing scenarios.
  • Provide feedback to the CIOX Artificial Intelligence Decision Science team to improve machine learning functionality for invoice auditing.

Additional Skills & Responsibilities:

  • Conduct periodic audits and data analysis to support performance metrics and reporting.
  • Organize workflow efficiently to review invoices promptly and accurately.
  • Communicate effectively in both oral and written form to obtain and deliver information.
  • Possess strong business math skills and appropriate telephone communication skills.
  • Ability to analyze legal service agreements and develop effective operational tools.
  • Proficient in electronic legal billing software and Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Maintain professionalism while working independently with minimal supervision.

job.title: EDW Informatica ETL Developer (32541)
job.description:
EDW Informatica ETL Developer

Job Title: Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) Informatica ETL Developer

Duration: 12 months with possible multi-year extension/s

Job Summary:

Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) is are seeking a highly experienced Informatica Extract Transform Load (ETL) Developer for a large, direct client in Springfield, IL. This opportunity will be an assent to the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) team.

This role is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining robust ETL processes using Informatica PowerCenter and Teradata. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of data integration, performance tuning, and data warehousing best practices, with a focus on supporting healthcare-related data systems.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement ETL solutions using Informatica PowerCenter to extract, transform, and load data from various agency sources.
  • Automate data staging processes and optimize ETL job scheduling for performance and efficiency.
  • Administer and support ETL environments, including development and production systems.
  • Perform repository backups, recovery operations, and system maintenance.
  • Develop mappings, mapplets, sessions, and workflows using a wide range of Informatica transformations.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot ETL jobs across development, testing, and production environments.
  • Write and optimize complex SQL queries and Unix Shell scripts for data marts and interfaces in Teradata.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements, document technical solutions, and support project planning.
  • Participate in unit, integration, and system testing.
  • Provide technical support, mentoring, and guidance to team members.
  • Communicate project status and deliverables to leadership and clients.
  • Continuously learn and apply new technologies to enhance system performance and capabilities.

Required Qualifications:

  • 7+ years of experience with Informatica PowerCenter and ETL development.
  • 5+ years of experience writing complex SQL and performance tuning.
  • 5+ years of experience with Teradata (v17+), including Fastload, TPT, and Multiload utilities.
  • 5+ years of Informatica PowerCenter administration experience.
  • 2+ years of Unix Shell (Bash/Korn) scripting experience.
  • Strong communication, collaboration, and mentoring skills.
  • Bachelor’s or advanced degree in IT, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • Strong organizational and time management skills. 2025 Page 1 of 2 Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) ETL/Informatica Developer

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Residing in or near Springfield, IL.
  • 5+ years of data warehouse development experience.
  • 5+ years of data modeling experience using ERWIN or similar tools.
  • 2+ years of experience with Azure Data Factory and Snowflake.
  • Experience with scripting languages such as Python, R, or JavaScript (React).
  • Familiarity with Informatica Data Quality (IDQ), Address Doctor, and Metadata Manager.
  • Experience with Medicaid, Medicare, or healthcare data systems.
  • Experience working in Agile environments.
  • Knowledge of BI and data integration technologies across relational and multidimensional systems.

job.title: Technical Manager, Professional Services (32658)
job.description:
Our client is seeking a hands-on Technical Manager to lead the design, development, and delivery of custom technical solutions across their entire product suite. This role blends technical leadership with project execution, guiding engineers and workflow developers through the successful implementation of enterprise-grade media workflows, systems integrations, and cloud-based solutions.

The ideal candidate will have deep technical expertise in cloud infrastructure, software integration, scripting, and solution architecture. They are passionate about translating customer needs into scalable, high-impact solutions while driving engineering excellence through mentorship, best practices, and cross-functional collaboration.

Core Responsibilities

  • Translate customer requirements into actionable technical tasks.

  • Contribute to writing and reviewing Statements of Work (SOW) by providing technical task breakdowns and time estimates.

  • Collaborate with the Commercial Lead to align on project scope, milestones, and sprint planning.

  • Define technical architecture and approaches for workflow implementation.

  • Allocate technical resources and prioritize tasks based on sprint goals.

  • Work with Engineering and DevOps teams to ensure infrastructure, integration, and deployment requirements are met.

  • Review and approve code, enforcing coding standards and best practices.

  • Ensure all technical deliverables meet customer expectations and internal quality standards.

  • Promote best practices in software development and workflow automation.

  • Mentor engineers to foster professional growth and technical excellence.

  • Proactively identify opportunities to improve customer deployments by recommending complementary solutions.

  • Analyze existing customer setups to identify inefficiencies and propose optimizations using the broader product suite.

  • Serve as a technical advisor, helping customers align their needs with the capabilities of our client's platform.

Required Qualifications and Skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field (or equivalent experience).

  • 3+ years of experience in software development or solution engineering.

  • 2+ years of experience in technical leadership or a senior engineering role.

  • Proficiency in object-oriented design, API development, scripting (e.g., Python, Bash), and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).

  • Familiarity with workflow automation tools and version control systems.

job.description:

job.title: IT Infrastructure Manager - Manufacturing (32619)
job.description:
IT Infrastructure Manager - Manufacturing
Direct hire
Onsite - Orion, MI

Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) is seeking an IT Plant Manager for a large client in Orion, MI. This role is crucial in managing all IT-related activities at the local plant, with key responsibilities encompassing infrastructure, manufacturing software, and business operations. Local candidates are strongly preferred.
 
 Responsibilities

  • Manage daily IT activity at plant level including employee related issues.
  • Assist in budget (cap-ex/allocation) for plant and corporate level.

Qualifications

  • Four (4) years of experience managing a budget
  • A minimum of 4 years of project management experience
  • A minimum of three (3) years of experience training and developing direct reports

  • RF

job.title: Senior AWS Cloud Project Manager (32652)
job.description:
Job Title: Sr AWS Cloud Project Manager 
Location: Waukegan, IL (3 days onsite)
Company: Myticas's direct client based in North Chicago, IL

Duration: 5+ months (with a possibility of extension)
 
TOP Skills:
  1. 5-10 years of experience of technical project management.
  2. Ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage multiple stakeholders effectively.
  3. Experience with cloud platforms, especially AWS.
  4. Experience managing SDLC projects.
 
Primary Function:
Develop, execute, and manage multiple IT projects within their defined scope(s). Manage a multitude of interrelated project activities and lead all aspects of the project lifecycle, working with project sponsors/key stakeholders, team members, and management to oversee all phases of project completion. Build and manage project’s work breakdown structure, milestones, risks, issues, and deliverables within the constraints of human and financial resources and changing priorities to ensure the successful completion of the project. Ensure transparent reporting of project status, issues, risks, and financials.
 
Key Responsibilities:
  • Initiate and Plan Project:
    • Collaborate with business and IT management to establish project goals, objectives, financials, and deliverables.
    • Build and manage the project plan, resources, and Gantt charts to accomplish the project scope.
  • Project Control and Quality Management:
    • Evaluate scope changes, issues, and risks, working with stakeholders to resolve them.
    • Measure performance against the original plan and budget, ensuring compliance with corporate and functional policies and procedures.
    • Maintain and update the RAID log to track project risks, actions, and issues.
  • Execute and Close Project:
    • Develop and execute work plans, securing authorized resources to complete all activities.
    • Lead the team in delivering the project scope, gather lessons learned, and obtain final project approval.
    • Assist in managing the process to ensure all validation deliverables are completed.
  • Project Communication:
    • Produce and distribute project reports to provide accurate status and decision support to stakeholders.
    • Make recommendations to resolve issues and manage risks based on the current project status.
  • Resource and Team Management:
    • Coordinate and assign resources to ensure project needs are met, effectively assign tasks based on team members’ abilities.
    • Motivate the project team to achieve desired outcomes.
  • Decisions and Financial Control:
    • Make decisions impacting project-level activities; influence or have authority over the project budget.
    • Develop and manage a financial plan, maintaining spend within +/- 10% of the overall budget.
    • Track and update financials in Clarity, coordinating estimates and invoices with vendors.
  • Vendor Coordination:
    • Coordinate vendor activities and ensure timely milestone delivery.
    • Ensure vendor purchase orders (POs) are processed promptly.
  • Project Meetings:
    • Facilitate Project Management meetings to oversee execution activities with IT System Owner and Principal Business Systems Consultant.
 
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Systems/Computer Science or related discipline.
  • Proven Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word skills are required.
  • 5-10 years of experience in Information Technology project management.
  • Proven experience with cloud platforms, especially AWS, experience with on-premise HPC clusters, and familiarity with data management tools and best practices a must
  • Experience managing SDLC projects.
  • Flexibility needed while collaborating with the global project team and vendors (eg 7 AM meetings and /or 4 pm meetings).
 
Preferred Qualifications:
  • PMP Certification
  • PPM Tool experience
  • Pharmaceutical experience
  • Experience managing projects to deliver or enhance validated systems.
 
Key Stakeholders:
  • Business and Technology resources; varying levels of leadership.

job.title: Remote-Sr. Application Developer & Data Engineer (SOI-773122) (32654)
job.description:
Myticas' direct client, based in Indianapolis, IN, is seeking a Sr. Application Developer & Data Engineer for a 100% contract position. 

Hiring Manager NOTE:  Preference is a local candidate but will consider candidates outside the state of Indiana. Local candidates will have occasional/periodic opportunities to work in office with state and vendor staff.

Required Skills and Experience:
Core Experience & Expertise

  • 7+ Years as a Senior Application Developer and/or Data Engineer
  • 7+ Years with MuleSoft APIs, Azure Data Factory, GoAnywhere MFT, and other cloud/ETL/application development technologies
  • 7+ Years of software development (principles, design patterns, programming languages)
  • 7+ Years in automated testing & CI/CD pipelines
  • 7+ Years in application development, data engineering, system integration, and support
  • 7+ Years in designing, coding, testing, debugging, and documenting system software
  • 7+ Years in data modeling (relational SQL & NoSQL databases)
  • 7+ Years designing and implementing ETL/ELT processes
  • 7+ Years with data quality principles & governance practices

Technical & Soft Skills
  • Strong analytical & problem-solving skills for complex troubleshooting
  • Excellent communication & interpersonal skills for stakeholder collaboration
  • Ability to work independently and in teams


Education:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field (or equivalent education/experience)



Job Summary:
The Indiana Office of Technology is seeking a skilled Senior Application Developer & Data Engineer with expertise in MuleSoft APIs, Azure Data Factory, and GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer services. 

Resource will be responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining various applications and systems to support our state agencies. This role also includes operations and support activities, such as fielding and resolving customer tickets and issues.

Key Responsibilities:
• Application Development: Design, develop, and implement applications using MuleSoft APIs, Azure Data Factory, GoAnywhere Managed File Transfer services, additional cloud ETL services, data pipelines, and application development technologies. 
• Software Development Lifecycle: Participating in all phases of the SDLC, including requirements gathering, design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance.
• Data Pipeline Development: Design, develop, and maintain efficient and scalable data pipelines and ETL processes that collect, process, and store data from various sources.
• Data Modeling and Architecture: Design and implement robust data models that enable efficient data analysis and manipulation
• System Integration: Integrate various systems and applications to ensure seamless data flow and interoperability.
• Programming: Develops and codes new application software and/or make enhancements to existing application software.
• Testing: Tests and debugs new and existing application software, generating comprehensive unit test data, and validating test results.
• Customer Support: Field and resolve agency customer tickets and issues in a timely and efficient manner. Resolves customer issues with application software and responds to suggestions for improvements and enhancements.
• Data Quality and Governance: Implement data quality checks, ensure data integrity, and contribute to data governance policies.
• Project Support: Confers with management to assist in planning, organizing, and controlling the activities of assigned areas. Assists state staff and vendors on various development projects and contributes to Agile and SDLC project management in assigned areas.
• Maintenance and Support: Provide ongoing maintenance and support for existing applications, data pipelines, and systems.
• Operations Activities: Monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and ensure optimal performance of applications and systems.
• Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for all applications, systems, and integrations.
• Collaboration: Work closely with other developers, system administrators, and stakeholders to ensure successful project outcomes.
• Compliance: Ensure all applications and systems comply with state policies and regulations.
• Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to junior developers and data engineers, fostering a collaborative and growth-oriented environment.

job.title: Cloud Solutions Architect, Smart Factory Solutions (32620)
job.description:
What we offer:

At Magna, you can expect an engaging and dynamic environment where you can help to develop industry-leading automotive technologies. We invest in our employees, providing them with the support and resources they need to succeed. As a member of our global team, you can expect exciting, varied responsibilities as well as a wide range of development prospects. Because we believe that your career path should be as unique as you are.

 

 

Group Summary:

Magna is more than one of the world’s largest suppliers in the automotive space. We are a mobility technology company built to innovate, with a global, entrepreneurial-minded team. With 65+ years of expertise, our ecosystem of interconnected products combined with our complete vehicle expertise uniquely positions us to advance mobility in an expanded transportation landscape.

 

Job Responsibilities:

 

Enterprise Cloud Solution architect will be responsible to create and execute cloud computing strategies by designing, developing, and managing cloud infrastructure and assets to help a business meet its goals. The position will be responsible for deploying well architected framework pillars, ensuring customers are following best practices, guidance, and recommendations to develop cloud solutions that are secure, resilient, efficient, and managed with operational excellence.

 

Your Responsibilities

  • Design cloud-based storage solutions for both structured and unstructured data

  • Recommend best practices for building secure and reliable applications

  • Identify and define which cloud-services meet a given technical requirement

  • Brainstorm for new ideas and ways to improve development and delivery

  • Monitor metrics and develop ways to improve

  • Provide detailed specifications for proposed solutions including materials, external services and internal resources required

  • Work with source control tools (Azure DevOps, GitHub)

  • Actively troubleshoot any issues that arise during testing and production

 

Who we are looking for

  • BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent experience.

  • 8+ years experience in developing technology solutions, including but not limited to: operations/engineering, networking engineering, infrastructure/database architecture, and/or applications development.

  • 3+ years of experience in software development

  • 2+ years of experience in microservice design or containerization

  • 7+ years of experience with developing cloud-based solutions on AWS and/or Microsoft Azure

  • 5+ years of experience with frameworks, architecture patterns and design patterns

  • AWS or Azure Solutions Architect or Developer Associate certification

  • Develop flexible architectures that enable capabilities that are leveraged across Magna

  • Design cloud-based solutions that comply to GDPR and CCPA standards

  • Broad technology experience across at least 2-3 of these areas including: cloud architecture, applications development, relational

job.title: Manufacturing Engineer (32643)
job.description:
Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a MANUFACTURING ENGINEER - willing to consider all experience levels - this is a contract role to start, with conversion to perm the goal.  


Planned 2nd shift hours of 4pm-12pm/1am, to support production.

We are hiring Associate to Sr. Manufacturing Engineer to lead and provide ongoing support through our manufacturing life cycle!

What You Will Be Doing:
With general direction, will lead the introduction of new products into the facility, improve productivity and profitability of existing production procedures, and provide ongoing support through the manufacturing life cycle. Acts as a technical expert in process technology

Improvements: Independently, with innovation and creativity, evaluates manufacturing processes to ensure optimal labor and material costs to increase productivity and profitability. Through justifications and evaluations, identifies prime areas for improvement. Tracks expenditures to ensure outlays are within budgeted amounts. Identifies, reduces, and eliminates worker exposure(s) to ergonomic stress(es) in the work place.

Floor Support: Provides timely product and process support for any manufacturing area to diagnose problems and implement solutions to minimize interruptions to production.

Special Projects: Leads the implementation of significant product, process, or other corporate change initiatives being introduced into the plant.

Strategic/Manufacturing Planning: Provides advanced research to introduce/integrate new processes, equipment, and technologies into the company


Who You Are:
Preferred Skills and Competencies
  • Very strong analysis skills: process, capacity, cost/benefit, waste stream, and quality tools.
  • Internal and external quality support/management
  • Knowledge in lean manufacturing techniques: flow, PQ, equipment reliability, and set up reduction.
  • Facilitation and negotiation skills
  • Knowledge of material handling
  • Productivity improvement techniques: RCI’s
  • Behavior sciences (logic, sociology, etc.)
  • Economics and financial analysis
  • Work measurement
  • Interpersonal skills
  • Computer skills; advanced level required to utilize Excel and Access programs
  • Experience in design, specification, purchase, and installation of new equipment
  • Experience in the Engineering Design Process
  • Knowledge of simulation, process modeling, and value stream mapping
  • Project management and leadership ability
  • Occupational Bio Mechanics/Human Factors Engineering
  • Strategic planning

Required Skills and Competencies
  • 4 year technical degree or equivalent education

job.title: Senior Software Technical Support Specialist (32305)
job.description:
The Senior SoftwareTechnical Support Specialist will provide expert-level technical assistance and strategic support the customers, partners, and cross-functional teams. This role involves complex issue resolution, leadership in support process improvement, ownership of professional service projects focused on product customization and integrations, deploying software solutions, onboarding new customers, and proactive engagement in optimizing team tools, processes, and customer issues. This individual will drive support initiatives, lead escalations, and act as a liaison with the engineering team to implement solutions resolving customer-reported bugs and issues.

Requirements

Essential Functions

  • Lead and Resolve Advanced Technical Issues: Provide exceptional, senior-level support by diagnosing and resolving complex technical issues for customers, partners, and sales engineers, demonstrating technical leadership and initiative.
  • Deployment and Customer Onboarding: Manage the deployment of our clients software solutions, ensuring smooth transitions for new customers and providing comprehensive onboarding to maximize product adoption and success.
  • Customer Impact Focus: Act as the primary point of escalation for challenging, high-impact technical issues, driving timely and effective resolutions for mission-critical customer needs.
  • Project Leadership in Professional Services: Lead professional service projects aimed at product customization and integrations, coordinating with customers to understand requirements and deliver solutions aligned with their business needs.
  • Critical Availability: Provide on-call support for critical escalations outside standard business hours as needed, prioritizing rapid resolution and customer satisfaction.
  • Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with development, QA, and product management teams to assist in developing and testing patches, updates, and scripts for issue resolution and software enhancements.
  • Team Mentorship and Skill Development: Mentor junior team members, fostering skill enhancement and knowledge-sharing across the support team.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Experience & Expertise:

  • Minimum of 7 years of experience in technical support or related fields in a software company, with a track record of successfully managing complex production environments.
  • Hands-on experience with Windows, Linux, and Mac OS environments, as well as multi-platform troubleshooting.
  • Networking knowledge, including TCP/IP, DNS, and SSL, with experience in packet capture and analysis.

Technical Proficiency:

  • Background in cloud infrastructure services (AWS, Azure) and familiarity with modern cloud-native architectures.
  • Familiarity with database administration (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and system automation tools to enhance support processes.
  • Competency in scripting or coding in one or more languages and familiarity with automation tools.
  • Experience with real-time data integrations using webhooks, API listeners, and other middleware solutions to enhance system interoperability.

Analytical & Troubleshooting Skills:

  • Strong diagnostic skills and proficiency in root-cause analysis, with the ability to implement proactive, preventative measures.
  • Ability to synthesize data insights to predict and address system bottlenecks and inefficiencies.

Leadership & Communication:

  • Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, for conveying complex technical information to diverse audiences.
  • Proven ability to lead support projects and initiatives, with a strong focus on customer satisfaction, teamwork, and collaboration.

Additional Desirable Skills:

  • Experience in technical support leadership roles, with the ability to delegate, prioritize, and coach effectively.
  • Expertise in technical documentation and knowledge management systems to empower both internal teams and end-users.
  • Ability to work flexible hours to support a 24/7 environment and provide guidance in high-pressure, critical situations.
INDSponsor

job.title: Cloud Architect (32642)
job.description:
Myticas' direct client, based in Lansing, MI, is seeking a Cloud Architect to work on a hybrid schedule in Lansing, MI (on-site 2 days per week).

Please Note:

  • Position Location: Lansing, MI. The resource will follow a hybrid schedule and must be on-site from day one, two days a week (typically Tuesdays and Wednesdays).
  • Local candidates are strongly preferred, but non-local candidates may apply if willing to relocate at their own expense and adhere to the hybrid schedule without delays.

Top Required Skills & Years of Experience:

  • Experience: 5+ years in the field.
  • Strong expertise in .NET, HTML, XML, SQL, SOAP, REST, PowerShell, IaC, Microsoft Azure, and Function Apps.
  • Hands-on experience writing and implementing Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
  • Comprehensive knowledge of Microsoft Azure, web-based systems, and client-server-based architecture.

Preferred Skills:

  • Ability to conduct interviews and build effective relationships with system users.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Visio and Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint).
  • Experience in analyzing, designing, programming, testing, implementing, and supporting web-based applications on the Microsoft/Windows platform (e.g., ASP.NET framework 4.8 or higher, .NET 6 or higher).

Job Summary:

The Cloud Application Architect will serve as a technical expert for the Michigan Center for Educational Performance and Information (CEPI). This role involves designing and orchestrating the placement and interaction of application components to meet business requirements while balancing factors such as sustainability, cost control, standardization, security, compliance, and strategic alignment.

This position will focus on IT system modernization initiatives within the CEPI portfolio and ensure seamless integration of the CEPI Cloud infrastructure with COTS packages, SaaS, Web Services, and other federal, state, and local government applications and services (both internal and external to the State).

The Cloud Architect will provide technical expertise and leadership to the application development team, promoting usability, security, mobility, maintainability, and reusability. This role requires minimal supervision and involves significant collaboration with program managers and technology oversight groups. The architect will work as part of a team of architects/designers, supported by additional staff.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead the development and application of technical architecture strategies.
  • Analyze technical and business problems and recommend solutions to improve processes and enable productivity.
  • Collaborate with other architects and developers to select and adapt cloud architecture frameworks and tools to project needs.

Required Skills/Experience:

  • In-depth knowledge of complex cloud application development environments and practices.
  • Ability to gather and analyze facts, define problems, and recommend solutions.
  • Thorough understanding of cloud application development architecture, frameworks, and tools.
  • Advanced knowledge of business requirements, network-based application orchestration, database management, and application development.
  • Expertise in advanced cloud application development and integration techniques.
  • Strong proficiency in .NET, HTML, XML, SQL, SOAP, REST, PowerShell, IaC, Microsoft Azure, and Function Apps.
  • Knowledge of secure coding and authorization concepts, relational database principles, web services, and microservices architecture.
  • Experience with distributed tracing and observability.
  • Proficient in creating and maintaining distributed applications using microservices.
  • Excellent technical documentation and presentation skills.
  • Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting abilities in high-stress environments.
  • Self-motivated, capable of managing tasks independently with minimal supervision.

Additional Qualifications:

  • Knowledge/training in object-oriented analysis, design, and programming.
  • Familiarity with cloud application and database development methods.
  • Ability to prepare detailed instructions and documentation.
  • Capacity to establish and maintain effective relationships with clients and support teams.

This role requires a candidate who can work efficiently under pressure, handle complex assignments, and deliver optimum solutions in a timely manner. The ideal candidate will be proactive, technically skilled, and collaborative, ensuring successful delivery of cloud architecture projects.

job.title: Senior FPGA Verification Developer (32383)
job.description:
Position: Senior FPGA Verification Developer Full-time Position

Position Overview On behalf of our client, we're seeking a Senior FPGA Verification Developer to join their product development team focusing on next-generation broadcast video processing technology. This role combines advanced FPGA verification expertise with cross-functional collaboration to ensure product excellence.

Reporting Structure Reports to: Sr. Manager, Hardware Development – IP Solutions

  • AXI

    Cross-functional Collaboration

    Preferred Additional Skills

    Professional Competencies

    • Strong interpersonal skills
    • Detail orientation
    • Creative problem-solving
    • Quick learning ability
    • Time management
    • Quality focus

    Work Environment

    • Agile/Scrum methodology

    Success Factors

    • Collaborative approach

    • Time management
    • Problem-solving ability

    This position offers an opportunity to work on cutting-edge broadcast video processing technology while developing both technical and collaborative skills. The ideal candidate will combine deep FPGA verification expertise with strong team collaboration abilities.

job.title: SAP Functional Consultant (32428)
job.description:

job.title: Technical Program/Project Manager (32635)
job.description:
About Us 
We are seeking a highly skilled and adaptable Technical Program Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of how technical products are built, deep expertise in agile methodologies, and the ability to navigate ambiguity while keeping teams focused and productive. They must also excel at communicating progress, managing stakeholder expectations, and resolving client conflicts effectively. 

Key Responsibilities: 
  • Provides project management on large scale, complex, high profile and high-risk projects for OPS I&IT initiatives. 
  • Project Planning and Road mapping: Collaborate with technical teams to develop and maintain project roadmaps, ensuring alignment with business goals and priorities. 
  • Task Breakdown: Break down large, complex tasks into smaller, manageable pieces of work, ensuring clarity and focus for the team. 
  • Agile Facilitation: Facilitate agile ceremonies (e.g., sprint planning, stand-ups, retrospectives) and ensure adherence to agile processes and principles. 
  • Bottleneck Identification: Proactively identify bottlenecks and risks and propose actionable solutions to keep projects on track. 
  • Work Allocation: Ensure team members have a steady stream of work, balancing workloads and priorities across teams. 
  • Metrics and KPIs: Define, track, and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure team performance and work throughput. 
  • Process Optimization: Continuously evaluate and improve processes to optimize team efficiency and output. 
  • Cross-Team Collaboration: Facilitate communication and collaboration across multiple teams, ensuring alignment and transparency. 
  • Reporting: Create and deliver clear, actionable reports on project status, progress, and metrics using tools like JIRA. 
  • Accountability: Take ownership of project delivery, ensuring timelines and deliverables are met while maintaining high-quality standards. 
  • SDLC Tracking & Technical Oversight: Monitor and track the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) to ensure projects progress through key phases (e.g., planning, development, testing, deployment) efficiently, identifying risks and dependencies at each stage. 

Must haves:
  • This is a Technical PM Role so the client is looking for a hands-on Technical PM with excellent communication skills.
  • Ability to handle client relationships to manage expectations provide updates as required, identify potential conflicts between project and functional areas and communicate with different stakeholders at various stages of the Project Delivery
  • Possess a deep understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and hands-on experience guiding projects through each phase, from planning and development to testing, deployment, and maintenance. 
  • Proven experience with agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc.) and familiarity with agile tooling like JIRA.

Nice-to-Have: 
  •    Certification in agile methodologies (e.g., Certified Scrum Master, PMI-ACP). 
  •    Experience working with distributed or remote teams. 
  •    Knowledge of software development lifecycle (SDLC) and CI/CD pipelines. 


Qualifications: 
   Technical Understanding:  
  • Strong grasp of how technical products are built, with the ability to engage with engineers and understand technical challenges. 
  • Possess a deep understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and hands-on experience guiding projects through each phase, from planning and development to testing, deployment, and maintenance. 

   Agile Expertise: Proven experience with agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc.) and familiarity with agile tooling like JIRA. 

   Project Management Skills: Demonstrated ability to manage complex projects in dynamic environments with minimal definition. 

   Communication:  
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex ideas clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. 
  • Ability to handle client relationships to manage expectations, provides updates as required, identifies potential conflicts between project and functional areas 
   Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a focus on identifying and resolving bottlenecks. 

   Process-Oriented: Experience creating, refining, and optimizing processes to improve team efficiency. 

   Metrics-Driven: Comfortable defining and tracking KPIs to measure and improve team performance. 

   Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment with ambiguous requirements. 

   Leadership: A collaborative and empowering leadership style, with the ability to motivate and guide teams toward success.

job.title: Senior SAP EWM consultant (32622)
job.description:

This is a hybrid role requiring 50–70% travel to Winnipeg. Candidates may be based anywhere in Canada but must be flexible with travel as needed.

The consultant will play a key functional leadership role within the SAP EWM workstream and collaborate closely with stakeholders to design and implement warehouse and logistics solutions using SAP S/4HANA.

  • Integrate EWM with related SAP modules (TM, PP, MM, SD)

  • Provide expert client-facing communication and presentations

  • Mentor junior consultants and support stakeholder alignment across teams

Qualifications:

  • 5–8+ years of SAP EWM experience with at least 2 full lifecycle implementations

  • Strong hands-on configuration experience with SAP EWM

  • Experience integrating with SAP TM, PP, MM, and SD modules

  • Prior experience leading teams on SAP S/4HANA projects

  • Strong communication and presentation skills

  • Experience delivering solutions in the utility, energy, or related industries is a plus

  • Familiarity with SAP TM is an asset

Additional Information:

  • Travel to Winnipeg required (50–70%)

  • Candidates must be located in Canada

job.title: SAP Functional Lead – Project Systems - PS (32621)

The successful candidate will be responsible for leading the design and implementation of SAP Project Systems solutions, ensuring alignment with business needs across project lifecycle management, finance integration, and operational workflows.

This is a high-visibility role requiring strong leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills. The position is hybrid with 50–70% travel to Winnipeg, MB. Candidates must be flexible with on-site travel and able to engage with stakeholders at all levels, including executives.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead the configuration and implementation of SAP PS solutions, including integration with maintenance, service, and finance modules

  • Collaborate with business and technical teams to gather and translate business requirements

  • Drive client discussions, challenging stakeholders when needed to ensure alignment with SAP best practices

  • Participate in project blueprinting, documentation, and testing activities

  • Support change management, training, and go-live planning

  • Monitor project progress, manage risks, and communicate outcomes effectively

Required Qualifications:
