  • Background in utilities, energy, oil, or gas is a strong asset

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, or a related field

  • SAP certifications highly preferred

job.title: Local to Chicago-Sr Project Manager (A-30582) (32582)
job.description:
Senior Project Manager 
Location: Waukegan, IL (3 days onsite)
Company: Myticas's direct client based in North Chicago, IL

Job Description Summary

Develop a fully integrated end-to-end RBQM ecosystem that will cover every aspect of the early- and late-stage critical-to-quality factors. This system will streamline data management, improve risk assessment and mitigation, and enable real-time data-driven intelligent decision-making across studies, processes, vendors, assets, and programs. .

Develop, execute, and manage multiple IT projects within their defined scope(s). Manage a multitude of interrelated project activities and lead all aspects of the project lifecycle, working with project sponsors/key stakeholders, team members, and management to oversee all phases of project completion. Build and manage project’s work breakdown structure, milestones, risks, issues, and deliverables within the constraints of human and financial resources and changing priorities to ensure the successful completion of the project. Ensure transparent reporting of project status, issues, risks, and financials.

Key Responsibilities

  • Initiate and Plan Project: Works with business and IT management to establish and gain consensus on project goals, objectives, financials and deliverables. Responsible for building the plan and resources needs to accomplish the scope.
  • Project Control: Assess the degree to which changes to scope, issues and risks will affect the project working with business and IT management and sponsor to gain agreement for resolution. Measure performance to assure the project is progressing as compared to original plan and budget.
  • Executing and Closing Project: Develops and executes a work plan obtaining authorized resources to ensure all activities are performed. Leads team in delivering project scope. Gather lessons learned and obtain final project approval from sponsor and stakeholders.
  • Project Communication: Communicate project progress by producing project reports to provide timely and accurate program status and decision support information to project teams, business, and IT management. Makes recommendations based on current project status to resolve issues and manage risks.
  • Resource and Team Management: Coordinate resources to ensure project needs are addressed and effectively assign tasks and deliverables to team members based upon their abilities. Motivates project team in order to deliver project outcomes.
  • Quality Management: Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and functional policies and procedures.
  • Decisions: Make decisions that impact project level activities. Influences or has final decision authority for project budget.
  • Financial Control: Develops and manages a financial plan with multi-million dollar spend. Tracks actual spend, accruals, proactively creates spend estimates on a regular basis (at least monthly) and coordinates estimates and invoices with project vendors, in order to maintain spend at +/- 10% of the overall project budget.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Systems/Computer Science or related discipline.
  • Proven Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word skills are required.
  • 5-10 years of experience in project management
  • Experience managing SDLC projects.
  • Key Stakeholders:
  • Business and Technology resources; varying levels of leadership

Preferred Qualifications

  • PMP Certification
  • PPM Tool experience
  • Pharmaceutical experience
  • Experience managing projects to deliver or enhance validated systems.

This is a hybrid position requiring both remote and onsite work in Waukegan, IL.

job.title: Technical Support and Customer Service Associate (32581)
job.description:
Technical Support and Customer Service Associate - REMOTE

Myticas is actively seeking a Technical Support and Customer Service Associate for a direct client to join their Personal Support Center (PSC) team. This role is perfect for someone with a passion for helping others, a knack for troubleshooting, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, tech-forward environment.

You'll be supported by extensive training, a detailed knowledge base, and a collaborative team ready to help you grow.

What We’re Looking For:
  • Strong customer service and communication skills
  • Comfort working in a flexible, 24/7/365 support environment
  • Ability to adapt to new tools, systems, and processes quickly
  • Team player who’s open to ongoing feedback, learning, and development
Why Join Us:
  • Hands-on training and mentoring

  • Opportunities to collaborate with tech experts and leadership

If you're ready to jump into a dynamic support role where no two days are the same, apply now or reach out to learn more. We’re excited to meet you!

job.title: Senior Technical Strategist (32522)
job.description:

Location: Lansing, MI (Hybrid – On-site Tuesdays and Wednesdays)

About the Role:

Please Note:

  • This position is open to local candidates residing within a two-hour drive of Lansing, MI.

  • This is a hybrid role; remote-only options are not available.

Top Required Skills and Experience:

  • A minimum of 5 years of experience providing Independent Verification and Validation (IV&V) or equivalent quality assurance services.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, Project Management, or a related field (required).

Preferred Skills and Certifications:

  • Additional certifications such as Certified ScrumMaster (CSM) or Certified Quality Auditor (CQA).

Position Summary:

Key Responsibilities:

  • Review critical project documentation, including charters, project management plans, schedules, risk registers, and contracts.

  • Evaluate deliverables for quality, completeness, and adherence to requirements.

job.title: Remote Work-Office Manager (W-9795) (32590)
job.description:

job.title: Hybrid Work-French Legal Invoice Analyst/Initial Reviewer (W-2101) (32600)
job.description:
Location: Hybrid Contract Position | Minneapolis, MN
NOTE: W2 Candidates Only!

Myticas's direct client, based in Minneapolis, MN, is seeking a Legal Invoice Analyst/Initial Reviewer for a hybrid contract position.

Position Overview:

The Legal Invoice Analyst I is responsible for the prompt, accurate, and efficient auditing of electronically submitted legal fee and expense invoices from law firms and vendors. The selected candidate will ensure compliance with billing guidelines by adjusting invoice line items that violate provisions and documenting justifications for those adjustments. The analyst will also provide guidance to business unit partners on issues or opportunities within the Legal Billing Audit process.

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Efficiently and accurately review legal invoice entries.
  • Receive legal invoice assignments from the Operations Support Specialist or self-assign tasks from the intake queue.
  • Verify compliance with legal billing guidelines for submitted invoices.
  • Ensure the accuracy of UTBMS task codes (Fee, Activity, and Expense codes) applied to invoice line items.
  • Document reasons for any adjustments made to invoice line items, specifying the violated billing guideline and rationale for the adjustment amount.
  • Forward audited legal invoices through the appropriate review chain as required.
  • Collaborate with Legal Invoice Analysts and Quality Assurance Analysts.
  • Exercise discretion and sound judgment when making audit and adjustment decisions.
  • Demonstrate a strong understanding of legal terminology and claims-related legal situations, with multijurisdictional exposure preferred.
  • Work independently with minimal supervision after training.
  • Utilize electronic legal bill submission and auditing software efficiently.
  • Organize work to ensure the prompt and efficient review of legal invoices within designated timeframes.
  • Apply basic business math skills and maintain appropriate business telephone etiquette.

Required Skills, Qualifications, and Experience:

Education:

  • Paralegal Certification or a Bachelor's Degree in a legal-related discipline, or equivalent work experience.

Experience:

  • 1-3 years of experience in a legal services or legal auditing environment.
  • Must speak, read and write French--for this opening.
  • Familiarity with legal billing processes.
  • Strong understanding of federal and/or state rules of civil procedure.

Technical Skills:

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
  • Experience with legal billing systems and processes.

Core Competencies:

  • Teamwork: Collaborate effectively with the Legal Billing Audit Center of Excellence (LBACOE) and other business units while providing constructive feedback.
  • Problem Solving: Think independently and make sound decisions. Identify necessary resources to aid in decision-making and take proactive steps to resolve problems.
  • Leadership: Demonstrate personal accountability for day-to-day tasks and collaborate with other business units to achieve results.
  • Planning and Organizing: Prioritize tasks to achieve short- and long-term goals within designated timeframes.
  • Technology: Partner with technology experts to identify gaps and develop impactful solutions.
  • Learning: Adapt to changes in the marketplace and workforce by acquiring or modifying knowledge through study, experience, or instruction.
  • Initiative: Exhibit self-direction and translate ideas into action to achieve results.

job.title: 100% remote- SAP-SRM/HANA migration Technical Lead (A-30533) (32564)
job.description:
Title: SAP-SRM/HANA/ARIBA Technical Lead
Duration: Thru Dec 31st, 2025 (possibility of extension)
Location: 100% remote
Initiative: Replacement of SAP SRM with SAP S/4 HANA (ARIBA)

This role will be responsible for supporting the Phase 0 analysis for applications in R&D FinOps that integrate with SAP/SRM.  The SAP-SRM/ Ariba Technical Lead would be responsible for reviewing the design, development, and implementation of the overall architecture of an SAP-SRM and Ariba solution within R&D. They would ensure, the current design aligns with business needs by considering factors like scalability, security, integration with other systems, and the entire "source-to-pay" procurement process across sourcing, contracting, and purchasing functions within the SAP-SRM and ARIBA platform.
 
Key Responsibilities:
 

  • Meet with Business stakeholders to understand current workflows and integrations with SAP/SRM.
  • Understand the landscape of the applications in the R&D FinOps domain that have integrations with SRM and determine impact of the SRM replacement.
  • Create workflows of the existing processes and document the gaps with the new processes.
  • Work with the Robotic Process Automation team to collaborate on any BOTS that may be impacted as part of the SAP SRM replacement.
  • Expand Ariba knowledge to learn more applications such as Tonkean, Coupa and how they integrate with our R&D systems because of Project Genesis
  • Solution Design:
  1. Understanding of procurement processes, including sourcing strategies, contract negotiation, and invoice management.
  2. Analyze business requirements, identify pain points, and create a comprehensive SAP-SRM and Ariba solution architecture that addresses those needs, including system integration with other enterprise applications.
• Configuration and Customization: Configure and customize SAP Ariba to match specific business processes and workflows, including user interface design and data mapping.
• Integration Management: Design and implement integration points between SAP Ariba and other systems like ERP (SAP ECC or S/4HANA), CRM, and other third-party applications.
 
Required Skills:
 
  • Project Leadership: Lead the technical implementation of SAP-SRM and Ariba projects, including managing development teams, coordinating with stakeholders, and ensuring project deliverables are met.
  • Possess in-depth knowledge of SAP-SRM and Ariba functionalities, including modules like Sourcing, Contract Management, Procurement, Supplier Management, Spend Analytics, and the underlying technical infrastructure.
  • Familiarity with SAP technical architecture, data models, and integration technologies like APIs, web services, and middleware.
  • Understanding of Data and with knowledge or exposure of PL/SQL.
  • Lifecycle and Performance Ariba Integration (CIG, Webservices)
  • Applications integration with non-ERP systems SAP ECC 6.0 and S/4HANA, and Ariba-specific parameters, programs, and other functions
  • Possess good Knowledge of Salesforce.

job.title: Local to Chicago, W2 ONLY - Cloud/DevOps Engineer, On-site (F-5168) (32507)

job.title: Local to MA - Hybrid, Senior IT Program Manager (Pharma experience) (A-30432) (32525)
job.description:
Senior Project Manager - Hybrid
Location: Worcester, MA
Duration: 6+ Month Contract (Possible Extension)

Position Overview:
Myticas' direct client is seeking an experienced Senior Project Manager to lead multiple IT initiatives in a hybrid work environment. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in project management, particularly in delivering Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) projects, and be comfortable managing cross-functional teams and complex project dynamics.

Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems/Computer Science, or a related discipline

  • 5-10 years of experience in project management

  • Proven experience managing SDLC projects

  • Proficient in Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word

Preferred Qualifications:

  • PMP Certification

  • Experience with Project Portfolio Management (PPM) tools

  • Experience in the pharmaceutical industry

  • Experience managing projects involving the delivery or enhancement of validated systems

Key Stakeholders:

  • Business and technology resources at various leadership levels

Job Summary:
The Senior Project Manager will develop, execute, and manage multiple IT projects within defined scopes. They will lead project activities throughout the full lifecycle, collaborating with sponsors, key stakeholders, team members, and management. Responsibilities include creating and managing work breakdown structures, milestones, risks, issues, and deliverables. The Senior Project Manager will ensure project success while balancing resource and budget constraints and maintaining clear, transparent reporting.

Responsibilities:

Initiation and Planning:

  • Collaborate with business and IT leadership to define project goals, objectives, financials, and deliverables

  • Develop project plans and resource requirements to achieve scope

Project Control:

  • Evaluate how changes to scope, risks, and issues impact the project

  • Partner with business and IT leadership to resolve issues and mitigate risks

  • Monitor project performance against original plan and budget

Execution and Closure:

  • Execute detailed work plans using authorized resources

  • Lead project teams to deliver agreed-upon scope

  • Facilitate lessons-learned sessions and secure final project approval from sponsors and stakeholders

Project Communication:

  • Prepare and deliver project reports, providing timely and accurate updates on project status, risks, and decision points

  • Provide recommendations to resolve issues and manage risks based on current project status

Resource and Team Management:

  • Coordinate resources to ensure project requirements are met

  • Assign tasks and deliverables based on team member capabilities

  • Motivate and guide project teams to achieve desired outcomes

Quality Management:

  • Ensure adherence to relevant corporate and functional policies and procedures

Decision-Making:

  • Make project-level decisions, including those affecting project scope, schedule, and budget

  • Influence or exercise final decision authority on project budget matters

Financial Management:

  • Develop and manage multi-million-dollar project budgets

  • Track actual expenditures and accruals, providing regular forecasts (at least monthly)

  • Work closely with vendors to manage estimates and invoices, maintaining spending within ±10% of the overall project budget

job.title: Local to Chicago - Application Support Analyst (A-29079) (32526)
job.description:
Job Title: Application Support Analyst

Location: North Chicago, IL – hybrid role

Myticas direct client is seeking an experienced Application Support Analyst for a hybrid 6+ months contract position at North Chicago, IL.

Top 3-5 skills requirements should this person have:

  1. Must have Lead experience and managing projects.
  2. Experience with SLAs and putting together timelines for projects.
  3. Service NOW - Ticketing and putting together dashboards and read dashboards.
  4. Good communication skills.
  5. Strong Analytical and Problem-solving Skills.

Nice to have (but not required):

  • Pharma or Regulatory application experience.
  • ITIL methodology- Service Management (ITIL is nice to have).

Job Description:

The Service Analyst is accountable for confirming that the appropriate production processes and quality metrics are executed for Client’s Applications that are scored with low risk and complexity.

The role will also provide support and prioritization for the execution of Application Maintenance and Support tasks and some critical production services.

Responsibilities:

List up to 10 main responsibilities for the job. Include information about the accountability and scope.

  • Offer oversight for some critical production services including: Incident, Problem, Service Transition and Disaster Recovery and seek assistance for other critical services such as: Audit, Validation and Compliance.
  • Participate P1- P2 MIM pidge and on call rotation and confirms business impact.
  • Provides support for audit requests for the ACOE.
  • Reviews the Disaster Recovery plan and schedule to ensure that the service providers exercise test drills and execute the plan as designed.
  • Participates with supplier personnel regarding short-term architecture strategy development and provides recommendation as it relates to Application performance or continuous improvement.
  • Performs post installation analysis including lessons learned and provides recommendations for continuous improvement implementations as needed.
  • Provides inputs to the technical reports and documentation that confirm the Root Cause Analysis for Incidents and Problems.
  • Contributes to the development of new or the refinement of existing critical Service Operations and/or Service Transition processes.
  • Assists providers in coordinating with 3rd party hosting or Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) providers on recovery capabilities.
  • Accountable for ensuring that the Service Transition process is fully executed by the provider and provides feedback into the existing Change, Release and Deployment management processes.
  • Reviews the Service Providers application and technical documentation such as Request for Change, operating procedures and technical and non-technical specifications and provides feedback and approval as appropriate.
  • Evaluates the Service Providers reported trends and the process improvement recommendations to help identify areas where preventative maintenance might be performed to improve Applications efficiency, in terms of both the performance of the Applications and any related maintenance and support efforts.
  • Responsible for reviewing the service provider Service Level Agreements on a regular basis and providing oversight for any action plans that are required to address performance issues.
  • Performs daily reviews of ticket activity: queue levels, processing efficiency, backlogs, aging levels along with prior day Incidents to ensure that ticket processing and the problem Management engines are performing within expected operating parameters.
  • Serves as primary client’s contact point and first level of escalation for Incidents and Problems.
  • Assists with the prioritization and escalation of system recovery issues with Cross-functional, Build and Infrastructure teams.
  • Assists MSPs in ensuring that all the user access to IT systems are properly controlled and authenticated and segregation of duties are maintained.
  • Will coordinate an annual access certification process ensuring that current users still require access to applications under their responsibility.
  • Seeks assistance from senior personnel in performing the initial business risk assessment for Maintenance and Support and Minor Enhancement activities.
  • Partakes in vendor performance meetings and operational reviews.
  • Supports vendor initiated continuous improvement performance plans.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or Computer Engineering.
  • Minimum of 2-4 years of combined experience in Information Technology.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of (could be a platform or a vertical such as Oracle, or Life Sciences Pharmaceutical Research and Development or Financial application technologies, etc.).
  • Ability to prioritize and multi-task.
  • Strong problem resolution skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to work within cross-functional teams towards task completion.

job.title: Local to Chicago-Infrastructure Analyst (A-30504) (32566)
job.description:
Infrastructure Risk Management Analyst
Location: Waukegan, IL (Hybrid)
Company: Myticas's direct client based in North Chicago, IL

Job Summary:
We are seeking a results-driven, customer-focused individual with exceptional communication skills to support our Infrastructure Compliance function. The primary goal is to minimize technology-related risks associated with the company’s network, data centers, and desktop/mobile environment.
This role requires prior experience in an IT infrastructure environment, and we provide training for compliance and risk management functions.

Responsibilities:

Risk Treatment:

  • Record infrastructure-related risks in the enterprise risk management platform (OneTrust).
  • Collaborate with business and IT system owners to assess risks based on the established risk management framework.
  • Evaluate proposed treatment plans for risks requiring remediation.
  • Coordinate with infrastructure teams to monitor the implementation of risk remediation plans, escalating tasks that fall behind the timeline.

Internal Audit Support:

  • Monitor the group email account for incoming audit requests.
  • Generate information requests for identified Infrastructure SMEs to fulfill auditor requirements.
  • Review submitted information for accuracy and completeness, log responses, and maintain the team tracker.

Additional Responsibilities:

  • Update documentation for infrastructure assets in the enterprise asset management system (CMDB), including regulatory characteristics and data classification.
  • Assist in creating and formatting operational metrics for compliance activities to support leadership.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree and 5+ years of relevant technology experience or an equivalent combination of education and work experience.
  • Proven experience with technical infrastructure components, including servers, firewalls, data centers, backup/restoration processes, and cloud-hosted environments.
  • Ability to learn and apply the client’s information security and risk management processes, including risk documentation and treatment within OneTrust.
  • Familiarity with IT Policies and Procedures available in the enterprise document management system (OneVault).
  • Capability to work independently while recognizing when to escalate and communicate issues within the team or to leadership.
  • Strong analytical and communication skills with the ability to effectively engage both technical and non-technical team members.

job.title: Training Specialist (MS Dynamics) (32595)
job.description:
Must haves:
 
  • Experience working in Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE and/or Finance & Operations (F&O) environments (or related CRM systems) particularly in a testing, data configuration, or sandbox context (e.g., managing user roles, creating records, validating workflows).
  • Experience with SharePoint teams sites for organizing, structuring and publishing digital content—such as building subpages, creating web parts and managing access and layout of knowledge repositories or internal learning portals.
  • Strong practical knowledge of creating and manipulating system data to support scenarios such as training simulations or testing use cases
  • Familiarity with documenting and organizing technical information, user guides, or system content that supports end-user learning—whether through task documentation, assignment instructions, or repository entries.
  • Detail-oriented with a structured approach to system task breakdowns and assignment creation, including the ability to align sandbox data to intended learning or testing outcomes.


*ROLE CONSISTS OF CHANGEMANAGEMNT & TRAINING




Scope
 
  • Support sandbox data preparation and environment setup for training and testing purposes within Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE and F&O.
  • Create role-based test case data, assignments and simulation scripts that align with business processes and test scenarios. 
  • Structure and maintain a SharePoint-based knowledge repository, including subpages, metadata, web parts, and layout. 
  • Develop technical documentation, assignment steps, and knowledge articles from system test cases, workflows, or process maps. 
  • Apply inclusive, plain language, user-centered design standards to all structured documentation and SharePoint content. 
  • Coordinate with training designers, developers, and project team members to ensure readiness of sandbox environments and digital assets. 
 

Assignment Deliverables
 
  • Assignment/test case scripts aligned to training objectives and sandbox role scenarios 
  • SharePoint knowledge base site with structured content, metadata, and web part layout 
  • Sandbox configuration guides and data entry protocols by user role 
  • Documentation and crosswalks mapping DevOps test cases to training use scenarios 
  • Content packages and structured folders with SharePoint-published knowledge objects 
  • Recorded walkthroughs or annotated guides for handover to internal teams 


Experience and Skillset Requirements
 
Mandatory Requirements
 
  • Experience working in Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE and/or Finance & Operations (F&O) environments (or related CRM systems) particularly in a testing, data configuration, or sandbox context (e.g., managing user roles, creating records, validating workflows).
  • Experience with SharePoint teams sites for organizing, structuring and publishing digital content—such as building subpages, creating web parts and managing access and layout of knowledge repositories or internal learning portals.
  • Strong practical knowledge of creating and manipulating system data to support scenarios such as training simulations or testing use cases
  • Familiarity with documenting and organizing technical information, user guides, or system content that supports end-user learning—whether through task documentation, assignment instructions, or repository entries.
  • Detail-oriented with a structured approach to system task breakdowns and assignment creation, including the ability to align sandbox data to intended learning or testing outcomes.


Desired Skills and Experience
 
  • Hands-on experience using Microsoft Dynamics CE and/or F&O environments, with a focus on test data entry, role simulation, and system validation
  • Demonstrated ability to interpret and transform technical documentation, business processes, and system workflows into structured training-aligned content
  • Proficiency in SharePoint Online site creation, page structuring, and web part configuration for training content delivery
  • Strong analytical skills for designing, reviewing, and preparing assignment data and testing logic
  • Knowledge of content tagging, organization, and user navigation best practices in internal learning repositories
  • Familiarity with plain language and AODA accessibility standards for digital and written content
 

Resumes Evaluation/Criteria:
 
Criteria 1: System Application & Sandbox Data Support - 40 Points
 
  • Demonstrated experience working in Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE and/or F&O sandbox or live environments to set up, configure, and manipulate system data.
  • Ability to generate and manage realistic training/test case data aligned to user roles and business processes.
  • Proficiency in logging in with multiple roles or profiles to simulate different user experiences and validate assignments.
  • Experience creating or supporting test cases, acceptance testing, or scripted simulation steps for training and testing purposes.

Criteria 2: SharePoint and Knowledge Content Structuring - 30 Points
 
  • Demonstrated experience designing, maintaining, and updating SharePoint Online sites, with a focus on web part configuration and subpage layout.
  • Ability to translate training and system documentation into SharePoint knowledge repositories for user access.
  • Skilled in content tagging, foldering and metadata application for ease of search and retrieval.
  • Strong organizational thinking to structure content that supports learner self-navigation and training reference.

Criteria 3: Technical and Documentation Skills - 20 Points
 
  • Skilled in reading and applying business processes, DevOps test cases and workflows to create structured content (e.g., assignment steps, simulation scripts).
  • Ability to draft clear, step-based documentation or “how-to” guides that align with technical system functionality.
  • Familiar with versioning, content updates and maintaining traceability across documents and systems.
  • Awareness of AODA and plain language writing principles in technical or system documentation.
 
Criteria 4: Collaboration and Communication - 10 Points
 
  • Comfortable working with cross-functional teams (training, IT, business) to ensure data accuracy and assignment readiness.
  • Strong communicator who can clarify technical questions or escalate data gaps or assignment logic issues.
  • Responsive to feedback and capable of iterating system inputs or content based on evolving training needs.
 

Knowledge Transfer
 
What needs to be KT
  • Finalized storyboards used for system training simulations, assignments, and knowledge artifacts
  • Sandbox data logic and configuration documentation, including any mapping between roles and test cases used to support training scenarios
  • SharePoint knowledge structure and content documentation, including site/page organization, web part configuration and tagging strategies
  • Assignment/test case crosswalks that show how training simulations align with DevOps test cases or system functions
 
To whom
  • Managers / Project Managers / Team members
 
When
  • 1:1 meetings / team meetings / documentation on SharePoint site, throughout the duration of the project life cycle etc.

job.title: Enterprise Systems Administrator II (32509)
job.description:
Job Title: Enterprise Systems Administrator II
Location: Dearborn, MI
Schedule: Daytime, full-time. Onsite 3x/week at 1 American Rd, Dearborn, MI 48126.
Pay Rate: Depending on experience and aptitude, $40-$50 per hour
Type: W2 Contract, 6 months with likely extension. We are unable to sponsor and cannot consider C2C candidates.  

Summary:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Jira Cloud Administrator to help manage and
maintain our Jira Cloud instance, ensuring optimal performance, security, and usability. The Enterprise Systems Administrator II will be responsible for all aspects of Jira Cloud administration, including project manipulation, workflow configuration, user access, and integration with other Atlassian tools. A solid understanding of Confluence administration is also desirable, and experience with Azure Identity and Access Management (IAM) is a plus. This role requires a proactive problem-solver with excellent communication skills and a passion for enabling teams to work efficiently.
 
What You'll Do:
  • Advise, Coach Technical Solutions, primary leveraging Jira and Confluence.
  • Actively participating with Vehicle Development Engineering / Operations Teams’ workflows and processes to gain firsthand insights into their usage patterns, challenges, and opportunities for improvement.
  • Support and Troubleshooting: Provide technical support to Jira Cloud users and troubleshoot issues in a timely and effective manner.
  • Jira Cloud Administration: Manage and maintain our Jira Cloud instance, including user management, permission schemes, custom fields, workflows, and screens.
  • Documentation and Education: Create and maintain documentation for Jira Cloud processes, configurations, and best practices. Develop and deliver training sessions for new and existing users along using documentation and training resources
  • Automation and Optimization: Implement and maintain Jira Cloud automation
  • rules to streamline workflows and improve efficiency.• Security Management: Implement and enforce Jira Cloud security best practices to protect data from unauthorized access and cyber threats.
  • Confluence Administration: Provide basic administration support for Confluence, including managing spaces, pages, and permissions.
  • Process Improvement: Actively identify areas for process improvement within Jira and Confluence environments. Analyze existing workflows and configurations to identify bottlenecks and inefficiencies. Develop and implement solutions to optimize processes, improve user experience, and enhance team productivity.
  • Identity Access Management (Desired): Support Jira user access controls – knowledge of single sign-on (SSO) and user provisioning is beneficial.
 
Minimal Qualifications:
  • 5+ years of experience administering Jira Cloud Suite (Jira Software, Jira Service Management [JSM]) in a professional environment with a Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Information Technology, Computer Science) or equivalent experience.
  • In-depth knowledge of Jira Cloud features, functionality, and best practices.
  • Experience with Jira Cloud automation tools.
  • Strong understanding of Jira Cloud security principles and practices.
  • Successful track record of advising enterprise teams on the best practices to leverage Jira to accomplish their business objectives.
  • Possess a learning mindset and curiosity and have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • The ability to convey complex technical information to non-technical audiences.
  • An effective relationship builder and able to influence without authority.
  • An eagerness to work cross-functionally in a dynamic environment where you are part of a high performing team.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
 
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Basic knowledge of Confluence administration.
  • Customer-centric focus, enjoying working directly with design and engineering to ship delightful products
  • A system approach with the desire and curiosity to strive for exceptional delivery execution and continuous improvement.
  • Knowledge of Agile methodologies (e.g., Scrum, Kanban).
  • Experience with user IAM (Azure AD / Entra ID)
  • Atlassian Certifications

job.title: EDW Medicaid Data Specialist (32543)
job.description:
EDW Medicaid Data Specialist

Job Title: EDW Medicaid Data Specialist

Duration: 12 months with possible multi-year extension/s

Location: Remote – Local Springfield, IL candidates strongly preferred.

This is a telecommute position with some (<15%) required travel to Springfield, IL for onsite customer meetings.

Functional Description: 

This position is a Medicaid Data Specialist for the Illinois Enterprise Data Warehouse supporting the State of Illinois Medicaid program. This role requires significant expertise of Medicaid Enterprise System modules and data warehousing or decision support systems. This role provides the guidance and direction to support a large data warehouse implementation and maintenance & operations. The selected candidate will provide the required decisions for the business and technical team members to modify, change, enhance or correct within the system, related to claims, provider, and recipient data. Roles in this function will partner with stakeholders to understand data requirements and support development and models such as interfaces, dashboards, data visualizations, decision aids and business case analysis to support the organization. Additional roles include producing and managing the delivery of activity, value analytics and critical deliverables to external stakeholders and clients.

This is a telecommute position with some (<15%) required travel to Springfield, IL for onsite customer meetings.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Provide data and information direction, guidance and recommendations supporting decision making for large Medicaid data warehouse implementation and operations.
  • With the specialized knowledge of the Medicaid and Children’s Health Insurance Programs, lead and guide internal and external stakeholders to make determinations relating to complex processes involving claims processing/adjudication, recipient/provider eligibility, and third-party liability.
  • Proactively identify and understand state Medicaid agency data needs and determine the recommended solution to meet them with credible reason, justification and validated proof of concepts.
  • Direct and train technical and business teams on healthcare topics understanding and utilizing healthcare data appropriately.
  • Proactively suggest and recommend enhancements and improvements throughout the project processes, driven by Medicaid best practices, standards and policies.

Required Qualifications:

  • More than ten (10) years of experience in information technology with five (5) years of the experience working directly with/for State Medicaid agencies or equivalent supporting business initiatives through data analysis, writing business requirements and testing/validation of various systems.
  • Understanding of claims, recipient/eligibility, and provider/enrollment data processes.
  • Able to create and perform data analysis using SQL, Excel against data warehouses utilizing large datasets.
  • Knowledge of the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services reporting requirements and the programs covered.
  • Excellent verbal/written communication and presentation skills, manager/executive/director-level client facing, team collaboration, and mentoring skills.
  • Strong culture fit, demonstrating our culture values in action (Integrity, Compassion, Inclusion, Relationships, Innovation, and Performance). May 2025 Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) Medicaid Data Specialist
  • Ability to travel to Springfield, IL two (3) to three (4) times per year.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master's Degree preferred
  • More than 2 years of experience working with PERM, T-MSIS, CMS Federal Reporting or similar projects
  • More than 2 years of experience in Adult/Child Core measures, HEDIS, CHIPRA or similar quality metrics
  • Experience with data analysis using Teradata Database Management System or other equivalent database management system.
  • Experience using JIRA, Rally, DevOps or equivalent.
  • Previous experience in large implementation projects.
  • Located within driving distance (3 - 5 Hours) of Springfield, IL.

job.title: Senior Network Architect (32577)
job.description:
We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Senior Network Architect with expertise in Segment Routing to join our dynamic and innovative team. As a Senior Network Architect, you will play a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and optimizing our network infrastructure, with a specific focus on segment routing technologies. Your deep understanding of network architecture, protocols, and best practices will contribute to the scalability, reliability, and performance of our network while ensuring alignment with business objectives.
The Sr. Network Architect is a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on all aspects of the LEO Network design and works with other LEO teams within Telesat and external contractors to ensure designs, implementation decisions, validation plans and documentation reflect the business requirements and objectives of the LEO program.

Main Responsibilities











 
  • Segment Routing Design and Implementation:
  • Participate in the design and implementation of segment routing solutions, ensuring optimal utilization of network resources and improved traffic engineering.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into effective network solution designs.
  • Develop strategies for partner business units to implement and manage network services implementations of segment routing architectures.
  • Network Architecture and Optimization:
  • Contribute to the architectural planning and evolution of the network, incorporating segment routing as a key technology.
  • Identify opportunities for optimization and enhanced performance using segment routing techniques, such as traffic steering, BSIDs and fast reroute mechanisms.
  • Perform network assessments and recommend improvements to maintain network health and operational efficiency.
  • Represent the LEO Network Engineering team by documenting and delivering network requirements to hardware and software development teams specifically in the areas of customer facing MEF 3.0 interface and networking design support requirements on data processing equipment
  • In coordination with Network team attend, contribute and produce materials for internal and external design and system engineering reviews for LEO Network Engineering related activities
  • Protocols and Standards:
  • Maintain a deep understanding of industry standards and protocols related to segment routing, such as IS-IS, BGP, and MPLS.
  • Stay updated with emerging trends and advancements in segment routing technologies, applying them to enhance network capabilities.
  • Troubleshooting and Problem Resolution:
  • Act as a subject matter expert, assist with complex network troubleshooting and incident resolution.
  • Collaborate with the LEO team to diagnose and address network behaviors and incidents in a timely manner, minimizing service disruptions.
  • Vendor and Solution Evaluation:
  • Evaluate new networking hardware, software, and solutions that align with segment routing strategies and network growth plans.
  • Collaborate with vendors to understand product roadmaps and provide feedback for feature enhancements.
  • Documentation and Knowledge Sharing:
  • Create and maintain detailed technical documentation, including network diagrams, configuration guidelines, and troubleshooting procedures related to segment routing.
  • Prepare and deliver materials including presentations, reference documentation and test strategies for LEO network equipment and applications deployment and operation
  • Share knowledge and mentor junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development.
  • With LEO Network Engineers develop and oversee plans including product idea investigations, proof of concept, Service validation and product demonstrations in Telesat LEO labs

Education and Experience

  • 10+ years of experience in carrier network design, operation and deployment
  • Broad experience or exposure across all areas of network related product design, development, verification, deployment and support
  • Understanding of Metro Ethernet Forum (MEF) standards and objectives as they relate to Carrier Ethernet Services.
  • Knowledge of routing and switching protocols, including BGP, OSPF, IS-IS, and MPLS.
  • Experience with network automation and scripting using tools such as Python, Ansible, or similar.
  • Strong troubleshooting skills and the ability to diagnose and resolve complex network issues.
  • Demonstrated leadership skills and the ability to guide and mentor junior engineers.
  • In-depth understanding of security principles and practices as they relate to network architecture.
  • Proven experience in network design, architecture, and optimization.
  • Professional certifications such as Cisco CCIE, Juniper JNCIE, or equivalent, are highly desirable.
  • Comfortable leading meetings and able to communicate issues and trends to senior management and other groups at the appropriate level of detail.
  • Excellent communication (verbal, written, presentation) and interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration abilities, with a proven track record of working effectively within cross-functional teams.
  • Communicates well with own team and across organizational boundaries to ensure the successful completion of shared goals.

job.title: Local to Irvine- Financial Analyst (32558)
job.description:
Job Title: Financial Analyst
Location: Irvine, CA – Hybrid Role
Contract Duration: 12 Months
Client: Myticas (Direct Client)

Job Summary:
Our direct client is seeking a skilled Financial Analyst for a 12-month hybrid contract position based in Irvine, CA. The successful candidate will support financial management processes, provide insights to leadership through detailed reporting, and ensure accuracy and compliance across various finance operations.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Monitor and manage multiple budget categories including capital plans, functional/run-the-business (RTB) budgets, business cost centers, and Latest Best Estimates (LBEs) to support leadership decision-making through financial reporting.

  • Track approved projects and authorized funding, reconcile cost centers, and manage project-related financials using SAP (required) and Microsoft Excel.

  • Process journal entry (JE) requests, manage purchase orders, and oversee Fixed Capital Deployment (FCD) extension and capitalization requests.

  • Collaborate with Procurement to ensure accuracy and compliance in Statements of Work (SOWs), and enforce Corporate Financial Management (CFM) policies and controls.

  • Oversee procurement workflows, reconcile vendor expenditures, and resolve invoice and billing issues with Accounts Payable.

  • Track capital expenditure approvals, support project close-out procedures and capitalization, and update financial forecasts and LBE data.

  • Partner with finance teams to support capital planning and RTB budget preparation.

  • Contribute to continuous process improvement and financial management optimization initiatives, including tool enhancements and pilot program support.

  • Lead or facilitate monthly and ad hoc financial review meetings, and assist teams in the preparation of Requests for Capital Expenditure (RCEs).

  • Maintain a comprehensive project portfolio, provide strategic financial insights, and ensure accuracy in forecasts and key financial metrics in collaboration with business and finance teams.

Required Skills and Experience:

  • 2–3 years of proven experience in financial reporting and analysis.

  • Prior experience in an analytical role supporting IT or business departments.

  • Proficiency with SAP for at least 2–3 years.

  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build and maintain professional relationships.

  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Smartsheet.

  • Experience working with remote teams and vendor partners.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  • Self-starter with a proactive mindset and strong problem-solving skills.

  • Collaborative team player with a strong work ethic and positive attitude.

  • Fluency in English is required.

  • Experience with Clarity is a plus.

job.title: D365 Finance Configuration Consultant (32537)
job.description:
Our client is in the build stage of a D365 Finance & Operations and Commerce implementation for a retail organization based in New Brunswick. The go-live is targeted for August 2026.

Role Overview:
We are seeking an experienced Finance Configuration Consultant with deep expertise in Microsoft D365 F&O. The ideal candidate will lead client-facing design sessions, provide hands-on system configuration, and support testing initiatives across the Finance workstreams.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Facilitate and lead finance-related design workshops

  • Configure the D365 F&O system to meet business requirements

  • Support client-side testing and validation activities

  • Collaborate with business stakeholders and technical teams

  • Provide input and expertise on best practices for D365 Finance implementations

Qualifications:

  • Hands-on configuration experience across core finance modules

  • Strong communication and client engagement skills

  • Microsoft certification in D365 Finance (asset)

  • Experience in retail or public sector projects (asset)

job.title: 100% Remote-Application Support Analyst W2 Only (W-6866) (32254)
job.description:
Application Analyst/Technical Support Specialist (Hands on with SQL)
Location: 100% Remote (Client Based in Madison, WI 53717)
Contract Type: Contract to Hire
Employment Type: W2 Only

Note: This is a fully remote position, requiring work during Central Time (CT) business hours (between 7 AM - 5 PM CT). Candidates from Eastern Time (ET) and Central Time (CT) zones are preferred. This role has the potential to transition to a permanent position.

Client is looking for candidates with strong SQL skills and can write and modify SQL themselves rather than just understanding how to use something that someone else hands them already written. 

Job Description

This role requires a deep understanding of technical customer service theories and principles, along with general knowledge of business and industry practices. The ideal candidate will work independently with minimal guidance, managing a full range of professional responsibilities and resolving complex technical issues. They will use advanced analytical, technical, and problem-solving skills to support post-implementation technical services, troubleshoot and resolve product-related issues, and contribute to the maintenance of applications and services. This role also involves collaborating with various internal teams to coordinate and implement solutions.

Responsibilities

  • Provide high-level technical support and assistance to customers and consultants using in-depth knowledge of technical customer service best practices.
  • Diagnose and resolve complex technical issues by analyzing multiple data sources and exercising sound judgment.
  • Identify and document defects in the tracking system for development team review and resolution.
  • Collaborate with internal escalation teams, development teams, and functional teams to resolve issues, explain technical challenges, and build consensus.
  • Implement and support advanced features and integrations of the CSC application suite to ensure data availability and efficient backend processes.
  • Write SQL queries to assist in troubleshooting application and data-related issues.
  • Troubleshoot application and interface-related problems and modify site configurations following best practices.

Experience & Skills Required

  • Education: Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
  • Experience: 5+ years of experience in a B2B technical customer service or implementation role.
  • Technical Skills:
  • Strong knowledge of cloud computing platforms such as Azure, Google Cloud, and AWS.
  • Expertise in database technologies, including Microsoft SQL Server and Oracle.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience working in a production support environment.
  • Prior experience with healthcare software and familiarity with healthcare industry regulations and standards.
  • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze and resolve complex issues.
  • Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills.
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
  • Open to constructive feedback and a collaborative team player.

This position requires a consultative and proactive approach, ensuring high-quality technical support and customer satisfaction. If you are a self-starter with strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, we encourage you to apply.

job.title: ITSM Specialist, Lead (Toronto or NorthBay) (32535)
job.description:
• Lead the design and review of IT best practice policy and procedure documentation to align with IT Service Management best practices.

• Collaborate with internal and external partners in the improvement/maintenance/development of processes and/or guides.

• Deliver coaching on transformation and cultural change in relation to the IT Service Management program; including facilitation of strategic planning to enable the team to plan and manage the required IT Service Management initiatives.

 


Skills
Experience and Skill Set Requirements

• Develop and lead cross-process compliance and design coordination within the operations team and cross-functionally throughout the organization. 

• Provide technical guidance to stakeholders to ensure that process standards are understood, process procedures and policies are adhered to, process activities are monitored and that best practice process activities are integrated accordingly. 

• Ensures documentation for I&IT best process procedures and protocols are drafted, ensuring their compatibility with the service management practices. 

• Provide advice and expertise to external vendors and senior management, to contribute to IT strategies and projects.

• Monitor compliance with agreements and ensure the timely identification and resolution of problems and issues.

• Provide expertise on all ITSM best practices and processes.

• Design, implement and work with the project team in completing all relevant and required documentation in alignment with OPS standards.

• Support the testing team during system and UAT testing.

• Participate in Knowledge transfer.

• IT Service Management process subject matter expertise, with experience in ITSM Best Practices (ITIL).

• Knowledge and experience in process design development and coordination across all organizational teams. 

• Experience in assisting with developing effective service delivery within Public Sector IT organizations.

• Experience effectively communicating strategic plans and providing guidance to senior management and extended supply chain (external vendors).

 

Criteria Ratings MUST TOTAL 100

Process Design Skills

40 points

• Knowledge of systems analysis, design, development, configuration, testing, release and installation principles and practices, methods, techniques, and tools for ITSM.

• Experience in designing processes for a public sector client, including the assessment of current state, and creation of supporting documentation and leadership for Continual Service Improvement reviews. 

• Experience in effectively conveying complex information to various stakeholders.

 

ITSM Process Skills

35 points

• Excellent in ITSM Processes including, but not limited to: Incident, Problem, Change, Configuration, Service Level, Service Catalogue, Service Portfolio, Business Relationship, Release and Deployment, Request, Fulfilment, IT Strategy and IT Asset Management. 

• Experience with knowledge management platforms (e.g., ServiceNow, Remedy) and how to create and organize documentation.

 

Documentation Skills

20 points

• Experience in template creation and review for all supporting Process artefacts.

• Experience translating technical information into clear, concise, and understandable language for a variety of audiences.

 

Public Sector Experience

5 points

• 5 Years of Experience.

 

Knowledge Transfer

• Codes

• Scripts

• Project Manager / Team members.

1:1 meetings / team meetings / documentation on SharePoint site, throughout the duration of the project life cycle etc.

 

MUST HAVES:

1. Experience working in service management for the OPS and/or other Public Sector Organizations

2. Demonstrate subject matter expertise in IT Service Management (ITSM) best practice

3. Have experience in design and review of IT best practice policy and procedure documentation to align with IT Service Management best practices

4. Have experience collaborating with internal and external stakeholders.

job.title: 100% Remote-.Net Developer W2 Only (W-2258) (32547)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client is seeking a Full stack .Net Developer for 100% REMOTE contract-to-hire opportunity.

Employment Type: W2 Only.

Job Description:

The Full-stack/C#.Net Developer works directly with UX , application specialists, and other software developers to improve our cloud-based SaaS solution. In addition, you will work with the engineering team to ensure a smooth migration to this new technology.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Write code and test automation as necessary to deliver features within a Scrum based environment.
  • Analyze story/task requirements and produce simple, maintainable code using OOP.
  • Collaborate with team members (UX, QA, DevOps) and other engineering teams to ensure features are delivered efficiently and with maximum impact. 

Experience & Skills Required:

Education: Bachelor of Science or equivalent job experience.
  • 5+ years of development experience or equivalent shipping web based applications (preferably in a SaaS environment)

job.title: FPGA Developer, Senior (32549)
job.description:
Overview:
A leading provider of real-time video processing technology is seeking a Senior FPGA Developer to join its core signal processing team. This group is responsible for developing high-performance media transport and processing systems used by global clients in live production, broadcast, and media environments.

This is an opportunity to work on cutting-edge, high-bandwidth systems built on advanced FPGA platforms—delivering critical real-time features that enable professional-grade media production. You’ll be surrounded by a highly experienced team that values innovation, collaboration, and practical problem solving.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement RTL for advanced real-time media systems with interfaces including memory, PCIe, and hardware-accelerated video processing.

  • Develop transport protocol implementations (e.g., SDI, SMPTE 2110) within FPGAs.

  • Collaborate on system architecture—reviewing schematics, optimizing clocking, thermal considerations, and FPGA resource allocation.

  • Perform full IO ring designs for leading FPGA families (e.g., Arria10, Stratix-10, Ultrascale+, Agilex).

  • Define and document high-level system requirements; support component selection and scheduling.

  • Create simulation testbenches (Verilog/SystemVerilog); perform functional verification and debugging.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with software, hardware, and manufacturing teams through the full product lifecycle.

  • Mentor peers and support technical knowledge sharing within the team.

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of hands-on FPGA design experience, preferably with exposure to video or audio systems.

  • Strong Verilog/SystemVerilog and scripting skills (TCL).

  • Experience with Intel and/or Xilinx FPGAs and their respective toolchains (Quartus, Vivado).

  • Familiarity with high-speed serial interfaces, DDR3/4, HBM, PLLs, and signal integrity principles.

  • Excellent debugging and validation skills; proficiency with lab tools (oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, WFMs, etc.).

  • Background in embedded systems (Linux, bash, C/C++) considered a plus.

  • Understanding of media production workflows and digital video standards (SMPTE, HDR, SDI) is advantageous.

  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced engineering environment.

job.title: Local to Michigan -Database Administrator-Hybrid (SOM-143628) (32545)
job.description:
Database Administrator
Location: Lansing, MI (Hybrid – On-site Tuesday and Wednesday)
Client: Myticas' Direct Client
Work Schedule: Hybrid (On-site two days per week – Tuesday and Wednesday)
Candidate Requirements: Local candidates only (within a two-hour radius of Lansing, MI). No remote-only option.

Top Skills & Years of Experience

  • Minimum of 8 years of professional experience in the field

  • Proficiency with Power BI Desktop, Power Query, DAX, and PowerBook tools

  • Experience with SQL Database ETL processes

  • Proficiency in SAS and SQL Data Modeling

  • Bachelor’s degree required

Job Summary

This position supports the Center for Educational Performance and Information (CEPI) database environment and serves as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for the modernization of Power BI reporting. The role requires substantial independent judgment in directing and coordinating data administration and management methods, practices, procedures, and tools to complete assignments effectively.

Expertise in Microsoft SQL Server database support is required, along with professional knowledge of the Power BI platform and SAS.

We are seeking a technically skilled and detail-oriented data professional to join our team on a temporary basis. The primary responsibility of this role is to collaborate with business users to understand the current utilization of Power BI, including identifying the data sources, databases, and tables supporting existing dashboards and reports.

A key focus of this position is to analyze and convert complex SAS programs into optimized SQL code that integrates seamlessly with Power BI, ensuring accuracy, performance, and adherence to best practices in data management.

The ideal candidate will demonstrate strong experience with SAS, SQL, and Power BI tools (including Power Query and DAX), be adept at documenting current-state processes, and identify opportunities for automation and efficiency. The candidate should also be capable of developing sustainable data pipelines and models. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders are essential, along with a proactive and customer-focused approach.

This is an excellent opportunity for someone who enjoys problem-solving, translating legacy code, and contributing to high-impact data reporting solutions.

Database Environment

  • Multiple SQL Server instances

  • Multiple collection environments (Development, Quality Assurance/Testing, Pre-Release, and Production)

  • Numerous SQL Reporting Services servers

  • More than 35 collection databases

  • Over 100 analysis databases

Job Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with business users to understand current Power BI usage, including identifying key dashboards, reports, data sources, and tables

  • Review and analyze existing SAS programs and convert them into optimized SQL code suitable for Power BI reporting

  • Apply advanced SAS and SQL knowledge to ensure logic accuracy, performance optimization, and data consistency across platforms

  • Assess and document current data processes, and recommend improvements and automation opportunities aligned with best practices

  • Work with stakeholders to identify data sources, ETL processes, and transformation logic critical to reporting needs

  • Build and maintain robust, sustainable data pipelines with a focus on clarity, performance, and long-term maintainability

  • Utilize Power BI Desktop, Power Query, DAX, and PowerBook tools to support data modeling, development, and visualization

  • Apply strong problem-solving skills to debug, validate, and optimize ETL and data transformation processes

  • Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical audiences, document processes, and collaborate across teams

  • Work independently in a temporary/contract role while delivering high-quality work with accuracy, attention to detail, and a customer-focused mindset

Additional Information

  • This is a hybrid role requiring on-site work in Lansing, MI, two days per week (Tuesday and Wednesday)

  • Only local candidates within a two-hour radius of Lansing, MI, will be considered

  • No remote-only option is available for this role

job.title: Business/Functional Analyst - SAP PP/DS & APO REQUIRED (31913)
job.description:
Business Analyst – SAP PP/DS & APO
Location: Remote
Contract Type: Contract or Contract-to-Hire
Client: Direct client in Grand Rapids, MI
Company: Clover Consulting (a Myticas Consulting Company)

Client needs a candidate with at least 1 full implementation of PP/DS at a manufacturing company, we’re looking specifically for someone who was a part of the design/implementation team through hypercare.

Position Overview

Clover Consulting is seeking a Business Analyst with expertise in SAP PP/DS & APO for a functional support role. This position requires strong interaction with users, coaching, and the ability to navigate SAP IMG configurations. Candidates must have experience translating business requirements into technical solutions.

SAP APO & PP/DS experience is essential, and familiarity with SAP S/4HANA is a plus.

Key Responsibilities

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Strong communication skills for collaboration at all organizational levels.
  • Ability to stay up to date with emerging technologies and best practices.

Education & Experience:

  • In-depth understanding of engineering, manufacturing, and order fulfillment processes.
  • Strong knowledge of how assigned business processes integrate into global and regional value streams.

Preferred Experience:

If you meet the above qualifications and are looking for an exciting opportunity in a functional SAP Business Analyst role, apply today!

job.title: Local to Michigan -Sr Window System Administrator -Hybrid (SOM-143424) (32521)
job.description:
Senior Windows System Administrator
Location: Lansing, MI (Hybrid – On-site Tuesday and Wednesday)

Client: Myticas' Direct Client
Work Schedule: Hybrid (On-site two days per week – Tuesday and Wednesday)
Candidate Requirements: Local candidates only (within 2 hours of Lansing, MI). No remote-only option.

Position Summary:
Our direct client in Lansing, MI, is seeking a Senior Windows System Administrator to join their team on a hybrid basis. This role requires a highly skilled and experienced professional to perform a wide range of system administration tasks, including installation, configuration, maintenance, and security of systems and application components across both Windows and Linux environments.

The ideal candidate will collaborate with vendors, customers, and internal technical teams to ensure secure and reliable operation of applications and infrastructure. The position will also support various COTS and SaaS applications, configure changes as needed, and maintain compliance with Federal, State, and industry security standards.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Install and configure systems and application components in Windows and Linux environments.

  • Gather and document requirements; research, analyze, and present solution options for both ongoing application changes and new initiatives.

  • Ensure security and compliance of applications and infrastructure in accordance with Federal, State, and industry standards.

  • Collaborate with vendors, customers, and technical teams to implement projects and changes in a timely manner.

  • Maintain and support COTS applications and assist in configuring changes for SaaS products.

  • Remediate vulnerabilities and provide proactive monitoring and maintenance for systems and networks.

  • Create architectural diagrams and documentation to support application and infrastructure initiatives.

Required Skills and Experience:

Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in:

  • Installing and configuring systems and application components on Windows and Linux environments.

  • Gathering and documenting requirements; analyzing and recommending solutions for application and infrastructure improvements.

  • Using the following tools and technologies:

  • Windows Server Administration (2016 and later)

  • Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 7.0 and above

  • Cloud Infrastructure: Azure, AWS, or GCP

  • Tomcat, IIS

  • Microsoft SQL Management Studio

  • Dynatrace or similar debugging tools

  • XML, PowerShell, Azure DevOps, Visio

  • Single Sign-On (SSO) protocols: SAML, OAuth, OpenID

  • Network knowledge: LAN/WAN, architecture, firewalls, IoT

  • Performing analytical tasks with extensive experience in monitoring and supporting Windows and Linux operating systems, networks, firewalls, and architecture.

    Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in:

    • Implementing and configuring applications in Azure Cloud infrastructure.

    • Proficiency in Azure services, containerization, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC).

    Additional Information:

    • This is a hybrid role requiring on-site work in Lansing, MI, two days per week (Tuesday and Wednesday).

    • Only local candidates within a two-hour radius of Lansing will be considered.

    • There is no remote-only option for this role.

  • Minimum of 2 years supporting the development of or compliance with the statement of work and/or other work agreements/contracts.
  • Minimum of 2 years working on projects developing/implementing IT solutions for public use.
  • Minimum of 1 year working on IT infrastructure projects.
  • Minimum of 1 year working with programs governed by state and/or federal regulations.

Job Summary

Looking for a Business Analyst 4 to provide excellent customer service supporting both project and work request needs. This person will have the opportunity to join in-flight projects focused on implementing new IT solutions to provide increased efficiencies and public support. These IT solutions leverage current technologies and include working with subject matter experts, vendors, and the public.

Responsibilities:

  • Key responsibilities include being the liaison between the Client and the project stakeholders, as well as providing expert facilitation and elicitation to help develop strategy and requirements for future enhancements and related work projects.
  • In addition, as part of the overall support for Agency Partners, this person will be a critical member of the Client’s Agency Services Business Analyst team, participating in various related work requests and contributing to the operational activities of the BA team.
  • The ideal candidate will possess client process experience, strong facilitator experience for requirements elicitation, experience with gap fit analysis, and requirements refinement for an in-flight project.
  • Customer service and being a champion to ease Agency compliance with clients’ policies and practices are key performance expectations for this person.

job.title: Manager, Automation Tools Software Development (32337)
job.description:
Manager, Automation Tools Software Development

Overview

We are seeking a Manager, Automation Tools Software Development to lead a team in delivering cutting-edge automation projects that support IP professional services for our customers. The ideal candidate will combine strong leadership skills with deep technical expertise in automation, IP/MPLS, and software development.

Responsibilities

  • Lead and mentor a team of software developers, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and technical excellence.
  • Define technical roadmaps, set development priorities, and oversee project execution to ensure timely and high-quality delivery.
  • Work closely with architects and senior engineers to design and implement scalable automation solutions.
  • Drive technical decision-making and resolve complex design challenges.
  • Own, design, and implement new software features while ensuring code quality and maintainability.
  • Identify and address system performance bottlenecks and scalability challenges.
  • Oversee root cause analysis of system issues and implement long-term solutions.
  • Ensure the creation of high-quality software documentation and actively participate in requirements, design, and code reviews.

Qualifications

  • Minimum of 7+ years of experience in software development, with at least 2 years in a leadership or management role.
  • Strong background in telecom and IP/MPLS domain, particularly in service provider environments.
  • Proven ability to lead software development teams and drive project success.
  • Proficiency in Python (preferred), Java, C#, or Jinja, with a track record of writing clean, reliable, and maintainable code.
  • Excellent debugging, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills.
  • Advanced knowledge of IP networking solutions including IPv4, IPv6, routing, switching, MPLS, L2VPN, L3VPN, QoS, multicast, BNG, CGNAT, redundancy.
  • Experience with web development (PHP, JavaScript, HTML5), Linux, and virtualization.
  • Strong familiarity with automation frameworks such as StackStorm, Ansible, Jenkins.
  • Knowledge of containerization (Docker), infrastructure automation (Chef, Ansible), and cloud platforms (OpenStack, SDN).
  • Experience with SCM tools like Git and non-relational databases (MongoDB is a plus).
  • Ability to balance hands-on technical work with strategic planning and team leadership.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience working with orchestration platforms, workflow automation (Mistral), and large-scale system integrations.
  • Previous experience in managing distributed teams and working in agile environments.
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to interface with stakeholders across technical and business teams.

This role offers an exciting opportunity to drive innovation and automation in a dynamic telecom environment while leading a talented team. If you’re passionate about automation, networking, and leadership, we encourage you to apply!
