job.title: Teradata DBA (32423)
job.description:
Title: Teradata DBA Database Administrator

Location: REMOTE

Type: Contract

Duration: 1 years with high probability of multi-year extensions

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Creating, maintaining, and supporting Teradata architectural environment
  • Working with creation of databases, tables, views, users, and granting them access
  • Working with the development teams with design, implementation, and performance tuning of new and existing applications
  • Performing database backup and recovery operations
  • Developing of pro-active processes for monitoring capacity and performance tuning
  • Supporting the application development teams for database needs and guidance
  • Providing day to day support for the EDW users problems like job hands, slowdowns, inconsistent rows, re-validating headers for tables with RI constraints, PPIs and configuration
  • Supporting Teradata patch and upgrades collaborating with Teradata team and interfacing with the application sub vendors
  • Supporting backup and restore/retrieval process – using the BAR DSA and NetBackup. Create, implement, and maintain BAR strategy for the Teradata (TD) application and system databases
  • Maintaining rules set in TASM and supporting workload management. Maintaining the Teradata Workload Manager with the proper partitions and workloads based on Service Levels
  • Supporting the database system and application server support for the Disaster Recovery (DR) build/test, annual drill, and quarterly maintenance as needed
  • Actively monitoring the health of the Teradata system and Teradata Managed Servers (TMS) using Viewpoint and other tools and application servers and make preventive or corrective actions as needed
  • Maintaining access rights, role rights, priority scheduling, and reporting using dynamic workload manager, Database Query Log (DBQL), usage collections and reporting of ResUsage, AmpUsage, security administration etc.
  • Coordinating with the team and customers in supporting database needs and make necessary changes to meet the business, contractual, security, performance, and reporting needs
  • Supporting internal or external audit process and address vulnerabilities or risk proactively. Prepare and support IRS audit
  • Coordinating with Teradata to perform Teradata system hardening and delivery SCSEM Reports as needed addressing issues in the hardening and vulnerability scan report
  • Generating and maintaining capacity management, Space, and CPU reports on analyzing the Spool, CPU, I/O, Usage, and Storage resources and proactive monitoring to meet performance and growth requirements
  • Reviewing and resolving Teradata alerts and communicate any risk / issues or impact to the management, team, and business users through appropriate communication strategy
  • Creating Teradata incident on issues, tracking using TAYS, setting appropriate priorities, monitoring and controlling, and work with Teradata to resolve the issues promptly
  • Performing additional duties that are normally associated with this position, as assigned

Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
  • 5+ years of experience as a Teradata DBA on Version 14+
  • 5+ years of SQL experience
  • 3+ years ETL using Teradata Utilities in a Unix/Linux environment
  • 3+ years performance tuning in a large database (>5TB) or data warehouse environment, using advanced SQL, DBQL and Explain plans
  • 3+ years analyzing project requirements and developing detailed database specifications
  • 3+ years identifying and initiating resolutions to customer problems and concerns associated with a
  • Data Warehouse or equivalent system

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 3+ years identifying and initiating resolutions to customer problems and concerns associated with a Data Warehouse or equivalent system
  • 5+ years logical and physical data modeling experience
  • 5+ years with Erwin or other data modeling software
  • 3+ years working with end users/customers to understand requirements for technical solutions to meet business needs
  • 3+ years working with technical developers to strategize solutions to align with business requirements
  • 3+ years defining standards and best practices and conducting code reviews
  • Experience in Application Server Hardware/Software Administration (Windows/Linux)
  • Experience in SharePoint
  • Knowledge in ETL process, Unix, and Windows Scripting
  • Knowledge/Experience in Agile
  • Excellent verbal/written communication, end client facing, team collaboration, and mentoring skills
  • Ability to proactively learn and support overall system administration, support hardware/software maintenance, and leading data management activities
  • Training developers in how best to design queries for a specific database
  • Working with lead / management, business users, SMEs/BA, developers, application administrators, architect/modelers, and coordinating with hardware / software sub vendors
  • Installing, configuring and administering Microsoft SQL Server on Windows Server
  • Performing application servers backups and recovery using Veritas Backup Exec 2012/above
  • Analyzing IBM Tivoli logs and responds to alerts and errors
  • Monitoring of SAN storage with the knowledge and ability to react to alerts and errors
  • Configuring and managing HP MSA Storage arrays
  • Installing, configuring and administering Windows Server 2008 R2 or higher platforms on HP DLT

job.title: Local to Chicago - IT Project Manager (A-30018) (32435)
job.description:
Myticas' direct client is seeking an experienced IT Project Manager for a 6-month contract position in North Chicago, IL.

Description:

  • Develop, execute, and manage multiple IT projects within their defined scope(s).
  • Manage a multitude of interrelated project activities and lead all aspects of the project lifecycle, working with project sponsors/key stakeholders, team members, and management to oversee all phases of project completion.
  • Build and manage project’s work peakdown structure, milestones, risks, issues, and deliverables within the constraints of human and financial resources and changing priorities to ensure the successful completion of the project.
  • Ensure transparent reporting of project status, issues, risks, and financials.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Initiate and Plan Project: Works with business and IT management to establish and gain consensus on project goals, objectives, financials and deliverables. Responsible for building the plan and resource needs to accomplish the scope.
  • Project Control: Assess the degree to which changes to scope, issues and risks will affect the project working with business and IT management and sponsor to gain agreement for resolution. Measure performance to assure the project is progressing as compared to original plan and budget.
  • Executing and Closing Project: Develops and executes a work plan obtaining authorized resources to ensure all activities are performed. Leads team in delivering project scope. Gather lessons learned and obtain final project approval from sponsor and stakeholders.
  • Project Communication: Communicate project progress by producing project reports to provide timely and accurate program status and decision support information to project teams, business, and IT management. Makes recommendations based on current project status to resolve issues and manage risks.
  • Resource and Team Management: Coordinate resources to ensure project needs are addressed and effectively assign tasks and deliverables to team members based upon their abilities. Motivates project team in order to deliver project outcomes.
  • Quality Management: Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and functional policies and procedures.
  • Decisions: Make decisions that impact project level activities. Influences or has final decision authority for project budget.
  • Financial Control: Develops and manages a financial plan with multi-million dollar spend. Tracks actual spend, accruals, proactively creates spend estimates on a regular basis (at least monthly) and coordinates estimates and invoices with project vendors, in order to maintain spend at +/- 10% of the overall project budget.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Systems/Computer Science or related discipline.
  • Proven Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word skills are required.
  • 5-10 years of experience in project management.
  • Experience managing SDLC projects.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • PMP Certification
  • PPM Tool experience
  • Pharmaceutical experience
  • Experience managing projects to deliver or enhance validated systems.

job.title: Local to AR-Logistics Claims Specialist (T-5650) (32422)
job.description:
Job Title: Logistics Claims Specialist (Contract)

Location: Springdale, AR 72762 (on-site role)

Work Shift: 08:00AM- 05:00PM

Pay Rate: $17-18/hr on W2

NOTE:  W2 only!

Job Description:

The Specialist diligently maintains and updates worklists in High Radius, conducting daily audits for accuracy, which is then reported the following business day in Power BI reports. These reports are scrutinized by Shipping locations and Transportation, making the data generated by the Specialist a foundational element in our key performance indicators (KPIs) for the Distribution division scorecards. This emphasizes the critical importance of accuracy and timeliness for the organization's overall success.

REQUIREMENTS Education:

  • High school diploma or equivalent required.
  • Candidate with and/or currently pursuing a BA degree is a plus.

Experience:

  • Minimum of 1 year of office clerical experience required, 3 years preferred.
  • Prior experience in a Logistics is highly valuable, particularly in handling OS&D claims or customer service.
  • Experience in data collection and analysis is advantageous.

Communication Skills:

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills are essential.
  • Professional phone skills for interacting with both internal company contacts and external vendors and customers.
  • Excellent negotiation skills to effectively manage and resolve third-party OS&D carrier claims.
  • Ability to convey complex information clearly and concisely to various stakeholders.
  • Skilled in managing conflict and addressing concerns diplomatically.
  • Proficient in crafting detailed and accurate reports and documentation.
  • Effective follow-up skills to ensure timely and accurate resolution of issues with various parties involved.

Computer Skills:

  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
  • Experience with High Radius system.
  • Proficiency in navigating and interpreting Power BI reports.
  • Experience with SAP Transportation Management (SAP TM); TES (Transportation Execution System); and DB2 Sessions.
  • Experience working with call center technology and answering systems, including software such as Five9.

Special Skills:

  • Motivated self-starter with a strong desire to learn and grow.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to manage time effectively.
  • Strong multitasking abilities and interpersonal skills.
  • Confident in making fact-based decisions through critical thinking and standing by those decisions.
  • Proven ability to analyze information, evaluate options, and implement solutions effectively.
  • Self-reliant with the capability to self-audit for any errors or discrepancies in work to ensure accuracy and quality.
  • Highly organized with the ability to thrive in a high-volume, fast-paced role.
  • Consistently focused on timely execution and quick decision-making
  • Maintain a high level of confidentiality.

job.title: Local to MI-Dynamics 365 Systems Architect (32421)
job.description:
Job Opportunity: Dynamics 365 Systems Architect
Location: Lansing, MI
Type: Hybrid Contract

Myticas’ direct client in Indianapolis, Indiana, is seeking a highly skilled Dynamics 365 Systems Architect to join their team on a contract basis.

Position Overview

The Dynamics 365 Systems Architect will provide application development and integration services to the Department of Technology, Management and Budget, supporting the following agencies:

  • Michigan Department of Civil Rights (MDCR)
  • Michigan Civil Service Commission (MCSC)
  • Michigan Department of Lifelong Education, Advancement, and Potential (MiLEAP)

The selected candidate will be responsible for the design, development, maintenance, and enhancement of agency applications. Project work will be conducted within the framework of the State of Michigan’s System Engineering Methodology (SEM). Responsibilities include the development, testing, and deployment of application releases, updates, and modifications in both client/server and web server environments.

Key Responsibilities

  • Provide advanced technical support for the Dynamics 365 platform.
  • Lead and perform project tasks including requirements gathering, planning, analysis, design, testing, implementation, documentation, and maintenance.
  • Oversee Dynamics 365 and Power Platform implementations.
  • Design and document technical architecture solutions that span multiple platforms, including systems integration and authentication.
  • Manage CI/CD and release processes for Dynamics 365-related technologies.
  • Identify and mitigate technical risks and issues.
  • Prepare detailed documentation and reports.
  • Communicate technical concepts effectively to various audiences.
  • Resolve complex problems under pressure and in high-stress environments.
  • Provide technical customer service support.

Required Skills and Experience

  • 5+ years of experience with Dynamics 365 and Power Platform implementations
  • 5+ years of architecture experience
  • 3+ years of experience with Power Platform solutions, particularly Power Automate and Power Pages
  • 5+ years of experience with Azure DevOps
  • 3+ years of database architecture experience
  • 5+ years of experience in infrastructure/network and application support
  • Experience designing and documenting technical architecture solutions across platforms
  • Experience with CI/CD and release/change management processes
  • Familiarity with Azure services and Azure communications
  • Experience working with APIs
  • Proficient with Microsoft Project, Excel, and PowerPoint
  • Strong written and oral communication skills
  • Proven ability to gather and analyze requirements and deliver optimal solutions
  • 5+ years of experience as a Technical Customer Service Analyst
  • Extensive experience with Microsoft Dynamics, Microsoft Azure, and application support (5+ years)

job.title: Network Engineer (31871)
job.description:
Job Purpose:

As a Network Engineer, you will be responsible for verifying data integrity, supporting hardware and software upgrades, and ensuring the seamless integration of network equipment, primarily the 7750, 7705, 7250, and IXR series. You will apply your extensive technical expertise to troubleshoot, validate procedures, and ensure operational efficiency during customer deployments.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Perform data integrity checks for 7750, 7705, and 7250 IXR nodes in preparation for integration and software upgrades.
  • Report any discrepancies to customers through chain management.
  • Execute tasks following approved Method of Procedures (MOPs) and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
  • Validate and update MOPs, SOPs, and data templates as necessary for equipment integration and deployment.
  • Prepare MOPs for safe software upgrades on customer equipment; resolve scripting issues and support internal teams during maintenance activities.
  • Troubleshoot software issues, resolve faults, and upgrade network equipment using Command Line Interface (CLI) and graphical user interfaces (GUI).
  • Apply QoS standards to analyze and optimize network performance.
  • Develop and build router configuration files to support customer requirements.

Other Responsibilities:

  • Provide ongoing support for 7750, 7705, 7210, and IXR router elements.
  • Manage software upgrades, implementation, and integration maintenance for customer networks.
  • Deliver IPv6 telecommunications traffic migration services.
  • Use proprietary software tools and execute set procedures to meet customer deliverables.
  • Escalate any quality issues to improve the overall customer experience.
  • Create detailed technical documentation, including MOPs for Field Technicians.
  • Apply strong analytical skills to troubleshoot and resolve network connectivity issues.

Qualifications:

  • Hands-on experience with routers.
  • certifications such as NRS I or NRS II (NRS II preferred).
  • Proficiency in IP, MPLS, Segment Routing, ISIS, and OSPF protocols.

Performance Expectations:

  • Consistently meet project deadlines and ensure high-quality service delivery.
  • Ensure all software and hardware upgrades are completed efficiently with minimal disruption.
  • Maintain effective communication with the customer, escalating any issues promptly.

job.description:
Senior Instructional Designer

Job Description:
Myticas’s direct client is seeking a Senior Instructional Designer  with extensive experience in developing multimedia-rich courses, proficient in tools such as Articulate Rise, Adobe Photoshop, Premiere, After Effects, Canva, Tech Smith Camtasia, and SharePoint. With over five years of experience in designing educational eLearning products (Video Base Learning, Microlearning Videos and eLearning/SCROM Course), the candidate should have a strong grasp of how to integrate various media elements based on different learning styles.

Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for creating content thumbnails and conducting content tests with subject matter experts and test subjects to ensure the learning material is sound.
  • Once courses are completed, they will upload the SCORM files to our Learning Management System (LMS) and educational videos to our video repository.
  • The role also includes uploading links and thumbnails to content on our internal SharePoint pages, making necessary edits to improve engagement, and ensuring the learning flow is seamless.
  • Organizing materials effectively is crucial to enhance the user experience for our learning audience.
  • The candidate will be responsible for updating the SharePoint page dedicated to communicating our educational material and assisting in writing content for internal communications (Teams Channels and LMS Communication Areas) about new projects that are launched.

Additionally, the candidate will be tasked with updating internal SharePoint pages with relevant links and content, ensuring materials are organized to enhance user experience for our learning audience. Their role will also involve writing content for internal communications about newly launched projects, aiding in the dissemination of information across the organization.

Strong organizational skills are essential, as the candidate will track project progress and regularly update the Associate Director of Learning and Development. This position reports to the Manager of Learning and Development, AI and Digital Upskilling.

job.title: Local IN only- AWS/Cloud Architect (SOI-1674) (32410)
job.description:
Job Opportunity: Local AWS/Cloud Architect

Location: Indianapolis, IN

Type: Hybrid Contract

 

Myticas' direct client in Indianapolis, Indiana, is looking for a highly skilled Local AWS/Cloud Architect to join their team on a contract basis.

 

Job Summary:

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of designing and delivering innovative cloud solutions, optimizing DevOps practices such as CI/CD pipelines, and managing vendor collaborations. This role involves working closely with agency solution architects, developers, stakeholders, and Indiana Office of Technology architects on key projects, including HEARTS, EPP, and Gateway Cloud Migration. The candidate will also be responsible for securely setting up environments to meet FedRAMP or GovRAMP compliance standards.

 

Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Design, implement, and manage cloud solutions in Microsoft Azure and Amazon Web Services (AWS) with a focus on large-scale projects.
  • Architect and deploy scalable, secure cloud infrastructure.
  • Set up environments securely in compliance with FedRAMP or GovRAMP standards, ensuring adherence to regulatory requirements.
  • Collaborate with software development teams to integrate CI/CD pipelines using DevOps practices.
  • Lead the design and implementation of cloud solutions for complex projects, ensuring robust performance and reliability.
  • Oversee cloud migration projects, including the internal HEARTS, EPP, and Gateway Cloud Migration, in collaboration with vendors.
  • Optimize cloud infrastructure for performance and cost efficiency.
  • Develop and enforce cloud governance frameworks to ensure compliance with organizational policies and standards.
  • Monitor cloud environments, troubleshoot issues, and ensure high availability and disaster recovery.
  • Implement security best practices and compliance measures in cloud systems.
  • Design disaster recovery strategies and backup systems to ensure business continuity.
  • Provide technical guidance and mentorship to team members on cloud and DevOps-related topics.
  • Manage vendor relationships to ensure seamless delivery and performance of cloud solutions.
  • Stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies to enhance cloud solutions.
  • Oversee cloud cost optimization and budgeting to deliver efficient, cost-effective solutions.
  • Utilize monitoring and logging tools to track performance and detect potential issues early.
  • Collaborate with agency solution architects, developers, stakeholders, and Indiana Office of Technology architects to ensure alignment with business objectives.

 

Required Skills and Experience:

  • 10+ Years of hands-on experience in cloud architecture and DevOps practices
  • 10+ Years of exceptional expertise in Azure and AWS cloud environments and services, with demonstrated success in implementing large-scale projects
  • 10+ Years of strong experience in designing and implementing CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, or Azure DevOps
  • 10+ Years of demonstrated success in delivering cloud solutions for complex and large-scale projects
  • 5+ Years of experience in securely setting up cloud environments to meet FedRAMP or GovRAMP compliance standards
  • 5+ Years of proficiency in infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation
  • 7+ Years of strong understanding of networking, security, and database management in cloud environments
  • 7+ Years of solid scripting skills (e.g., Python, Bash, or PowerShell)

 

Education & Soft Skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills to articulate complex technical concepts to diverse audiences
  • Effective interpersonal skills for working in cross-functional teams and interacting with stakeholders
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to address challenges and innovate within cloud environments
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities effectively
  • Exceptional ability to present solutions and align technology goals with business objectives

 

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect or Microsoft Azure Architect Expert
  • Experience with containerization tools (Docker) and orchestration platforms (Kubernetes)
  • Familiarity with Agile development practices

job.title: Partner/Managing Director (31881)
job.description:
Overview: 
We are seeking a seasoned professional with expertise in investment operations, technology transformation, and process optimization to serve as a Partner or Managing Director. This role is ideal for individuals with a strong consulting background who work extensively with wealth and asset managers to optimize business operations within alternative and diversified investments.

Responsibilities:
1. Investment Operations & Process Optimization
   - Lead initiatives to streamline and enhance business processes for wealth and asset management clients, focusing on private equity, real estate, and credit funds.
   - Oversee both front and back-office operational tools, including fund accounting systems such as Geneva, Investran, LemonEdge, Allvue, and Yardi.

2. Technology Transformation & Target Operating Models (TOM)
   - Drive technology transformation projects to achieve optimal Target State Operating Models (TOM), improving business performance and supporting long-term operational goals.
   - Guide the selection and implementation of CRM systems, with a preference for experience with Salesforce or similar platforms.

3. Advisory & Financial Services Expertise
   - Utilize extensive consulting experience to advise clients on the alignment of financial and operational strategies.
   - Provide strategic insights on alternative and diversified investments, leveraging a deep understanding of equities and other asset classes.

4. Stakeholder Engagement & Solution Delivery
   - Partner with wealth and asset managers across major investment companies to develop tailored solutions for operational and technology enhancements.
   - Deliver comprehensive recommendations that support clients in meeting industry standards, regulatory requirements, and organizational goals.

Qualifications:
- Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Management Information Systems (MIS), Business, or a related field.
- Extensive knowledge and experience in alternative and diversified investments, equities, and financial advisory services.
- Proficiency in fund accounting systems, including Geneva, Investran, LemonEdge, Allvue, and Yardi.
- Proven expertise in technology transformation, process improvements, and TOM (Target Operating Models).
- Hands-on experience with Salesforce or similar CRM tools.
- A consulting background with a successful track record in optimizing business processes for wealth and asset management clients.

job.title: Hybrid-DevOps Engineer-W2 Only (W-2741) (32355)
job.description:
Mytica's direct client is seeking DevOps Developer/Engineer for a contract-to-hire opportunity - Hybrid at Madison, WI (need to be onsite at least 1day per week). 


W2 Contract Only, temp-to-hire role

Job Description:
We are seeking a passionate technologist to join our DevOps team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in managing and optimizing our processes, ensuring seamless integration and deployment of software solutions.

Responsibilities
  • Build and maintain automation scripts and infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools such as Terraform, Ansible, or similar
  • Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues to ensure high availability and reliability of production environments
  • Design, implement, and manage CI/CD pipelines to streamline the software development lifecycle using a wide variety of commercial and open-source technologies
  • Implement security best practices, certificate-based security and secret management
  • Collaborate with development, QA and IT teams to ensure smooth and reliable delivery of software applications

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
  • Proven experience in a DevOps or related role
  • Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC) tools like Terraform
  • Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes
  • Strong knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and tools such as TeamCity or Jenkins
  • Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure
  • Experience with SaaS solutions (custom applications using .NET and Java)
  • Proficiency in scripting languages such as Bash, PowerShell, or Python
  • Understanding of configuration management tools such as Ansible, Puppet, or Chef
  • Solid understanding of IT- including servers, storage, Windows and Linux, networking, DNS, Firewalls, routing
  • Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, communication and collaboration abilities
Bonus Qualifications
  • Knowledge of monitoring and logging tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, or ELK stack
  • Experience with Virtualization and Cloud Computing (VMWare, Azure)
  • Experience with data analytics platforms/business intelligence (preferably Sisense)
  • Experience with deployment automation tooling such as Octopus Deploy
  • Experience with Microsoft SQL Server
  • Understanding of Single-Sign-On setup and configuration (Ping Federate, OIDC, ADFS, Okta).
  • Understanding of application and system telemetry.

job.title: Hybrid Work-Accounting Manager-CPA (W-7802) (32322)
job.description:
Position: Accounting Manager

Location & Work Arrangement

  • Multiple locations: Philadelphia, PA; Waltham, MA; Baltimore, MD & Riverwoods, IL
  • Hybrid work model (2-3 days onsite required)
  • Contract to Hire opportunity
  • W2 employment only

Position Overview The Accounting Manager will lead accounting and reporting efforts, demonstrating critical thinking, meticulous attention to detail, and proactive management of complex accounting scenarios. The role requires expertise in general ledger management, team leadership, and month-end close processes within a 3-5 day timeline.

Key Responsibilities

  • Drive month-end close and reporting processes according to established timelines
  • Lead and supervise accounting team members
  • Review and approve general ledger transactions with accuracy and timeliness
  • Manage preparation of balance sheet reconciliations (monthly/quarterly/semi-annual)
  • Support external and internal audits with documentation and professional interaction
  • Maintain and update process documentation and desktop procedures
  • Oversee completion of month-end close checklists and reporting requirements
  • Conduct analysis for process improvement opportunities
  • Coordinate effectively with accounting team and third-party service providers
  • Provide mentorship and feedback to improve team performance

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Business Administration (Master's in Accounting preferred)
  • CPA certification or actively pursuing certification preferred
  • 7-9 years of accounting/audit experience (public or private)
  • 2-3 years of managerial experience
  • Proficiency in major ERP systems (SAP, Great Plains, NetSuite)
  • Experience with Blackline
  • Advanced Microsoft Office Suite skills
  • Strong data analysis and reporting capabilities

Technical Competencies

  • Month-end close process management
  • General ledger expertise
  • Journal entry preparation and review
  • Balance sheet account reconciliations
  • Bank reconciliations
  • Intercompany accounting
  • Audit support and compliance
  • International accounting experience (preferred)

Professional Skills

  • Demonstrated leadership and team management abilities
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical capabilities
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Strong project management skills
  • Detail-oriented with focus on accuracy
  • Adaptable to changing business requirements
  • Proactive approach to problem identification and resolution

Work Requirements

  • Flexible schedule during month-end close periods
  • Ability to coordinate with team members across multiple time zones
  • Minimal travel may be required
  • Capability to work both remotely and in-office

Additional Preferences

  • Project management certification or experience
  • International accounting experience
  • Experience with process improvement initiatives

This position offers an opportunity to join a dynamic organization with potential for growth and development in a professional accounting environment.

job.title: 100% Remote - Drupal Developer (ANL) (32279)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client based out of Lemont, IL is currently seeking a Drupal Developer for an 100% Remote contract position.

TOP 3 skills:

  1. Drupal development experience.
  2. PHP, JavaScript, HTML/CSS experience.
  3. Database development experience with MySQL, SQL Server, or Oracle experience.

Description

The ideal candidates will need to perform investigation and analysis of business requirements, establish requirements and objectives of computerized solution in web content management and related systems; prepare detailed software development agile artifacts such as Stories and Testing/Scrum Tasks, and recommend methodologies necessary to accomplish plan. In addition, candidates will consult with product manager and product owner on planning and monitoring of work.

  • Develop tools and functionality for web content management and related systems.
  • Work with a scrum team to develop the services with an Agile Scrum practice and mindset.
  • Develop components that leverage community-built functionality where possible and complex programming where appropriate.
  • Provide the experience for authentication and web services integrations.
  • Mentor others in developing strategies and execution.
  • Develop test plans and deployment procedures for assigned work.
  • Interface with code repository and CI/CD pipeline.
  • Conduct business analysis and create workflow diagrams and implement those workflows. 

Job Qualifications:

  • Minimum 8 years’ experience.
  • Drupal development experience.
  • PHP, JavaScript, HTML/CSS experience.
  • Database development experience with MySQL, SQL Server, or Oracle experience.
  • SharePoint, Enterprise Search (ex. Coveo), and WordPress experience is a plus.
  • Knowledge of software development life cycle, agile development, software testing and debugging.
  • Excellent communication and technical skills.
  • Ability to produce secure, reliable, and extendable code.

job.title: Remote-BI Project Manager (W-2414) (32343)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client based out of Madison, WI is currently seeking a BI Project Manager for a 100% Remote Contract position.

NOTE:  W2 only!

  • 100% remote 9-5 EST or CST

Job Summary:

  • Drives BI team programs and projects required to ensure programs achieve their strategic objectives within scope, schedule, and budget and deliver business value.
  • Ensures that all assigned programs are utilizing an appropriate change control process.
  • Articulates the program status and outcomes appropriately to all stakeholders, including making presentations that could be presented for executive sponsors.
  • Develops and implements effective communication plans, designed to drive program discussions with stakeholders; handles escalations or further escalates so that issues do not impact scope, schedule, or budget.
  • Develops resource estimates and identifies subject-matter-expertise required to effectively staff program. Negotiates with resource managers on the availability of all needed resources.
  • Ensures that all required program artifacts (charter, change requests, etc.) are executed and stored correctly; ensures that all project teams and project managers comply with methodologies established; conducts periodic program audits to ensure compliance.
  • Ensures that program and project managers utilize industry-standard project, program, and change management best practices.
  • Ensures that the project and program managers are helping their teams to Identify all project risks and create plans to manage (accept, avoid, mitigate, transfer.) Coaches on risk management strategies as needed.
  • Responsible for forecasting and controlling the program budget (revenue and costs) to ensure the entire portfolio realizes the expected financial & business benefits (e.g., revenue, cost savings, etc.).
  • Ensures that requirements gathering sessions with key stakeholders and project teams occur as needed. Ensure that requirements between inter-related and/or non-related projects within the program are clearly articulated and approved to ensure the successful execution of the portfolio.
  • Understands Business Unit requirements and ensure that program time logging requirements are met.
  • Leads efforts in determining the optimal resourcing mix required to best achieve program operational and financial goals

Requirement:

  • 10+ years’ experience managing multiple, large-scale, complex, cross-functional projects/programs; accountable to executive stakeholders. These projects may include software product development, product/service implementation, or marketing that utilizes cutting-edge technology.
  • 6-9 years of management experience, experience managing diverse project portfolios preferred. Demonstrated ability to manage geographically dispersed project teams.
  • Excellent customer focus, dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers, acts with customers in mind, and establishes and maintains effective working relationships with customers.
  • Project Management: Proven knowledge of Project/Program Management principles/methodologies (e.g., waterfall and Agile) and the ability to coach and mentor less experienced program/project managers.
  • Proven process management skills: skilled at figuring out the processes necessary to get things done, knows how to organize people and activities, knows how to separate, and combine tasks into an efficient workflow. Can recommend enhancements and present findings to executive stakeholders.
  • Proven planning skills: can work with cross-functional project teams to accurately scope out length and difficulty of milestones, break work down into tasks, develop schedules for multiple, inter-connected and non-related projects and teams, anticipate and adjust for problems and roadblocks, measure performance against goals across the program, and evaluate results.
  • Communication: Embrace and lead change, excellent communication skills (verbal, written, and interpersonal) with team members, stakeholders, and customers—effective in a variety of informal and formal settings. Able to clearly articulate complex concepts.
  • Excellent decision-making skills—can make quality decisions in a timely manner.
  • Excellent conflict resolution skills.
  • Demonstrates ability to thrive in a fast-paced, self-managing, team-based, dynamic environment.
  • Technical Understanding: Research functional and technical knowledge and programs needed to support the program.

job.title: Hybrid Work-French Legal Invoice Analyst/Initial Reviewer (W-2101) (32154)
job.description:
Location: Hybrid Contract Position | Minneapolis, MN
NOTE: W2 Candidates Only!

Myticas's direct client, based in Minneapolis, MN, is seeking a Legal Invoice Analyst/Initial Reviewer for a hybrid contract position.

Position Overview:

The Legal Invoice Analyst I is responsible for the prompt, accurate, and efficient auditing of electronically submitted legal fee and expense invoices from law firms and vendors. The selected candidate will ensure compliance with billing guidelines by adjusting invoice line items that violate provisions and documenting justifications for those adjustments. The analyst will also provide guidance to business unit partners on issues or opportunities within the Legal Billing Audit process.

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Efficiently and accurately review legal invoice entries.
  • Receive legal invoice assignments from the Operations Support Specialist or self-assign tasks from the intake queue.
  • Verify compliance with legal billing guidelines for submitted invoices.
  • Ensure the accuracy of UTBMS task codes (Fee, Activity, and Expense codes) applied to invoice line items.
  • Document reasons for any adjustments made to invoice line items, specifying the violated billing guideline and rationale for the adjustment amount.
  • Forward audited legal invoices through the appropriate review chain as required.
  • Collaborate with Legal Invoice Analysts and Quality Assurance Analysts.
  • Exercise discretion and sound judgment when making audit and adjustment decisions.
  • Demonstrate a strong understanding of legal terminology and claims-related legal situations, with multijurisdictional exposure preferred.
  • Work independently with minimal supervision after training.
  • Utilize electronic legal bill submission and auditing software efficiently.
  • Organize work to ensure the prompt and efficient review of legal invoices within designated timeframes.
  • Apply basic business math skills and maintain appropriate business telephone etiquette.

Required Skills, Qualifications, and Experience:

Education:

  • Paralegal Certification or a Bachelor's Degree in a legal-related discipline, or equivalent work experience.

Experience:

  • 1-3 years of experience in a legal services or legal auditing environment.
  • Must speak, read and write French--for this opening.
  • Familiarity with legal billing processes.
  • Strong understanding of federal and/or state rules of civil procedure.

Technical Skills:

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
  • Experience with legal billing systems and processes.

Core Competencies:

  • Teamwork: Collaborate effectively with the Legal Billing Audit Center of Excellence (LBACOE) and other business units while providing constructive feedback.
  • Problem Solving: Think independently and make sound decisions. Identify necessary resources to aid in decision-making and take proactive steps to resolve problems.
  • Leadership: Demonstrate personal accountability for day-to-day tasks and collaborate with other business units to achieve results.
  • Planning and Organizing: Prioritize tasks to achieve short- and long-term goals within designated timeframes.
  • Technology: Partner with technology experts to identify gaps and develop impactful solutions.
  • Learning: Adapt to changes in the marketplace and workforce by acquiring or modifying knowledge through study, experience, or instruction.
  • Initiative: Exhibit self-direction and translate ideas into action to achieve results.

job.title: Hybrid Work- Executive Assistant (W-8207) (32324)
job.description:
Position: Executive Assistant

Location & Work Arrangement

  • Location: New York, NY 10005
  • Schedule: Hybrid (minimum 2 days onsite, typically Tuesdays and Thursdays)
  • Contract Type: Contract
  • Compensation: $27-28/hour
  • Employment Type: W2 only

Position Overview The Executive Assistant role provides high-level administrative support to senior executives, managing complex operational tasks and enhancing organizational efficiency. This position requires sophisticated schedule management, problem-solving capabilities, and the ability to handle confidential information while maintaining exceptional customer service in a professional environment.

Key Responsibilities

  • Provide comprehensive administrative support for 2-3 senior executives
  • Manage complex executive calendars and schedule internal and client meetings
  • Create and process purchase orders as needed
  • Coordinate domestic and international travel arrangements
  • Reconcile business travel expenses according to company policies
  • Prepare and edit professional correspondence, presentations, and reports
  • Maintain confidentiality with sensitive information
  • Coordinate special projects, townhall meetings, and organizational events
  • Support Administrative Services Team with departmental projects
  • Execute additional responsibilities as assigned by management

Required Qualifications

  • High school diploma or equivalent (Associate or Bachelor's degree preferred)
  • 5-8 years of administrative support experience, preferably in corporate settings
  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
  • Demonstrated experience in calendar management and meeting coordination
  • Strong organizational and time-management capabilities
  • Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy

Technical Skills

  • Microsoft Office Suite expertise
  • Experience with expense reporting systems (preferred)
  • Knowledge of travel booking platforms (preferred)
  • Proficiency in business communication tools

Professional Competencies

  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills
  • Proven ability to maintain confidentiality
  • Strong problem-solving and decision-making capabilities
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work both independently and collaboratively
  • Professional demeanor and customer service orientation
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks
  • Adaptability to changing schedules and requirements

Work Schedule Requirements

  • Minimum 2 days per week onsite (typically Tuesdays and Thursdays)
  • Flexibility to adjust onsite days based on executive schedules and office visitors
  • Ability to maintain consistent communication with executive team

Additional Information The successful candidate will demonstrate initiative, professionalism, and the ability to anticipate needs while maintaining discretion with confidential information. This role requires someone who can thrive in a dynamic environment while providing consistent, high-quality support to senior leadership.

This position offers an opportunity to work with senior executives in a professional corporate environment, providing crucial support that enables organizational success.

job.title: W2 ONLY Remote - AWS Data Engineer (32274)
job.description:
******NOT OPEN FOR C2C*****

Myticas's direct client based out of Phoenix, AZ, is currently seeking an AWS Data Engineer with strong PYTHON experience for a 100% remote contract position.

Job Description: 

We are looking for a versatile and experienced professional to fill the role of Data Engineer with a strong expertise in utilizing AWS tools and services. The ideal candidate will be adept at both data analysis and engineering, with a deep understanding of AWS technologies to drive data-driven insights and solutions.

Responsibilities:

  1. Data Exploration and Analysis: Leverage AWS tools such as Amazon Redshift, Amazon Athena, and Amazon Quicksight to extract, transform, and analyze data, providing actionable insights to support business decisions.
  2. Machine Learning and Predictive Analytics: Develop and deploy machine learning models using AWS SageMaker, utilizing algorithms to generate predictive and prescriptive insights from large datasets.
  3. Data Pipeline Development: Design, build, and maintain end-to-end data pipelines using AWS services like AWS Glue, ensuring efficient data movement and transformation from various sources to target destinations.
  4. Real-time Data Processing: Implement real-time data processing using AWS Kinesis, Lambda, and other relevant tools, enabling near-instantaneous data insights and actions.
  5. Big Data Technologies: Work with AWS EMR and related tools to process and analyze large-scale datasets using technologies like Apache Spark and Hadoop.
  6. Data Warehousing: Design and optimize data warehousing solutions using AWS Redshift, ensuring high-performance querying, and reporting capabilities.
  7. Data Quality and Governance: Implement data validation, cleansing, and quality checks using AWS services to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data.
  8. Dashboard Creation: Develop interactive and visually appealing dashboards using Amazon QuickSight or other relevant tools, enabling stakeholders to easily consume and interpret data.
  9. Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements, provide data-driven insights, and develop solutions that align with organizational goals.
  10. Cloud Cost Optimization: Monitor and optimize AWS resource utilization to manage costs effectively while maintaining high-performance data processing and analysis capabilities.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's or advanced degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • Strong proficiency in AWS services, including but not limited to Redshift, Athena, Glue, SageMaker, Kinesis, Lambda, EMR, and Quicksight.
  • Demonstrated experience in both data analysis and engineering, with a portfolio showcasing impactful data-driven projects.
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java for data manipulation, analysis, and model development and component deployment through Terraform.
  • Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, Scikit-learn) and their integration with AWS tools.
  • Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data modeling, and SQL proficiency.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
  • Excellent communication skills to translate technical insights into actionable business recommendations.

job.title: Process Specialist (32078)
job.description:
The Process Specialist is an integral member of the Lightspeed Program Delivery team, reporting directly to the Program Delivery Office Manager. This role involves analyzing and improving various activities within the Lightspeed Program, including contract handling, project execution, and delivery. The Process Specialist will develop and refine processes, identify inefficiencies, explore automation opportunities, create process maps, and monitor outcomes post-implementation. Feedback collected from these activities will be used for continuous improvement and training initiatives. This role requires collaboration with individuals at all organizational levels, from technical staff to executive management, to implement and enhance processes effectively.

Key Qualifications

The ideal candidate should demonstrate expertise in process mapping, data analysis, and project management. Strong problem-solving abilities, effective communication skills, attention to detail, and experience with organizational change management are essential. Familiarity with process management tools and knowledge of the telecom industry are also important. The candidate must be adept at working collaboratively with cross-functional teams to drive meaningful improvements.

Main Responsibilities

  • Analyze and evaluate existing processes, identifying opportunities for improvement.
  • Develop and implement efficient systems to enhance program execution and operations.
  • Apply process improvement methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma, and Kaizen across departments.
  • Collaborate with development teams to observe and analyze project-specific tasks and meet with stakeholders to recommend efficiency enhancements.
  • Guide on-site personnel during the implementation and adoption of new processes.
  • Continuously identify and prioritize areas for improvement, leading projects that utilize data and reporting to drive changes.
  • Work with team members to ensure a smooth transition and adoption of enhanced processes.
  • Create training materials and collaborate with the Training Coordinator to facilitate workshops, training sessions, and coaching to promote a culture of continuous improvement.

Education and Experience Requirements

  • Diploma or degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Science, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
  • At least 5 years of experience in project coordination, preferably within the telecom or engineering industry.
  • Proven experience in identifying and implementing process improvements.
  • Strong communication skills to engage effectively with teams and stakeholders and inspire positive change.
  • Ability to work well with diverse teams and adapt to different personalities.
  • Quick aptitude for learning new tools and techniques.
  • Solution-oriented mindset with the ability to handle ambiguity.
  • Professional demeanor, sound judgment, strong organizational skills, and critical thinking abilities.
  • Capacity to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Decision-Making and Supervision

This position supports the Lightspeed Program Delivery team through the Program Delivery Office. As a Process Specialist, you will make informed recommendations to the Lightspeed Program Delivery leadership. While this role does not include direct reports, you will interact with multi-disciplinary teams, including engineering, contracts, legal, and commercial teams.

job.title: Hybrid Work-Technical/Product Customer Service Representative (W-6741) (32295)
job.description:
Technical/Product Customer Service Representative
Location: Hagerstown, MD 21740 (Open for Hybrid Work, will need to come onsite weekly)
Contract Type: 12 Months Contract to Hire
Employment Type: W2 only
Pay Rate: $13-14/hr on W2

  • Respond to customer inquiries that include order entry, adjustments, subscriptions, and queries related to existing orders from multiple sources
  • Manage customer inquiries from onset to resolution using established procedures to solve routine problems
  • Manage database records to maintain customer accounts, ensuring accurate entry and upkeep of all transactions according to business policies

Other Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:

job.title: Remote, Python Developer (LLM/Chatbot) - A-28991 (32282)
job.description:

job.title: Local to Chicago -Automation Engineer with AI/Chatbot experience(A-28964) (32263)
job.description:
Job Title: Automation Engineer (AI/Chatbot)

Location: Waukegan, IL (Hybrid)

Myticas' direct client is seeking an experienced Automation Engineer (AI/Chatbot) for a hybrid, 6+ month contract position in Waukegan, IL.

Top Skills & Experience Requirements:

  • Education & Experience:
  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field with 5+ years of experience in delivering information technology projects, or
  • Master’s degree with 4+ years of experience.
  • Relevant Experience:
  • Proven experience as a Business Systems Analyst, Test Engineer, or in a similar role.
  • Track record of successfully delivering IT projects in a quality-focused capacity.
  • Strong ability to define test plans and procedures in alignment with departmental standards.
  • Experience with Agile methodologies in software development.
  • Technical & Soft Skills:
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
  • Ability to work on-site in Lake County, IL, on a regular basis.
  • Project management experience.
  • Preferred:
  • Knowledge and experience with AI systems or chatbots.

    Job Summary:

    One of our key strategic initiatives is to enhance the client enterprise's efficiency—helping our teams focus on addressing the unmet needs of patients. To support this mission, we are developing an advanced AI-powered chatbot, AVA (the Client Virtual Assistant).

    The primary focus of this role is to establish and enhance rigorous quality processes, including test strategies, automation, test execution, and real-world data monitoring. You will work closely with technical teams to build integrations and deliver enterprise knowledge and automation to client colleagues through AVA.

    Job Responsibilities:

    • Collaborate with designers, developers, and stakeholders to ensure the implemented technology aligns with business requirements and objectives identified by the product owner team.
    • Define and implement scalable testing strategies, incorporating test automation where applicable.
    • Utilize analytical thinking to diagnose system issues and propose solutions based on:
    • Business requirements,
    • User feedback,
    • Data insights, and
    • Cross-functional stakeholder input.
  • Develop and execute testing strategies, analyzing results to derive actionable insights. Work is performed with a high degree of independence and is evaluated based on outcomes.
  • Assess business processes and system needs, recommending improvements that optimize efficiency, particularly in relation to the AI-powered chatbot.
  • Participate actively in client and team meetings, contributing insights and recommendations. Provide leadership in quality assurance planning and testing.
  • Exercise independent judgment in problem-solving, with work reviewed for sound business decisions and alignment with project goals.

    This role requires a proactive and detail-oriented professional who can balance quality assurance, project coordination, and AI technology implementation to enhance the capabilities of AVA.

job.title: Hybrid Work-Senior Executive Assistant (W-7601) (32273)
job.description:
Executive Assistant
Location: New York, NY 10005 or Philadelphia, PA 19103-Hybrid 
Contract Type: Contract to Hire
Employment Type: W2 only

NOTE: 

  • This is Hybrid position at preferably NY location, but open to Philadelphia as well.
  • Expected to come onsite weekly. 
  • Manager would like candidates to be tested for MS Office proficiency (Word, Excel, PPT, etc). Manager is looking for high proficiency.
  • Potential temp-to-hire role.
Job Qualifications:
Education:
  • High School Degree required; College degree or higher education courses are a plus
Experience:
  • At least 5 years’ experience as an Executive Assistant to levels VP and above in a global corporation or other professional services organization working across multiple time zones
  • Experience in learning new technologies and managing large volumes of information, distribution lists
  • Experience with project support “best practices & disciplines”
  • Demonstrated experience requiring excellent planning, organizational and time management skills
  • High proficiency in Microsoft Office suite including Outlook, Teams, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Essential Competencies/skills:
  • Strong multitasker with demonstrated success working in high stress environments for multiple executive leaders
  • Adapt and modifies established processes and practices to anticipate recurring operational or administrative issues and problems, enabling others to resolve issues independently and collaborating across the organization for immediate support.
  • Excellent organizational, judgment, planning and problem-solving skills, including a proactive approach to working in a matrixed environment with key stakeholders, partners, and clients.
  • Proactively learns and trains others to use workplace/ office technology tied to core responsibilities and Executives
  • Completes operational or administrative work without clear guidelines based on prior experience.
  • Excellent attention to detail, working to consistently deliver to a high standard
  • Good business discretion and awareness with sensitivity to handling highly confidential information
  • A professional and proactive approach, with the ability to prioritize and adapt to changing demands; ability to work within tight deadlines and deliver on time
  • Strong client service focus in dealing with both external and internal clients, displaying an image of professionalism, discretion, and integrity
  • Strong communication skills (verbal and written) with an ability to follow instructions from multiple leaders with different management styles to promote good relations.
  • Solid relationship-building skills to develop networks both within our highly matrixed global company and externally.

Job Description:

This role provides executive administrative support to several senior Executives within the leadership team of the Health Division.  Responsible for advanced administrative and project management support requiring excellent judgment, time management, and discretion.
Requires extensive knowledge of organization operations, procedures and personnel working within company guidelines and strong working knowledge of Microsoft office suite and enterprise systems.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Manages calendar and email requests to ensure timely attention and responses with appropriate urgency based on an understanding of priorities. Professionally responds to requests for meetings, as appropriate, using discretion and judgment, processes requests, takes messages, and delegates to appropriate party in a timely and effective manner to maintain a high level of productivity and confidentiality.
  • Manages all logistics and prepares agendas for internal and external meetings, partnering with staff and vendors for onsite meetings for smooth end-to-end execution.  Obtains quality and timely briefing materials as needed, including research and intelligence; demonstrates knowledge of underlying issues and objectives, as applicable. Ensures that Executives receive all materials prior to meetings to facilitate efficient review and use of Division Executives’ time. Manages schedule to allow for sufficient time to read, analyze, and respond to short and long-term strategic work.  May also include research and analysis related to meeting preparation.
  • Assists in special projects and supports coordination of PowerPoint presentations for strategy/market segments and mergers and acquisitions and other leader presentations including internal communications, Monthly Division and annual Strategy meetings and other corporate meetings and events
  • Supports other Executive direct reports in their initiatives, as needed and requested including attendance at regular team meetings and helping with adherence to deadlines; helps to on-board new employees, as required.
  • Manages all travel arrangements and ground logistics for the Division Executives with a focus on balancing travel dates with the need for cost-efficient and seamless travel within appropriate corporate guidelines.
  • Prepares and processes employee recognition awards, monthly expense reports, and regular time off tracking for Division Executives and reviews and supports related administration tied to direct reports
  • Manages all outside vendor set up, billing, codes for payment, and ensures proper systems processing and adherence to budget.
  • Maintains paper and electronic files for Division Executives; complies with records retention policies and organizes files such that records can be retrieved efficiently.
  • Provides back up support for the Executive Assistant to the CEO of the Health Division including assistance with on-site meetings, as well as mutual coverage for each other during peak times or vacations.

job.title: Project Manager - Azure Dev Ops (31831)
job.description:
Project/Program Manager with Cybersecurity Experience
Clearance Required: Secret Level Government Clearance

Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Project/Program Manager with a strong background in cybersecurity to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing and managing complex projects and programs within the cybersecurity domain, ensuring they are completed on time, within scope, and budget. This role requires a Secret level government clearance and offers an opportunity to work on critical national security initiatives.

Key Responsibilities:

  1. Project/Program Management:
    • Lead and manage multiple cybersecurity projects and programs simultaneously.
    • Develop project plans, including timelines, milestones, and deliverables.
    • Monitor and report on project progress, addressing any issues or risks promptly.
    • Coordinate with stakeholders, including government clients, to ensure project requirements are met.
  2. Cybersecurity Expertise:
    • Apply advanced knowledge of cybersecurity principles and practices to project management.
    • Ensure projects align with cybersecurity policies, standards, and regulations.
    • Provide guidance on cybersecurity risk management and mitigation strategies.
  3. Team Leadership:
    • Lead and mentor a team of cybersecurity professionals, ensuring effective collaboration and performance.
    • Foster a positive and productive work environment, promoting continuous learning and development.
  4. Stakeholder Communication:
    • Serve as the primary point of contact for project stakeholders, including government clients.
    • Prepare and present project status reports, proposals, and other documentation as required.
    • Facilitate effective communication and collaboration among all project stakeholders.
  5. Compliance and Documentation:
    • Ensure all projects comply with relevant cybersecurity and government regulations.
    • Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including plans, reports, and compliance records.

Qualifications:

  • Education: Bachelor's degree in Cybersecurity, Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.
  • Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in project/program management within the cybersecurity domain.
  • Certification: PMP, Prince2, or equivalent certifications are highly desirable.
  • Security Clearance: Active Secret level government clearance required.
  • Skills:
    • Strong understanding of cybersecurity principles, practices, and frameworks.
    • Proven experience in managing complex projects and programs.
    • Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
    • Ability to work effectively with government clients and stakeholders.
    • Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.

job.title: Automation Network Architect (31956)
job.description:
HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE AND WHAT YOU WILL LEARN

The selected candidate will develop and deliver service offerings for the IP Fabric and domain controller within the Data Center Fabric solution.

  • Lead architecture discussions and requirements-gathering workshops with customers.
  • Document, present, and deliver relevant design collateral, such as high-level designs (HLD), low-level designs (LLD), and test plans.
  • Provide guidance on validated design best practices and architecture.
  • Engage in the staging and network integration phases of customer projects.
  • Consult with network deployment and integration teams on design questions and architectural guidelines.
  • Work with Product Line Management, pre-sales, and support teams to gather feedback and meet customer expectations.

These responsibilities will be carried out specifically in customer contexts, involving direct participation in defining and executing customer projects.

KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

This role requires cross-domain knowledge, with a familiarity in Data Center networking and Cloud concepts expected.

  • 8+ years of work experience in the IP Routing domain.
  • Strong working-level knowledge of IP Networking and Routing protocols (OSPF, ISIS, BGP), QoS, L2 and L3 VPNs, EVPN, NAT, etc.
  • Familiarity with Data Center Design principles.
  • Knowledge of Cloud Computing concepts and platforms such as Kubernetes, OpenShift, AWS, and GCP.
  • Experience in consulting and delivering professional services directly to external customers.
  • Hands-on network integration and problem-solving skills.

Additional Skills Considered Valuable:

  • Experience with Network Management & API concepts and protocols, such as NETCONF, YANG, REST, and gNMI.
  • 3rd-party router expertise, including Cisco/Juniper product lines.
  • Knowledge of public cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP.

job.title: Project Manager - Windows Server Upgrade (31996)
job.description:
We are looking for an experienced Project Manager with a strong background in data center management, Microsoft technologies, and large-scale logistical planning to lead a Windows Server upgrade across 400+ servers. The ideal candidate will have exceptional organizational management skills, with the ability to coordinate and communicate acr

We are looking for an experienced Project Manager with a strong background in data center management, Microsoft technologies, and large-scale logistical planning to lead a Windows Server upgrade across 400+ servers. The ideal candidate will have exceptional organizational management skills, with the ability to coordinate and communicate across multiple teams, manage timelines effectively, and oversee the project from planning through completion.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Project Planning and Coordination:

    • Develop, document, and execute a comprehensive project plan for upgrading Windows servers across multiple locations.
    • Coordinate with internal teams, including IT, data center operations, and vendor partners, to establish project goals and timelines.

  • Schedule and Logistics Management:

    • Create detailed schedules to ensure minimal disruption to business operations.
    • Oversee logistics, including resource allocation, server access, and hardware/software compatibility.
    • Track progress, mitigate risks, and adjust schedules to meet changing project requirements.

  • Data Center and Microsoft Server Expertise:

    • Apply in-depth knowledge of data center best practices to ensure efficient and secure deployment of the Windows server upgrade.
    • Oversee software installations, configurations, and upgrades in compliance with Microsoft standards and organizational requirements.
    • Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to Windows Server infrastructure.

  • Stakeholder Communication and Reporting:

    • Regularly update stakeholders on project milestones, potential risks, and remediation steps.
    • Prepare and present status reports to management and relevant teams.

Qualifications:

  • Proven experience managing large-scale IT projects, ideally involving Windows Server upgrades or similar infrastructure projects.
  • Strong background in data center operations and Microsoft server environments.
  • Excellent organizational, time management, and logistics coordination skills.
  • Ability to work collaboratively across teams and manage complex schedules.
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Certifications in Project Management (PMP or PRINCE2) and/or Microsoft technologies.
  • Experience with cloud or hybrid server environments is a plus.

job.title: Network Engineer - EK (32071)
job.description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Network Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will manage, troubleshoot, and optimize our network infrastructure, which includes Nokia routers (7750, 7250, 7705), Cisco ASR903 routers, and Cisco switches. This role involves working with advanced networking protocols, supporting Layer 2 and Layer 3 VPN services, and ensuring network security and reliability.

Key Responsibilities

Network Operations and Maintenance:

  • Monitor, configure, and troubleshoot Nokia routers (7750, 7250, 7705), Cisco ASR903 routers, and Cisco switches.
  • Manage and optimize routing protocols, including OSPF and BGP, to ensure optimal network performance.
  • Oversee Layer 2 and Layer 3 VPN services to ensure high availability and reliability.

Level 2 Support:

  • Provide Level 2 support to troubleshoot and resolve complex network issues.
  • Serve as an escalation point for advanced technical problems.

Radio Access Network (RAN) Support:

  • Support and troubleshoot radio access network (RAN) nodes, including 3G, LTE, and 5G technologies.
  • Collaborate with RAN teams to ensure seamless network performance and integration.

Network Security:

  • Implement and maintain authentication mechanisms using TACACS+ and RADIUS.
  • Ensure compliance with organizational security policies and standards.

Microwave Technology Management:

  • Operate and maintain Nokia Wavence equipment and manage microwave link setups.
  • Diagnose and resolve issues in microwave technologies, ensuring seamless integration into the overall network.

Network Management Tools:

  • Operate and maintain the Nokia NSP platform for efficient network service provisioning and management.
  • Use network monitoring tools to proactively identify and resolve network issues.

Maintenance and On-Call Support:

  • Participate in on-call rotations and scheduled maintenance windows to support network upgrades and resolve outages.
  • Execute changes during maintenance windows following industry best practices and organizational policies.

Required Qualifications

Education:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Telecommunications, or a related field.

Experience:

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in network operations, with hands-on exposure to Nokia and Cisco devices.
  • Strong expertise in routing protocols (OSPF, BGP) and VPN services (L2VPN, L3VPN).
  • Proficiency in Nokia Wavence and microwave technology.

Skills:

  • Advanced troubleshooting and diagnostic skills for Nokia and Cisco equipment.
  • Knowledge of Nokia NSP for network provisioning and management.
  • Strong understanding of network security principles and tools, including TACACS+ and RADIUS.

Certifications (Preferred):

  • Nokia NRS II or equivalent certification.
  • Cisco certifications such as CCNP or CCIE.

job.title: Part-Time Translator for Somali (T-5585) (32257)
job.description:
Part-Time Somali Interpreter (100% Remote – Contract)

We are seeking a Part-Time Somali Interpreter to facilitate effective communication between individuals who do not share the same language. The interpreter will provide language support for various settings, including employment, training, orientation, meetings, human resources, health services, and other operational activities as assigned. This role requires strict adherence to confidentiality.

  • Certification in interpreting or translation is a plus

Experience & Skills:

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in both English and Somali

Key Competencies:
