job.title: Local to Chicago - Application Support Analyst (A-28862) (32229)
job.description:
Job Title: Application Support Analyst

Location: North Chicago, IL – hybrid role

Myticas direct client is seeking an experienced Application Support Analyst for a hybrid 6+ months contract position at North Chicago, IL.

Top 3-5 skills requirements should this person have:

  1. Must have Lead experience and managing projects.
  2. Experience with SLAs and putting together timelines for projects.
  3. Service NOW - Ticketing and putting together dashboards and read dashboards.
  4. Good communication skills.
  5. Strong Analytical and Problem-solving Skills.

Nice to have (but not required):

  • Pharma or Regulatory application experience.
  • ITIL methodology- Service Management (ITIL is nice to have).

Job Description:

The Service Analyst is accountable for confirming that the appropriate production processes and quality metrics are executed for Client’s Applications that are scored with low risk and complexity.

The role will also provide support and prioritization for the execution of Application Maintenance and Support tasks and some critical production services.

Responsibilities:

List up to 10 main responsibilities for the job. Include information about the accountability and scope.

  • Offer oversight for some critical production services including: Incident, Problem, Service Transition and Disaster Recovery and seek assistance for other critical services such as: Audit, Validation and Compliance.
  • Participate P1- P2 MIM pidge and on call rotation and confirms business impact.
  • Provides support for audit requests for the ACOE.
  • Reviews the Disaster Recovery plan and schedule to ensure that the service providers exercise test drills and execute the plan as designed.
  • Participates with supplier personnel regarding short-term architecture strategy development and provides recommendation as it relates to Application performance or continuous improvement.
  • Performs post installation analysis including lessons learned and provides recommendations for continuous improvement implementations as needed.
  • Provides inputs to the technical reports and documentation that confirm the Root Cause Analysis for Incidents and Problems.
  • Contributes to the development of new or the refinement of existing critical Service Operations and/or Service Transition processes.
  • Assists providers in coordinating with 3rd party hosting or Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) providers on recovery capabilities.
  • Accountable for ensuring that the Service Transition process is fully executed by the provider and provides feedback into the existing Change, Release and Deployment management processes.
  • Reviews the Service Providers application and technical documentation such as Request for Change, operating procedures and technical and non-technical specifications and provides feedback and approval as appropriate.
  • Evaluates the Service Providers reported trends and the process improvement recommendations to help identify areas where preventative maintenance might be performed to improve Applications efficiency, in terms of both the performance of the Applications and any related maintenance and support efforts.
  • Responsible for reviewing the service provider Service Level Agreements on a regular basis and providing oversight for any action plans that are required to address performance issues.
  • Performs daily reviews of ticket activity: queue levels, processing efficiency, backlogs, aging levels along with prior day Incidents to ensure that ticket processing and the problem Management engines are performing within expected operating parameters.
  • Serves as primary client’s contact point and first level of escalation for Incidents and Problems.
  • Assists with the prioritization and escalation of system recovery issues with Cross-functional, Build and Infrastructure teams.
  • Assists MSPs in ensuring that all the user access to IT systems are properly controlled and authenticated and segregation of duties are maintained.
  • Will coordinate an annual access certification process ensuring that current users still require access to applications under their responsibility.
  • Seeks assistance from senior personnel in performing the initial business risk assessment for Maintenance and Support and Minor Enhancement activities.
  • Partakes in vendor performance meetings and operational reviews.
  • Supports vendor initiated continuous improvement performance plans.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or Computer Engineering.
  • Minimum of 2-4 years of combined experience in Information Technology.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of (could be a platform or a vertical such as Oracle, or Life Sciences Pharmaceutical Research and Development or Financial application technologies, etc.).
  • Ability to prioritize and multi-task.
  • Strong problem resolution skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to work within cross-functional teams towards task completion.

job.title: Local to TX-Evidence Support Specialist (W-0716) (32225)
job.description:
Evidence Support Specialist
Location: Austin, TX 78701 (On-site)
Contract Type: Contract
Employment Type: W2 Only

Job Description:

This role consists of approximately 80% evidence support and 20% fulfillment, which includes customer service, administrative tasks, and data entry. Candidates with experience in these areas will be well-suited for this position.

Key Responsibilities:

Evidence Support:

  • Prepare and distribute evidence for multiple jurisdictions, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
  • Coordinate with relevant departments and jurisdictions to ensure proper evidence handling.
  • Verify that all evidence documentation is accurate and complete.
  • Identify and address any discrepancies or issues in the evidence-handling process.
  • Maintain confidentiality and integrity of sensitive evidence and related records.

Fulfillment Associate (Floater):

  • Process filings and document orders with state government agencies.
  • Work closely with internal and external customers to provide excellent service and prompt responses to inquiries.
  • Assist in administrative and clerical tasks to support overall team efficiency.
  • Actively participate in team meetings, offering suggestions to improve productivity and workflow.

Required Skills & Experience:

  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • At least one year of experience in administrative support, customer service, processing, or production.
  • Strong ability to interact with all levels of the organization.
  • Self-motivated with the ability to work independently while contributing to a team.
  • Proficiency in various computer software applications and spreadsheets.
  • Professionalism, with strong communication skills including poise, tact, and diplomacy.
  • Excellent attention to detail in composing, proofing, and processing materials, as well as meeting deadlines.
  • Ability to read and comprehend instructions, correspondence, and memos.
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced, evolving environment.
  • Willingness to work overtime when necessary.

This position requires a detail-oriented and organized individual with strong multitasking abilities and a commitment to maintaining the highest level of accuracy and confidentiality.

job.title: Local to Chicago - Sr Operations Lead (Infrastructure & Facilities) (A-28794) (32221)
job.description:
Job Title: Sr Operations Lead (Infrastructure & Facilities)

Location: North Chicago, IL – Hybrid role

Myticas direct client is seeking an experienced Sr Operations Lead (Infrastructure & Facilities) for a hybrid 12+ months contract position at North Chicago, IL.

Top 5 skills/experience:

  1. Deep experience with facility solutions that require personal data compliance.
  2. Experience troubleshooting and working with device communications protocols like BACnet.
  3. Strong technical background with focus on complex desktop clients and Operating Technology systems (building automation and control, fire systems, calipation).
  4. Strong written & verbal communications skills and a bias towards good institutional knowledge.
  5. Cooperation and stakeholder relationship management – works directly with business unit clients to understand specific business processes business drivers and business strategies across multiple business units; identifies and communicates resulting needs and opportunities for business process improvement that can be enabled via technology.

Job Summary:

This position will be responsible for supporting facility/building technologies including traditional information technology applications, operations technology, instruments, and client-server applications.

  • It will require hands-on work with applications, infrastructure, and networking, as well as support of GxP processes.
  • It requires a strong knowledge of communications protocols, and the corresponding network security considerations.
  • The role will be responsible also for creating strong institutional knowledge and work process documentation so that new team members can onboard successfully.
  • Project-wise, there are several required installations and upgrades of applications in our facility technology space, and this role will give the person a chance to lead and execute.
  • They will be expected to own small/medium projects end to end and follow our system lifecycle.

Experience/education and/or certifications required:

  • At least 5 years of experience serving as a technical lead or project management on complex projects.
  • At least 5 years of experience writing and following system life cycle documentation and knowledge base solutions.
  • Business analysis and some project management experience preferred.
  • Initiative and self-starter that is motivated to do great work.
